title: Tax Cuts and Jobs Act
sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to reduce tax rates and modify policies, credits, and deductions for individuals and businesses.

title: Jerusalem Embassy and Recognition Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI]]
texts: This bill states that it should be U.S. policy to recognize Jerusalem as the undivided capital of Israel.

title: Increasing the Department of Veterans Affairs Accountability to Veterans Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], None, Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO]]
texts: This bill requires the reduction of the federal annuities of individuals removed from the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Senior Executive Service (SES) if they are convicted of a felony that was related to their performance while employed in such position.

title: No Windfalls for Government Service Act
sponsers: [Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to establish a $1 million lifetime limitation on the nonrecognition of a taxpayer's gains from the sale of property pursuant to a certificate of divesture to comply with conflict-of-interest requirements for certain federal government positions.

title: No Budget, No Pay Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA]]
texts: This bill prohibits the payment of any pay to any Member of Congress (excluding the Vice President): (1) if both houses of Congress have not approved a concurrent resolution on the budget for a fiscal year before October 1 of that fiscal year and have not passed all the regular appropriations bills for the next fiscal year by such date, or (2) until both houses of Congress approve such a budget resolution and pass all such appropriations bills. Retroactive pay is prohibited for such a period.

title: Iran Ballistic Missile Sanctions Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill amends the Iran-Iraq Arms Non-Proliferation Act of 1992 to cover ballistic missile or related technology.

title: Federal Reserve Transparency Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: This bill directs the Government Accountability Office (GAO) to complete, within 12 months, an audit of the Federal Reserve Board and Federal Reserve banks.

title: GAO Access and Oversight Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL]]
texts: This bill authorizes the Government Accountability Office (GAO) to obtain federal agency records required to discharge the GAO's duties (including audit, evaluation, and investigative duties), including through bringing civil actions to require an agency to produce a record.

title: Fair Tax Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], None, Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS]]
texts: This bill is a tax reform proposal that imposes a national sales tax on the use or consumption in the United States of taxable property or services in lieu of the current income and corporate income tax, employment and self-employment taxes, and estate and gift taxes. The rate of the sales tax will be 23% in 2019, with adjustments to the rate in subsequent years. There are exemptions from the tax for used and intangible property, for property or services purchased for business, export, or investment purposes, and for state government functions.

title: MOBILE NOW Act
sponsers: [Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill requires the National Telecommunications and Information Administration (NTIA) and the Federal Communications Commission (FCC), by December 31, 2020, to make available at least 255 megahertz of federal and nonfederal spectrum below the frequency of 6000 megahertz for mobile and fixed wireless broadband use. At least: (1) 100 megahertz shall be made available on an unlicensed basis; and (2) 100 megahertz shall be made available on an exclusive, licensed basis for commercial mobile use subject to potential continued use by incumbent federal entities in designated geographic areas.

title: NA
sponsers: [Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to deny a publicly held corporation a tax deduction for the payment of performance-based remuneration in excess of $1 million to any of its current or former officers or directors if such corporation does not meet the pay fairness requirement established by this bill. The pay fairness requirement is satisfied if: (1) the average compensation paid by the employer for all applicable U.S. employees for the taxable year exceeds the inflation and productivity growth adjusted average of such compensation for the preceding taxable year; and (2) the aggregate compensation paid by the employer to or for all applicable employees for the taxable year is not less than the aggregate of such compensation for the preceding taxable year.

title: Regulations from the Executive in Need of Scrutiny Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA]]
texts: This bill revises provisions relating to congressional review of agency rulemaking. A federal agency promulgating a rule must publish information about the rule in the Federal Register and include in its report to Congress and to the Government Accountability Office: (1) a classification of the rule as a major or nonmajor rule, and (2) a copy of the cost-benefit analysis of the rule that includes an analysis of any jobs added or lost.

title: Nevada Land Sovereignty Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill prohibits any extension or establishment of national monuments in Nevada except by express authorization of Congress.

title: Biological Implant Tracking and Veteran Safety Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to:

title: A bill to expand eligibility for hospital care and medical services under section 101 of the Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014 to include veterans who are age 75 or older, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA]]
texts: The final program report shall include the number of such veterans who are receiving care or services under the program.

title: Right Start Child Care and Education Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) increase the rates and maximum allowable amount of the tax credit for employer-provided child care facilities; (2) increase the eligibility threshold amount and rate of the household and dependent care tax credit and make such credit refundable; (3) allow a new $2,000 annual tax credit for three years for child care providers who hold a bachelor's degree in early childhood education, child care, or a related degree and who provide at least 1,200 hours of child care services in a taxable year; and (4) increase the tax exclusion for employer-provided dependent care assistance.

title: Presidential Tax Transparency Act
sponsers: [Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], None, Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR]]
texts: This bill amends the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 to require the President and certain candidates for President to disclose federal income tax returns for the three most recent taxable years in reports filed with either the Office of Government Ethics (OGE) or the Federal Election Commission (FEC), in the case of a candidate.

title: A bill to establish an independent commission to examine and report on the facts regarding the extent of Russian official and unofficial cyber operations and other attempts to interfere in the 2016 United States national election, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA]]
texts: The commission must: (1) report on evidence developed by federal agencies; (2) build upon investigations of executive branch, congressional, or independent entities; and (3) make a full accounting of interference attempts and the U.S. response, and government preparedness, to defend against such interference.

title: Health Savings Account Expansion Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to modify the requirements for health savings accounts (HSAs) to:

title: Fair RETIRE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], None, Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: This bill expresses the sense of Congress with respect to the retention and reappointment of law enforcement officers, customs and border protection officers, firefighters, air traffic controllers, nuclear materials couriers, members of the Capitol and Supreme Court police, Central Intelligence Agency employees or diplomatic security agents of the Department of State (covered positions) who suffer an injury or illness while serving. In developing regulations to carry out this bill, the Office of Personnel Management and the Department of Labor should ensure, to the greatest extent possible, that the reappointment of an individual to a position in the civil service that is not a covered position is with the same federal agency, in the same geographic location, and at a level of pay commensurate to the position which the individual held immediately prior to such injury or illness.

title: Extending Justice for Sex Crime Victims Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], None, Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to revise the statute of limitations for a victim of a human trafficking offense or federal sexual offense to file a civil action to recover damages.

title: West Coast Ocean Protection Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], None, Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA]]
texts: This bill amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to prohibit the Bureau of Ocean Energy Management from issuing a lease for the exploration, development, or production of oil or natural gas in any area of the outer Continental Shelf off the coast of California, Oregon, or Washington.

title: California Desert Protection and Recreation Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA]]
texts: Specified federal land shall be taken into trust for the Lone Pine Paiute-Shoshone Tribe.

title: Improved National Monument Designation Process Act
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], None, Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: Before a national monument can be designated on public land, the President must obtain congressional approval, certify compliance with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (NEPA), and receive notice from the governor of the state in which the monument is to be located that the state legislature has enacted legislation approving its designation.

title: Midnight Rules Relief Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL]]
texts: This bill amends the Congressional Review Act to allow Congress to consider a joint resolution to disapprove multiple regulations that federal agencies have submitted for congressional review within the last 60 legislative days of a session of Congress during the final year of a President's term. Congress may disapprove a group of such regulations together (i.e., "en bloc") instead of the current procedure of considering only one regulation at a time.

title: Black Hills National Cemetery Boundary Expansion Act
sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], None, Sen. Thune, John [R-SD]]
texts: This bill transfers jurisdiction over certain public land from the Department of the Interior to the Department of Veterans Affairs for inclusion in the Black Hills National Cemetery.

title: Keep Our Communities Safe Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA]]
texts: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to revise requirements for the detention and removal of aliens ordered removed.

title: Sarah's Law
sponsers: [Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], None, Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA]]
texts: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to require the detention of an alien: (1) who was not inspected and admitted into the United States, who held a revoked nonimmigrant visa (or other nonimmigrant admission document), or who is deportable for failing to maintain nonimmigrant status; and (2) who has been charged in the United States with a crime that resulted in the death or serious bodily injury of another person.

title: Economic Mobility for Productive Livelihoods and Expanding Opportunity Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to require every employer to pay to each of his or her eligible Puerto Rican employees who in any workweek are engaged in commerce and who receive qualified wage subsidy payments minimum wages of $5.00 an hour, determined without regard to those wage subsidy payments.

title: S. 39, Little Shell Tribe of Chippewa Indians Restoration Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: This bill extends federal recognition to the Little Shell Tribe of Chippewa Indians of Montana. The tribe and its members become eligible for services and benefits provided by the United States to federally recognized tribes and their members, without regard to the existence of a reservation or the location of the residence of any member.

title: Middle Class Health Benefits Tax Repeal Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to repeal, beginning with taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017, the excise tax on employer-sponsored health care coverage for which there is an excess benefit (high-cost plans).

title: Medicare Prescription Drug Price Negotiation Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to require the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) to negotiate with pharmaceutical companies regarding prices for drugs covered under the Medicare prescription drug benefit. Current law prohibits CMS from doing so.

title: Inspiring the Next Space Pioneers, Innovators, Researchers, and Explorers (INSPIRE) Women Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: This bill directs the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) to encourage women and girls to study science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM), pursue careers in aerospace, and further advance the nation's space science and exploration efforts through support of the following initiatives:

title: Native American Health Savings Improvement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to specify that receiving hospital care or medical services under a medical care program of the Indian Health Service or a tribal organization does not disqualify an individual from being eligible for a health savings account.

title: End Pay Discrimination Through Information Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to prohibit an employer from discriminating against an employee who inquires about, discusses, or discloses the wages of the employee or another employee. This protection does not apply to an employee who has access to wage information as part of the employee's essential job functions, unless the disclosure is in response to a sex discrimination complaint or charge, or in furtherance of a sex discrimination investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer.

title: Kate's Law
sponsers: [Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID]]
texts: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to increase from two years to five years the maximum prison term for an alien who re-enters after being excluded, denied admission, deported, or removed.

title: Strengthening Medicare Intensive Cardiac Rehabilitation Programs Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to revise requirements related the approval of intensive cardiac rehabilitation programs by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) for purposes of Medicare coverage.

title: Protect Family Farms and Businesses Act
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS]]
texts: This bill prohibits proposed Internal Revenue Service regulations published on August 4, 2016, relating to restrictions on liquidation of an interest with respect to estate, gift, and generation-skipping transfer taxes from taking effect. The bill prohibits funds from being used to finalize, implement, administer, or enforce the proposed regulations or any substantially similar regulations.

title: Hearing Aid Assistance Tax Credit Act
sponsers: [Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a tax credit of up to $500 once every five years for the purchase of a hearing aid that is authorized under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act for commercial distribution and is intended for use by the taxpayer or a dependent of the taxpayer.

title: Alaska Oil and Gas Production Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: This bill authorizes the exploration, leasing, development, production, and transportation of oil and gas to and from the Coastal Plain of Alaska.

title: Mobile Mammography Promotion Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to exempt from the motor fuel excise tax fuel used in any highway vehicle designed exclusively to provide mobile mammography services.

title: Taking Action Against Drunk Drivers Act
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Shelby, Richard C. [R-AL], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA]]
texts: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to require the mandatory detention of an alien who: (1) was not lawfully admitted into the United States, held a revoked nonimmigrant visa, or violated his or her nonimmigrant status; and (2) has a pending federal or state charge of driving under the influence or driving while intoxicated, regardless of whether the offense is classified as a felony or a misdemeanor.

title: A bill to make aliens associated with a criminal gang inadmissible, deportable, and ineligible for various forms of relief.
sponsers: [Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], None, Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: An alien who is or was a member of a criminal gang, or who participated in gang activity knowing that such participation will promote the gang's illegal activity, shall be inadmissible and deportable.

title: Tsunami Warning, Education, and Research Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: This bill revises and reauthorizes through FY2021 the Tsunami Warning and Education Act.

title: Protect American Families Act
sponsers: [Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], None, Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ]]
texts: This bill prohibits: (1) the Department of Homeland Security, the Department of Justice, or any other federal department from creating or implementing a law enforcement or national security program that requires or causes people to register or check in on the basis of religion, race, age, gender, ethnicity, national origin, nationality, or citizenship; and (2) federal funds from being used to create or implement an immigration registry or check-in program.

title: S. 55, Fort Ontario Study Act
sponsers: [Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of the Interior to conduct a special resource study of Fort Ontario in Oswego, New York.

title: RED Tape Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], None, Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK]]
texts: This bill prohibits a federal agency from issuing a rule that causes a new financial or administrative burden on businesses or people in the United States unless the agency has repealed or amended two or more existing rules causing such a burden and the cost of the rule to be issued is less than or equal to that of the rules repealed or amended. The bill exempts a rule that: (1) relates to the internal policy or practice of, or procurement by, the agency; or (2) is being revised to be less burdensome by decreasing requirements imposed by, or compliance costs of, the rule.

title: A bill to require the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to revoke bonuses paid to employees involved in electronic wait list manipulations, and for other purposes
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], None, Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA]]
texts: If an adverse finding is made, the VA, after providing notice and an opportunity for a hearing, shall direct the employee to repay any bonus received during the year in which the adverse finding is made, unless such finding is found to have been made in error.

title: Middle Class Health Benefits Tax Repeal Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to repeal, beginning with taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017, the excise tax on employer-sponsored health care coverage for which there is an excess benefit (high-cost plans).

title: Hearing Protection Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) eliminate the $200 transfer tax on firearm silencers, and (2) treat any person who acquires or possesses a firearm silencer as meeting any registration or licensing requirements of the National Firearms Act with respect to such silencer. Any person who pays a transfer tax on a silencer after January 9, 2017, may receive a refund of such tax.

title: A bill to designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 719 Church Street in Nashville, Tennessee, as the "Fred D. Thompson Federal Building and United States Courthouse".
sponsers: [None, Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN]]
texts: NA

title: A bill to remove the sunset provision of section 203 of Public Law 105-384 and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], None, Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA]]
texts: (Sec.1)This bill makes permanent the authority of Washington, Oregon, and California to adopt and enforce state laws governing fishing and processing in the exclusive economic zone adjacent to their state in any Dungeness crab fishery for which there is no fishery management plan in effect under the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act.

title: January 8th National Memorial Act
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of the Interior to establish the January 8th National Memorial in Tucson, Arizona, as an affiliated area of the National Park System in commemoration of the shooting of Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords and 18 others in Tuscon on January 8, 2011.

title: Tribal Labor Sovereignty Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], None, Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS]]
texts: This bill amends the National Labor Relations Act (NLRA) to exclude Native American tribes and tribal enterprises and institutions on tribal land from requirements for employers under the NLRA. (Currently under the NLRA, employers may not engage in unfair labor practices and must allow employees to form unions, engage in collective bargaining, and take collective action.)

title: Safe and Affordable Drugs from Canada Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (FFDCA) to require the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to promulgate regulations within 180 days permitting individuals to import a prescription drug purchased from an approved Canadian pharmacy that:

title: Presidential Conflicts of Interest Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA]]
texts: This bill requires the President and Vice President to submit to Congress and the Office of Government Ethics a disclosure of financial interests.

title: Retired Pay Restoration Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR]]
texts: This bill allows the receipt of both military retired pay and veterans' disability compensation with respect to any service-connected disability (under current law, such a disability must be rated as not less than 50% disabling).

title: IRGC Terrorist Designation Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC]]
texts: This bill expresses the sense of Congress that Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) meets the criteria for designation as a foreign terrorist organization and should be so designated by the Department of State.

title: Muslim Brotherhood Terrorist Designation Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI]]
texts: This bill requires the Department of State to report to specified congressional committees within 60 days indicating: (1) whether the Muslim Brotherhood meets the criteria for designation as a foreign terrorist organization; and (2) if not, which criteria have not been met.

title: Regulatory Responsibility for our Economy Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], None, Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS]]
texts: This bill sets forth general requirements for the federal regulatory system, including the protection of public health, welfare, safety, and the environment, the promotion of predictability in the regulatory process, and the consideration of benefits and costs of regulations.

title: A bill to designate the mountain at the Devils Tower National Monument, Wyoming, as Devils Tower, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [None, Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY]]
texts: NA

title: Emergency Citrus Disease Response Act
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a full deduction in the current taxable year of the cost of replanting lost or damaged citrus plants. The taxpayer must own an equity interest of at least 50% in such replanted plants and may deduct costs paid or incurred through the date that is ten years after the enactment of this bill.

title: Counterterror Alert Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill requires the Department of Justice (DOJ) to include in the national instant criminal background check system (i.e., the NICS database) information about an individual who is or has been under a federal terrorism investigation.

title: Housing Accountability Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the United States Housing Act of 1937 to require an entity receiving low-income housing assistance payments for existing public housing units to maintain decent, safe, and sanitary conditions for any structure covered under a payment contract.

title: Marine Oil Spill Prevention Act
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI]]
texts: This bill address issues related to preventing and responding to oil spills.

title: Arla Harrell Act
sponsers: [Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill requires the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to reconsider and make a new determination regarding each claim for disability compensation in connection with exposure to mustard gas or lewisite during active military, naval, or air service during World War II that was denied before this bill's enactment. The VA or the Department of Defense (DOD): (1) shall presume that a veteran experienced full-body exposure to mustard gas or lewisite unless proven otherwise; and (2) may not use information contained in the DOD and VA Chemical Biological Warfare Database or any list of known testing sites for mustard gas or lewisite maintained by the VA or DOD as the sole reason for determining that the veteran did not experience such exposure.

title: CORE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to require at least 5% of the new markets tax credit limitation to be allocated to community development entities in connection with certain investments, financial counseling, and other services in distressed coal communities.

title: Stop Paying U.S. in Peanuts Act
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ]]
texts: This bill amends the Agricultural Act of 2014 to repeal the rules for peanuts under the nonrecourse marketing assistance loan program administered by the Department of Agriculture (USDA). (Under a nonrecourse marketing assistance loan, a farmer pledges a commodity as collateral and may deliver the pledged collateral to USDA to repay the loan.)

title: Modernizing Government Travel Act
sponsers: [Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill requires the General Services Administration (GSA) to prescribe regulations to provide for the reimbursement of federal employees traveling on official business for the use of a transportation network company (e.g., Uber or Lyft) or innovative mobility technology. The Administrative Office of the United States Courts shall prescribe such regulations with respect to judicial branch employees.

title: Securing Energy Infrastructure Act
sponsers: [Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID]]
texts: This bill establishes a two-year pilot program within the Department of Energy's (DOE)national laboratories to identify thesecurity vulnerabilities of certain entities in the energy sector, and research and test technology that can be used to isolate the most critical systems of such entities from cyber-attacks.

title: A bill to protect the right of individuals to bear arms at water resources development projects.
sponsers: [Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], None, Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID]]
texts: NA

title: Seniors Fraud Prevention Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME]]
texts: This bill directs the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to establish an office within the Bureau of Consumer Protection to advise the FTC on the prevention of fraud targeting seniors and to assist the FTC in monitoring the market for mail, television, Internet, telemarketing, and recorded message telephone call (robocall) fraud targeting seniors.

title: Stop Subsidizing Multimillion Dollar Corporate Bonuses Act
sponsers: [Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], None, Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to the $1 million limitation on the deductibility of employee compensation, to: (1) extend such limitation to any individual who is a current or former officer, director, or employee of a publicly-held corporation; (2) eliminate the exemption from such limitation for compensation payable on a commission basis or upon the attainment of a performance goal; and (3) make such limitation applicable to all publicly-held corporations that are required by the Securities and Exchange Commission to register securities and provide periodic reports to their investors.

title: Promoting Women in Entrepreneurship Act
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill amends the Science and Engineering Equal Opportunities Act to authorize the National Science Foundation to encourage its entrepreneurial programs to recruit and support women to extend their focus beyond the laboratory and into the commercial world.

title: A bill to provide for an exception to a limitation against appointment of persons as Secretary of Defense within seven years of relief from active duty as a regular commissioned officer of the Armed Forces.
sponsers: [Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ]]
texts: (Sec. 1) This bill allows the first person, and only such person, appointed as Secretary of Defense after the enactment of this bill to be a person who is, on the date of appointment, not within at least three years after relief from active duty as a commissioned officer of a regular component of the Armed Forces. (Under current law, an individual may not be appointed as Secretary of Defense within seven years after relief from such active duty.)

title: Restoring Access to Medication Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], None, Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS]]
texts: This bill repeals provisions of the Internal Revenue Code, as added by the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, that limit payments for medications from health savings accounts, medical savings accounts, and health flexible spending arrangements to only prescription drugs or insulin (thus allowing distributions from such accounts for over-the-counter drugs).

title: Veterans Choice Continuation Act
sponsers: [Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC]]
texts: This bill amends the Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014 to eliminate the August 7, 2017, termination date for the Veterans Choice Program, which allows the program to operate until all of the money in the Veterans Choice Fund is expended.

title: Stop Dangerous Sanctuary Cities Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], None, Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA]]
texts: This bill prohibits a sanctuary jurisdiction from receiving grants under certain Economic Development Assistance Programs and the Community Development Block Grant Program. A sanctuary jurisdiction is a state or political subdivision that has a statute, policy, or practice in effect that prohibits or restricts: (1) information sharing about an individual's immigration status, or (2) compliance with a lawfully issued detainer request or notification of release request.

title: DIGIT Act
sponsers: [Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], None, Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE]]
texts: This bill requires the Department of Commerce to convene a working group of federal stakeholders to provide recommendations and a report to Congress regarding the growing number of connected and interconnected devices known as the Internet of Things (IoT). The bill establishes a steering committee to be composed of stakeholders outside the federal government to advise the working group.

title: A bill to amend title 46, United States Code, to exempt old vessels that only operate within inland waterways from the fire-retardant materials requirement if the owners of such vessels make annual structural alterations to at least 10 percent of the areas of the vessels that are not constructed of fire-retardant materials and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA]]
texts: Vessels in operation before January 1, 1968, that operate within inland waterways are exempted from the new requirements until December 1, 2028. Exempt vessel operators must follow certain requirements including notifying prospective passengers in writing prior to the sale of any ticket for boarding and making annual structural alterations to at least 10% of areas of the vessel that are not constructed of fire-retardant materials.

title: Red River Gradient Boundary Survey Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX]]
texts: This bill directs the Bureau of Land Management (BLM) to commission a survey to identify the South Bank boundary line with respect to land along a specified 116-mile stretch of the Red River in Oklahoma and Texas (the affected area).

title: S. 91, Indian Employment, Training and Related Services Consolidation Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: This bill amends the Indian Employment, Training and Related Services Demonstration Act of 1992 to revise the program that provides for the integration of employment, training, and related services programs for Indian tribes. The Act is renamed the Indian Employment, Training and Related Services Act of 1992.

title: Safe and Affordable Drugs from Canada Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], None, Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (FFDCA) to require the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to promulgate regulations within 185 days permitting individuals to import a prescription drug purchased from an approved Canadian pharmacy that:

title: Allowing Greater Access to Safe and Effective Contraception Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], None, Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA]]
texts: This bill requires the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to prioritize review of supplemental drug applications (applications to modify the approved use of a drug) for contraceptive drugs intended for routine use that would be available to individuals aged 18 and older without a prescription. The FDA must waive user fees for such supplemental drug applications. Any drug that is eligible for this priority review must be a prescription drug for individuals under age 18.

title: Russian Cyber Intrusions Sanctions Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], None, Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD]]
texts: This bill directs the President to impose U.S. entry and property blocking sanctions against: (1) a person that engages in significant activities for the government of the Russian Federation that undermine U.S. or allied cyber security, or (2) a foreign person responsible for serious human rights abuses in any territory occupied or controlled by Russia.

title: Nuclear Waste Informed Consent Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV]]
texts: This bill prohibits the Department of Energy (DOE) from making an expenditure from the Nuclear Waste Fund for the costs incurred by DOE in connection with disposing of spent nuclear fuel or high-level radioactive waste in a repository, unless DOE has entered into an agreement to host the repository with certain affected entities.

title: Improving Rural Call Quality and Reliability Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], None, Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: This bill amends the Communications Act of 1934 to require intermediate providers that offer the capability to transmit voice communications and signaling information from one destination to another, and that charge a rate to any other entity (including an affiliated entity) for such a transmission, to: (1) register with the Federal Communications Commission (FCC), and (2) comply with service quality standards to be established by the FCC.

title: Nuclear Energy Innovation Capabilities Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], None, Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID]]
texts: By December 31, 2017, DOE shall determine the mission need for a versatile reactor-based fast neutron source, which shall operate as a national user facility.

title: Balanced Budget Accountability Act
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA]]
texts: This bill requires the Office of Management and Budget (OMB), upon adoption by a chamber of Congress of a concurrent budget resolution for a fiscal year, to determine and submit to the Speaker of the House of Representatives or the President pro tempore of the Senate a certification as to whether that chamber has adopted a balanced budget.

title: S. 99, James K. Polk Presidential Home Study Act
sponsers: [Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of the Interior to conduct a special resource study of the James K. Polk Home and adjacent property in Columbia, Tennessee.

title: Shiloh National Military Park Boundary Adjustment and Parker's Crossroads Battlefield Designation Act
sponsers: [Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN]]
texts: This bill modifies the boundary of Shiloh National Military Park to include the following areas : (1) Fallen Timbers Battlefield, (2) Russell House Battlefield, and (3) Davis Bridge Battlefield. The Department of the Interior may acquire lands by donation, purchase from willing sellers, or exchange.

title: King Cove Road Land Exchange Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: This bill declares that, if the state of Alaska offers to convey to the Department of the Interior 43,093 acres of state-owned land, Interior shall convey to Alaska, in exchange, 206 acres of federal land within the Izembek National Wildlife Refuge and 131 acres of federal land within the Izembek Wilderness, for purposes of: (1) designating a road corridor through the refuge, and (2) constructing a single-lane gravel road along the road corridor.

title: S. 102, Securing Access to Networks in Disasters Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], None, Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA]]
texts: This bill requires the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to publish a study on the public safety benefits, technical feasibility, and cost of providing the public with emergency access to 9-1-1 services, when mobile service is unavailable during certain presidentially declared emergencies or major disasters or during gubernatorially declared emergencies, through:

title: Local Zoning Decisions Protection Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], None, Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT]]
texts: This bill nullifies:

title: Trafficking Survivors Relief Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to establish a process to vacate convictions and expunge arrests for criminal offenses committed by trafficking victims that directly result from or relate to having been a trafficking victim.

title: ObamaCare Repeal Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY]]
texts: This bill repeals the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act and the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010 and restores provisions of law amended by those Acts, effective January 1, 2018.

title: Safeguard Israel Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. texts: This bill prohibits the U.S. government from making any voluntary or assessed contributions to the United Nations (U.N.) or any U.N. organization until the President certifies to Congress that Security Council Resolution 2334 has been repealed.

title: Medical Device Access and Innovation Protection Act
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Smith, Tina  [D-MN]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to repeal the excise tax on the sale of a medical device by the manufacturer, producer, or importer.

title: Pharmacy and Medically Underserved Areas Enhancement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], None, Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to provide for Medicare coverage and payment with respect to certain pharmacist services that: (1) are furnished by a pharmacist in a health-professional shortage area, and (2) would otherwise be covered under Medicare if furnished by a physician.

title: Digital Coast Act
sponsers: [Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], None, Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI]]
texts: This bill requires the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) to establish a constituent-driven Digital Coast program. (This program currently exists under NOAA to provide data, tools, and training that communities use to manage their coastal resources.) The program must: (1) provide an online resource that integrates geospatial data, decision-support tools, training, and best practices to address coastal management issues and needs, and to enhance resilient communities, ecosystem values, and coastal economic growth and development; and (2) provide for the documentation, dissemination, and archiving of the data.

title: Filipino Veterans Promise Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Defense to establish a process for determining whether individuals who served in the organized military forces of the Government of the Commonwealth of the Philippines or in the Philippine Scouts while in the service of the U.S. Armed Forces during World War II and who are not included in the Missouri List are eligible for certain benefits relating to their U.S. service.

title: Creating a Reliable Environment for Veterans' Dependents Act
sponsers: [Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill provides that the services for which a recipient of a grant under the Department of Veterans Affairs comprehensive service program for homeless veterans may receive per diem payments may include furnishing care for a dependent under the care of a veteran who is receiving services.

title: Maximizing Efficiency and Improving Access to Providers at the Department of Veterans Affairs Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to carry out an 18-month pilot program to increase the use of medical scribes to maximize the efficiency of physicians at VA medical facilities. A "medical scribe" is defined as a member of the medical team hired and trained to perform documentation in an electronic health record to maximize the productivity of a physician.

title: VA Choice and Quality Employment Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME]]
texts: This bill requires the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to submit an annual report to specified congressional committees on the performance awards and bonuses presented to Regional Office Directors of the VA, Directors of Medical Centers of the VA, and Directors of Veterans Integrated Service Networks.

title: Veterans Transplant Coverage Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill authorizes the Department of Veterans Affairs to provide for an operation on a live donor to carry out a transplant procedure for an eligible veteran, notwithstanding that the live donor may not be eligible for VA health care.

title: A bill to amend title 10, United States Code, to permit veterans who have a service-connected, permanent disability rated as total to travel on military aircraft in the same manner and to the same extent as retired members of the Armed Forces entitled to such travel.
sponsers: [Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: In establishing space-available transportation priorities under the travel program, DOD shall provide transportation on the same basis as such transportation is provided to members of the Armed Forces entitled to retired or retainer pay.

title: Alex Diekmann Peak Designation Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: This bill designates the 9,765-foot peak located 2.2 miles west-northwest of Finger Mountain on the western boundary of the Lee Metcalf Wilderness in Montana as "Alex Diekmann Peak."

title: Reinforcing American-Made Products Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME]]
texts: This bill amends the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994 to require the Federal Trade Commission's regulation of the labeling of products as "Made in the U.S.A." or "Made in America" to supersede any state laws regarding the extent to which a product is introduced, delivered, sold, advertised, or offered for sale in interstate or foreign commerce with such a label in order to represent that the product was in whole or substantial part of domestic origin.

title: Sunshine for Regulatory Decrees and Settlements Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], None, Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: This bill establishes public notice and comment procedures and motion to intervene standards for civil actions seeking to compel agency action and alleging that an agency is unlawfully withholding or unreasonably delaying an agency action, and for consent decrees or settlement agreements that require agency action, relating to a regulatory action that would affect the rights of: (1) private persons other than the person bringing the action; or (2) a state, local, or tribal government.

title: Bring Our Heroes Home Act
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill: (1) requires the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) to establish the Missing Armed Forces Personnel Records Collection; and (2) establishes the Missing Armed Forces Personnel Records Review Board, which shall require all missing Armed Forces personnel records to be transmitted to NARA and disclosed to the public in the collection.

title: Veterans Small Business Ownership Improvements Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill amends the Small Business Act to establish the Boots to Business Program under which the Small Business Administration (SBA) shall provide entrepreneurship training to:

title: Mortgage Debt Tax Relief Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to extend through 2018 the exclusion from gross income of income attributable to the discharge of indebtedness on a principal residence.

title: NA
sponsers: [Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], None, Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: This bill amends the Communications Act of 1934 to prohibit businesses from manufacturing or importing for use in the United States, or selling or leasing in the United States, a multi-line telephone system unless it can be installed to: (1) allow 9-1-1 calls to be transmitted to the appropriate public safety answering point without requiring the user to dial any additional digit, code, prefix, or post-fix (including any trunk-access code such as the digit "9"), regardless of what a user is required to dial for other calls; and (2) provide on-site notifications (if possible without any improvement to the system) so that when a person at the facility where the system is installed initiates a 9-1-1 call, the system notifies a central location at the facility or a person or organization with responsibility for safety or security for the location.

title: Preserve Access to Affordable Generics Act
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Trade Commission Act to authorize the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to initiate proceedings against parties to any agreement resolving or settling a patent infringement claim in connection with the sale of a drug. Such an agreement, with specified exceptions, is presumed to have anticompetitive effects and is a violation of this bill if the filer of the abbreviated new drug (generic) application receives anything of value and agrees to limit or forego research, development, manufacturing, marketing, or sales of the generic drug.

title: Foreign Spill Protection Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], None, Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: This bill amends the Oil Pollution Act of 1990 to make foreign facilities that are located offshore and outside the exclusive economic zone (EEZ) liable for removal costs and damages that result from oil spills that reach (or threaten to reach) U.S. navigable waters, adjoining shorelines, or the EEZ. Specifically, the following parties may be held liable: (1) the owners or operators of the foreign facilities, including facilities located in, on, or under any land within foreign countries; and (2) the holders of a right of use and easement granted under applicable foreign law for the area in which the facility is located.

title: Repeal ID Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: This bill repeals provisions of the REAL ID Act of 2005 that prohibit federal agencies from accepting state-issued driver's licenses or identification cards that do meet minimum specified security requirements.

title: SAFE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ]]
texts: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide that the Department of Homeland Security (DHS): (1) shall grant a three-year provisional protected presence to a qualifying alien, (2) may not remove the alien from the United States unless such protected presence is rescinded, and (3) shall provide such alien with employment authorization.

title: BRIDGE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], None, Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC]]
texts: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide that the Department of Homeland Security (DHS): (1) shall grant a three-year provisional protected presence to a qualifying alien, (2) may not remove the alien from the United States unless such protected presence is rescinded, and (3) shall provide such alien with employment authorization.

title: National Sea Grant College Program Amendments Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], None, Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the National Sea Grant College Program Act to reauthorize through FY2022 the National Sea Grant College Program.

title: DAIRY PRIDE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI]]
texts: NA

title: Alaska Mental Health Trust Land Exchange Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK]]
texts: Before completing each phase of the land exchange, USDA shall complete any necessary land surveys and required pre-exchange clearances, mitigation activities, and approvals related to:

title: National Monument Designation Transparency and Accountability Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK]]
texts: This bill requires the President, before a national monument can be designated on public land, to obtain congressional approval, certify compliance with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969, and determine that the state in which the monument is to be located has enacted legislation approving its designation.

title: S. 133, Intelligence Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC]]
texts: This bill authorizes FY2017 appropriations for the conduct of intelligence and intelligence-related activities of:

title: Spoofing Prevention Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], None, Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the Communications Act of 1934 to expand the prohibition against knowingly transmitting misleading or inaccurate caller identification information to apply to: (1) persons outside the United States if the recipient of the call is within the United States, and (2) text messages.

title: Ocmulgee Mounds National Historical Park Boundary Revision Act
sponsers: [Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA]]
texts: The boundary of the park is adjusted to include approximately 2,100 acres.

title: Kennesaw Mountain National Battlefield Park Boundary Adjustment Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA]]
texts: The Department of the Interior may acquire land or interests, by donation or exchange, from willing sellers only.

title: Fort Frederica National Monument Boundary Expansion Act
sponsers: [Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA]]
texts: This bill expands the boundary of the Fort Frederica National Monument on St. Simons Island, Georgia, and increases the maximum number of acres that may be included in the monument from 250 to 305 acres.

title: Preventing Destabilization of Iraq and Syria Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA]]
texts: This bill directs the President to impose U.S.-based property blocking and entry sanctions against any foreign person that: (1) is responsible for or complicit in actions that threaten the peace, security, or stability of Iraq or Syria, actions or policies that undermine economic reconstruction and political reform in Iraq, or the obstruction of the delivery or distribution of, or access to, humanitarian assistance to the people of Iraq or Syria; (2) has materially assisted or provided financial, material, or technological support for any such activity; or (3) is owned or controlled by, or has acted on behalf of, a foreign person that has carried out any such activity.

title: An Act to amend the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 to improve foreign intelligence collection and the safeguards, accountability, and oversight of acquisitions of foreign intelligence, to extend title VII of such Act, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], None, Rep. Amash, Justin [R-MI-3], None, Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], None, Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], None, Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen.
