Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], ...]
texts: This bill amends the DNA Identification Act of 1994 to require the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) to issue standards and procedures for using Rapid DNA instruments to analyze DNA samples of criminal offenders.

title: S. 140, a bill to amend the White Mountain Apache Tribe Water Rights Quantification Act of 2010 to clarify the use of amounts in the WMAT Settlement Fund
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], None]
texts: (Sec. 1) This bill amends the White Mountain Apache Tribe Water Rights Quantification Act of 2010 to specify that settlement funds may be used for the planning, design, and construction of the tribe's rural water system.

title: S. 141, Space Weather Research and Forecasting Act
sponsers: [Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], None, Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI]]
texts: This bill directs the Office of Science and Technology Policy (OSTP) to:

title: Community Economic Assistance Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide for the establishment of community economic assistance zones that are eligible for certain tax deductions and credits.

title: Military Spouse Job Continuity Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], None, Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow the spouse of a member of the Armed Forces (military spouse) who moves with such member to another state under a permanent change of station order a tax credit for up to $500 of qualified relicensing costs incurred by such spouse. The bill defines "qualified relicensing costs" as costs for a state license or certification to engage in the profession that such military spouse engaged in while residing in the former state.

title: Promise Zone Job Creation Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to direct the Departments of Housing and Urban Development and Agriculture, acting jointly, to designate, before January 1, 2019, not more than 40 areas as Promise Zones for purposes of priority consideration in federal grant programs and initiatives. Twelve of such areas shall be outside of a metropolitan statistical area or shall be determined to be rural areas.

title: National Strategic and Critical Minerals Production Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID]]
texts: This bill addresses the mine permitting process.

title: Border Security Technology Accountability Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO]]
texts: This bill amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to require the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to: (1) ensure that each border security technology acquisition program that is determined to be a major acquisition program has an acquisition program baseline approved by the relevant acquisition decision authority; (2) document that each such program is meeting the cost, schedule, and performance thresholds specified in such baseline in compliance with relevant departmental acquisition policies and the Federal Acquisition Regulation; and (3) have a plan for each such program to meet program implementation objectives by managing contractor performance.

title: Obamacare Taxpayer Bailout Prevention Act
sponsers: [Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], None, Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill repeals the provision of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act that directs the Department of Health and Human Services to establish a program of risk corridors for 2014, 2015, and 2016 under which qualified health plans must participate in a payment adjustment system based on the ratio of a plan's allowable costs to its premiums. (Qualified health plans are sold on health insurance exchanges, are the only plans eligible for premium subsidies, and fulfill an individual's requirement to maintain minimum essential coverage.)

title: Educational Opportunities Act
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individual taxpayers a tax credit for charitable contributions to a scholarship granting organization. The bill allows a maximum credit amount of $4,500 ($2,250 for a married individual filing a separate return). A "scholarship granting organization" is a tax-exempt entity whose exclusive purpose is to provide scholarships for the tuition and other education expenses of elementary and secondary school students from low income households (i.e., household income not exceeding 250% of federal poverty guidelines).

title: Terrorism Survivors Student Loan Deferment Act
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill amends title IV (Student Assistance) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to allow a borrower who is a victim of a terrorist attack to defer (i.e., suspend repayments on) student loans made under the Federal Family Education Loan, Federal Direct Loan, and Federal Perkins Loan programs.

title: Preventing Crimes Against Veterans Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to declare that any person who knowingly engages in any scheme or artifice to defraud an individual of veterans' benefits, or in connection with obtaining veteran's benefits for that individual, shall be fined, imprisoned not more than five years, or both.

title: Terror Intelligence Improvement Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill requires each federal department or agency to provide to the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) information about a person who is or has been under a federal terrorism investigation.

title: VA Accountability First and Appeals Modernization Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: NA

title: Ensuring the Reliability of Our Hurricane Hunter Aircraft Act
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill directs the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to maintain secondary backup capability for each class of hurricane reconnaissance, research, surveillance, and response aircraft sufficient to prevent a single point of failure.

title: Small Business Relief From Disease Induced Economic Hardship Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the Small Business Act to expand the definition of a "disaster" for which the Small Business Administration may provide disaster loans to small business concerns to include communicable diseases for which the federal government issues a travel alert or travel warning.

title: RAISE Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the National Labor Relations Act to allow an employer to pay an employee higher wages, pay, or other compensation than provided for in a collective bargaining agreement.

title: A bill to require the Secretary of the Treasury to implement security measures in the electronic tax return filing process to prevent tax refund fraud from being perpetrated with electronic identity theft.
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: NA

title: Seniors' Tax Simplification Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT]]
texts: This bill directs the Internal Revenue Service to make available to taxpayers who have turned age 65 at the close of the taxable year a new federal income tax Form 1040SR (similar to the existing Form 1040EZ). Such taxpayers can use this new form even if their income includes: (1) Social Security benefits; (2) distributions from qualified retirement plans, annuities, or other such deferred payment arrangements; (3) interest and dividends; or (4) capital gains and losses.

title: Let Seniors Work Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT]]
texts: This bill amends title II (Old Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) of the Social Security Act to: (1) eliminate the federal payroll tax with respect to the earnings of an individual who has attained retirement age, and (2) remove limitations on the amount of outside income that an OASDI beneficiary may earn without incurring a reduction in benefits.

title: Firearms Manufacturers and Dealers Protection Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill prohibits the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, the Department of Justice, or any other federal agency from using funds to carry out Operation Choke Point or any other program designed to discourage financial institutions from providing credit to, or processing payments for, dealers and manufacturers of firearms and ammunition.

title: HUD Inspection Process and Enforcement Reform Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill allows the Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) to remove certain HUD employees from civil service or to reduce their grade or pay for misconduct or performance. HUD employees may challenge a removal or reduction in grade or pay by filing an appeal with the Merit Systems Protection Board.

title: Hurricane Forecast Improvement Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill requires the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) to maintain a project to improve hurricane forecasting. The project's goal is to develop and extend accurate hurricane forecasts and warnings in order to reduce loss of life, injury, and damage to the economy, with a focus on: (1) improving the prediction of rapid intensification and track of hurricanes, (2) improving the forecast and communication of storm surges from hurricanes, and (3) incorporating risk communication research to create more effective watch and warning products.

title: Second Amendment Enforcement Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill declares that a Washington, DC statute that prohibits the killing of wild birds and wild animals in DC does not authorize the DC Council, Mayor, or any DC governmental or regulatory authority to prohibit or unduly burden the ability of persons otherwise not prohibited from possessing firearms under federal law from acquiring or using for lawful purposes any firearm neither prohibited by federal law nor subject to the National Firearms Act. DC is denied authority to enact laws or regulations that discourage or eliminate the private ownership or use of firearms for legitimate purposes.

title: Presidential Innovation Fellows Program Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ]]
texts: This bill establishes in the General Services Administration (GSA) the Presidential Innovation Fellows Program to enable exceptional individuals with proven track records to serve time-limited appointments in executive agencies as Presidential Innovation Fellows to address some of the most significant challenges facing the United States and improve federal efforts that would particularly benefit from expertise using innovative techniques and technology. The functions of the Presidential Innovation Fellows Program established pursuant to Executive Order 13704, as in existence on the day before enactment of this bill, shall be functions of the program established by this bill.

title: A bill to direct the Secretary of the Interior to reissue the final rules relating to the listing of the gray wolf in the Western Great Lakes and the State of Wyoming under the Endangered Species Act of 1973.
sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], None, Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI]]
texts: NA

title: Caregiver Program Information Dissemination Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD]]
texts: This bill requires pre-separation counseling for members of the Armed Forces to include a description of Department of Veterans Affairs family caregiver assistance and support services, including information about covered veterans, eligible caregivers, and program assistance and support.

title: Muhammad Ali Commemorative Coin Act
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH]]
texts: This bill requires the Department of the Treasury to mint and issue commemorative coins that emblemize the life and legacy of Muhammad Ali.

title: S. 167, National Memorial to Fallen Educators Act
sponsers: [Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], None, Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS]]
texts: This bill designates as the "National Memorial to Fallen Educators" an existing memorial located at the National Teachers Hall of Fame in Emporia, Kansas. The memorial is not a unit of the National Park System, and its designation shall not require or allow federal funds to be expended for any purpose related to it.

title: S. 168, Commercial Vessel Incidental Discharge Act
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Shelby, Richard C. [R-AL], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], None, Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS]]
texts: This bill requires the U.S. Coast Guard to: (1) address the regulation of discharges incidental to the normal operation of a commercial vessel into navigable waters, including ballast water discharges; and (2) preempt applicable state laws and federal regulations issued under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (commonly known as the Clean Water Act). Ballast water is water and suspended matter taken on board a commercial vessel to control or maintain trim, draught, stability, or stresses of the commercial vessel.

title: Countering Anti-Semitism and Anti-Israel Activities at the United Nations Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK]]
texts: This bill requires the President to direct the U.S. Permanent Representative to the United Nations (U.N.) to use U.S. influence at the U.N. to work toward reducing anti-Semitism in the U.N., including among its employees and its specialized agencies, programs, and funds.

title: Combating BDS Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID]]
texts: This bill allows a state or local government to adopt and enforce measures to divest its assets from, prohibit investment of its assets in, or restrict contracting with: (1) an entity that engages in a commerce- or investment-related boycott, divestment, or sanctions activity targeting Israel; or (2) an entity that owns or controls, is owned or controlled by, or is under common ownership or control with such an entity. Such measures are not preempted by federal law. A state or local government that seeks to adopt or enforce such measures shall comply with specified requirements related to notice, timing, and opportunity for comment.

title: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Commissioned Officer Corps Amendments and Hydrographic Services Improvement Act Reauthorization and Amendments Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], None, Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK]]
texts: This bill revises the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Commissioned Officer Corps Act of 2002.The bill sets forth new requirements under that Act concerning obligated service requirements, training and physical fitness, education loan assistance, recruitment, hiring and promotions, and other workforce issues.

title: A bill to require the President to withdraw from the Trans-Pacific Partnership Agreement and to make that Agreement ineligible for expedited consideration by Congress.
sponsers: [Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI]]
texts: The bill amends the Bipartisan Congressional Trade Priorities and Accountability Act of 2015 to declare that congressional trade authorities procedures (fast track) shall not apply to an implementing bill submitted with respect to a trade agreement with the Trans-Pacific Partnership countries.

title: A bill to require the United States Postal Service to designate a single, unique ZIP code for particular communities.
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: NA

title: S. 174, Federal Communications Commission Consolidated Reporting Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI]]
texts: This bill amends the Communications Act of 1934 to replace various reporting requirements with a communications marketplace report that the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) is required to publish on its website and submit to Congress every two years assessing: (1) competition in the communications marketplace; (2) deployment of communications capabilities, including advanced telecommunications capabilities; and (3) whether laws, regulations, regulatory practices, or demonstrated marketplace practices pose a barrier to competitive entry or expansion of existing providers of communications services.

title: Miners Protection Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA]]
texts: This bill amends the Surface Mining Control and Reclamation Act of 1977 (SMCRA) to transfer certain funds to the Multiemployer Health Benefit Plan and the 1974 United Mine Workers of America (UMWA) Pension Plan to provide health and pension benefits to retired coal miners and their families.

title: HELP for Coal Miners Health Care Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: This bill amends the Surface Mining Control and Reclamation Act of 1977 (SMCRA) to transfer certain funds to the Multiemployer Health Benefit Plan to provide health benefits to retired coal miners and their families.

title: Global Trade Accountability Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], None, Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT]]
texts: This bill amends the Trade Act of 1974 to define "unilateral trade action" to mean any of the following actions taken with respect to the importation of an article pursuant to specified trade laws:

title: S. 178, Elder Abuse Prevention and Prosecution Act
sponsers: [Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV], None, Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], None, Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: This bill establishes requirements for the Department of Justice, the Federal Trade Commission, and the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) with respect to preventing, investigating, and prosecuting elder abuse crimes and enforcing elder abuse laws.

title: Accountability Through Electronic Verification Act
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Shelby, Richard C. [R-AL], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA]]
texts: This bill amends the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996 to make the E-Verify program permanent.

title: NA
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT]]
texts: This bill amends the the Immigration and Nationality Act to revise employer and government requirements regarding visas for nonimmigrant aliens rated H-1B (specialty occupation) and L-1 (intracompany transfer to the United States from abroad).

title: A bill to ensure that certain Federal public works and infrastructure projects use materials produced in the United States, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: No funds or credit assistance made available under any such program for which a domestic content preference requirement does not apply may be used for a project commencing after the GAO issues such report for the construction, alteration, maintenance, repair, rehabilitation, conversion, or extension of infrastructure or the acquisition of related equipment and vehicles unless all of the iron, steel, manufactured goods, and commodity construction materials used in the project are produced in the United States. Such prohibition shall not apply if the agency involved finds that:

title: Court-Appointed Guardian Accountability and Senior Protection Act
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV]]
texts: This bill amends title XX (Block Grants to States for Social Services and Elder Justice) of the Social Security Act to direct the Department of Health and Human Services to award grants to the highest courts of states to conduct demonstration programs that: (1) assess adult guardianship and conservatorship proceedings, including the appointment and the monitoring of the performance of court-appointed guardians and conservators; and (2) implement changes deemed necessary as a result of the assessments, such as requiring background checks for all potential guardians and conservators, and establishing systems that enable electronic filing and review of the annual accountings and other required conservatorship and guardianship filings.

title: Short on Competition Act
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to require the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to authorize importation of life-saving drugs for which there is, or is likely to be, a shortage. For a drug to be imported, the drug's manufacturer must intend to seek FDA approval of the drug as a generic drug. The FDA may deny importation of a drug for reasons related to safety or effectiveness.

title: No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion and Abortion Insurance Full Disclosure Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Shelby, Richard C. [R-AL], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL]]
texts: This bill makes permanent the prohibition on the use of federal funds, including funds in the budget of the District of Columbia, for abortion or health coverage that includes abortion. The prohibitions in this bill, and current prohibitions, do not apply to abortions in cases of rape or incest, or where a physical condition endangers a woman's life unless an abortion is performed.

title: Head Start Improvement Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX]]
texts: This bill amends the Head Start Act to replace the existing Head Start program with block grants to states and Indian tribes for prekindergarten (pre-K) education.

title: Fair RATES Act
sponsers: [Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Power Act to permit a party to seek a rehearing and subsequent judicial review of any rate change filed by a public utility that takes effect without the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) issuing an order making such change effective. (Public utilities must give FERC and the public a 60-day notice before a proposed rate change can take effect.)

title: A bill for the relief of Alemseghed Mussie Tesfamical.
sponsers: [Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY]]
texts: NA

title: S. 188, EGO Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill prohibits the use of funds appropriated or otherwise made available to the federal government to pay for an official portrait of an officer or employee of the federal government, including the President, the Vice President, a Member of Congress, the head of an executive agency, or the head of an office of the legislative branch.

title: Fort Scott National Historic Site Boundary Modification Act
sponsers: [Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS]]
texts: This bill allows the Department of the Interior to acquire by purchase from willing sellers with donated or appropriated funds, by donation (as under current law), or by exchange the lands and interests in land, together with buildings and improvements, known as Fort Scott in the city of Fort Scott in Bourbon County, Kansas, and the land to be added to the Fort Scott National Historic Site as a result of the modification of the site's boundary according to this bill.

title: Power And Security Systems (PASS) Act
sponsers: [Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA]]
texts: This bill amends the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to require the Department of Energy to issue a rule by July 1, 2021, that determines whether energy conservation standards for external power supplies should be amended. The rule must contain any amended standards and apply to products manufactured on or after July 1, 2023.

title: Patient Freedom Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD]]
texts: This bill provides states with three options regarding title I (provisions on health insurance reform, exchanges, and subsidies) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA): (1) continue implementing PPACA, with a limit on total premium and cost sharing subsidies provided in the state; (2) waive the requirements of title I of PPACA, with specified exceptions; or (3) the second option plus implementation of a Roth health savings account (HSA) deposit system. Only residents of states continuing to implement PPACA are eligible for PPACA premium subsidies.

title: Southwestern Oregon Watershed and Salmon Protection Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR]]
texts: The bill amends the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to revise the segment designations for the Chetco River in Oregon.

title: Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: This bill directs the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) to establish a Community Volunteer Income Tax Assistance Matching Grant Program (VITA grant program) for the development, expansion, or continuation of volunteer tax preparation programs to assist low-income taxpayers and members of underserved populations.

title: CHOICE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], None, Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to require the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to offer, throughout the United States, a public health insurance option that provides value, choice, competition, and the stability of affordable, high-quality coverage. Plans under the public health insurance option must be qualified health plans and must include plans with bronze, silver, and gold tier benefits. (Qualified health plans are sold on health insurance exchanges, are the only plans eligible for premium subsidies, and fulfill an individual's requirement to maintain minimum essential coverage.)

title: TIRE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ]]
texts: This bill repeals provisions that require that the locally prevailing wage rate be paid to laborers and mechanics working on federal-aid highway construction projects.

title: Public Health Emergency Response and Accountability Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME]]
texts: This bill requires the Department of Health and Human Services, upon determination of a public health emergency, to provide for the convening of a group of federal officials to prepare monthly reports concerning such matters as funding, collaboration, and best practices.

title: Radiation Exposure Compensation Act Amendments of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], None, Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID]]
texts: This bill amends the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act to extend the Radiation Exposure Compensation Trust Fund until 19 years after this bill's enactment. The trust fund compensates individuals who contract cancer or other diseases as a result of their exposure to radiation during nuclear testing undertaken by the United States during the Cold War.

title: Combating European Anti-Semitism Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], None, Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill expresses the sense of Congress that: (1) it is in the U.S. national interest to combat anti-Semitism at home and abroad; (2) there is a need to ensure the security of European Jewish communities, including synagogues, schools, and cemeteries; and (3) the United States should continue to emphasize the importance of combating anti-Semitism in multilateral bodies.

title: A bill to authorize the use of the active capacity of the Fontenelle Reservoir.
sponsers: [None, Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY]]
texts: Interior may enter into: (1) any contract, grant, cooperative agreement, or other agreement that is necessary to carry out this bill; and (2) contracts with Wyoming for division of any additional active capacity made available under this bill.

title: Restricting First Use of Nuclear Weapons Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], None, Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA]]
texts: This bill prohibits the President from using the Armed Forces to conduct a first-use nuclear strike unless such strike is conducted pursuant to a congressional declaration of war expressly authorizing such strike.

title: Protection of Military Airfields from Wind Turbine Encroachment Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to make new wind facilities located near certain military installations ineligible for the tax credits for: (1) electricity produced from renewable resources, and (2) investments in qualified small wind energy property.

title: Social Security Beneficiary 2nd Amendment Rights Protection Act
sponsers: [Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], None, Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID]]
texts: This bill amends titles II (Old Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) and XVI (Supplemental Security Income) (SSI) of the Social Security Act to specify that an OASDI or SSI benefit determination may not be considered, for purposes of restricting the possession or transfer of firearms, to be a determination that an individual has been adjudicated as a mental defective.

title: RPM Act of 2017

texts: This bill requires the federal government to allow unrestricted manufacturing, distribution, prescribing, and dispensing of experimental drugs, biological products, and medical devices that are: (1) intended to treat a patient who has been diagnosed with a terminal illness, and (2) authorized by state law. The federal government must allow unrestricted possession and use of such treatments by patients certified by a physician as having exhausted all other treatment options.

texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) repeal the estate and generation-skipping transfer taxes, and (2) make permanent the maximum 35% gift tax rate and the lifetime gift tax exemption. The bill also provides for an inflation adjustment to such exemption amount.

title: JOBS Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], None, Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA]]
texts: This bill amends title IV (Student Assistance) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to establish the Job Training Federal Pell Grant Program. The Department of Education must award job training Federal Pell Grants to eligible students.

texts: Synthetic Abuse and Labeling of Toxic Substances Act of 2017 or the SALTS Act

title: PACE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], None, Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to the tax credit for expenses for household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment (known as the Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit), to: (1) make the credit refundable, (2) increase the rate for the credit, and (3) require the dollar amounts for such credit to be adjusted for inflation after 2017.

title: A bill to authorize an additional district judgeship for the district of Idaho.
sponsers: [None, Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID]]
texts: NA

sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO]]
texts: This bill states that foreign nongovernmental organizations shall not be ineligible for U.S. international development assistance under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 solely on the basis of health or medical services provided by such organizations with non-U.S. government funds if such services do not violate the laws of the country in which they are being provided and would not violate U.S. federal law if provided in the United States. Such organizations also shall not be subject to requirements relating to the use of non-U.S. government funds for advocacy and lobbying activities other than those that apply to U.S. nongovernmental organizations receiving such assistance under such Act.

title: State Refugee Security Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX]]
texts: This bill directs the Office of Refugee Resettlement to notify the state agency responsible for coordinating the placement or resettlement of an alien refugee not later than 21 days before the alien's arrival in the state.

title: MANIFEST for Human Spaceflight Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX]]
texts: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) shall report a strategy to achieve such objective through a series of successive, sustainable, free-standing, but complementary missions making robust use of cislunar space and employing the Space Launch System, Orion crew capsule, and other capabilities provided under specified titles of the Act.

title: A bill to authorize the expansion of an existing hydroelectric project.
sponsers: [Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK]]
texts: (Sec.1)This bill authorizes the licensee for the Terror Lake Hydroelectric Project in Kodiak Island, Alaska, to occupy not more than 20 acres of federal land to construct, operate, and maintain the Upper Hidden Basin Diversion Expansion without further authorization under the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act or from the Department of the Interior.

title: A bill to authorize the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to issue an order continuing a stay of a hydroelectric license for the Mahoney Lake hydroelectric project in the State of Alaska, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK]]
texts: Additionally, upon request, FERC must reinstate the construction license and make it effective as of the date the stay is lifted.

title: Bureau of Reclamation Transparency Act
sponsers: NA
texts: This bill directs the Department of the Interior to submit to Congress, make publicly available, and biennially update an Asset Management Report that describes the Bureau of Reclamation's efforts to maintain in a reliable manner all reserved works (buildings, structures, facilities, or equipment owned by the Bureau for which operations and maintenance are performed by Bureau employees or through a contract with the Bureau) at Reclamation facilities (infrastructure assets that are owned by the Bureau at each Reclamation project owned by the Bureau) and to standardize and streamline data reporting and processes across regions and areas for the purpose of maintaining such works.

title: S. 217, a bill to amend the Denali National Park Improvement Act to clarify certain provisions relating to the natural gas pipeline authorized in the Denali National Park and Preserve
sponsers: [None, Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: Additionally, the pipeline shallnot be subject to agency approval under the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act.

title: Social Security Fraud Prevention Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: This bill prohibits federal departments and agencies from including the Social Security account number of any individual on any document sent by mail unless the department or agency head determines that inclusion of that Social Security number on the document is necessary.

title: Safeguard Aquaculture Farmers Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Shelby, Richard C. [R-AL], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC]]
texts: This bill provides the force and effect of law for certain regulations that allow for the taking of double-crested cormorants (birds) that eat fish at aquaculture facilities.

title: Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act
sponsers: [Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to require any health care practitioner who is present when a child is born alive following an abortion or attempted abortion to: (1) exercise the same degree of care as reasonably provided to any other child born alive at the same gestational age, and (2) ensure that such child is immediately admitted to a hospital. The term "born alive" means the complete expulsion or extraction from his or her mother, at any stage of development, who after such expulsion or extraction breathes or has a beating heart, pulsation of the umbilical cord, or definite movement of voluntary muscles, regardless of whether the umbilical cord has been cut.

title: A PLUS Act
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC]]
texts: This bill allows each state to receive federal elementary and secondary education funds on a consolidated basis and manage the funds to advance the educational policy of the state.

title: Obamacare Replacement Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code, the Public Health Service Act, the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA), and the Social Security Act to repeal certain provisions regarding health insurance, including: the requirement for individuals to maintain minimum essential coverage, limitations on insurers varying premiums by age or health status, requirements for health insurance to cover preexisting conditions and the essential health benefits, and the prohibition on lifetime or annual limits on benefits.

title: Senior$afe Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. [D-DE], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: This bill extends immunity from liability to certain individuals who, in good faith and with reasonable care, disclose the suspected exploitation of a senior citizen to a regulatory or law-enforcement agency. Specifically, this immunity shall apply to certain credit-union, depository-institution, investment-adviser, broker-dealer, insurance-company, and insurance-agency employees who have received specified training related to identifying and reporting the suspected exploitation of a senior citizen. Similarly, the employing financial institution shall not be liable with respect to disclosures made by such employees.

title: Child Interstate Abortion Notification Act
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to make it a crime to knowingly transport a minor to another state to obtain an abortion without satisfying a parental involvement law in the minor's resident state. A parental involvement law requires parental consent or notification, or judicial authorization, for a minor to obtain an abortion.

title: Mount Hood Cooper Spur Land Exchange Clarification Act
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR]]
texts: This bill amends the Omnibus Public Land Management Act of 2009 to revise details of the Cooper Spur-Government Camp land exchange between the United States and Oregon.

title: A bill to exclude power supply circuits, drivers, and devices to be connected to, and power, light-emitting diodes or organic light-emitting diodes providing illumination or ceiling fans using direct current motors from energy conservation standards for external power supplies.
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA]]
texts: (Sec. 1) This bill amends the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to exclude from energy conservation standards for external power supplies any power supply circuit, driver, or device designed to power light-emitting diodes (commonly known as LEDs) or to power ceiling fans using direct current motors. The Department of Energy may prescribe new energy conservation standards for that equipment no earlier than one year after the date on which a test procedure has been prescribed.

title: Iran Nonnuclear Sanctions Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX]]
texts: This bill prescribes requirements for sanctions with respect to: (1) Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) and related entities; (2) Mahan Air; (3) Iran's support of terrorism; (4) Iran's human rights abuses; (5) certain Iranian individuals; (6) persons who conduct transactions with or on behalf of certain Iranian individuals; (7) financial institutions that engage in certain transactions on behalf of persons involved in human rights abuses or that export sensitive technology to Iran; (8) Iran's ballistic missile program and persons and Iranian sectors that support such program; and (9) certain entities owned by the Aerospace Industries Organization, the Shahid Hemmat Industrial Group, or the Shahid Bakeri Industrial Group.

title: Small Business Broadband Deployment Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: This bill exempts for five years any small business broadband Internet access service provider with no more than 250,000 subscribers from the enhancements to the transparency rule of the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) under which any person engaged in the provision of broadband Internet access service must disclose publicly accurate information regarding the network management practices, performance, and commercial terms of its broadband Internet access services sufficient for:

title: Protect DREAMer Confidentiality Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], None, Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to protect individual application information submitted to DHS after June 15, 2012, as part of a request for consideration or reconsideration for the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program from disclosure to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) or U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) for any purpose other than implementing such program. Such information may be shared with national security and law enforcement agencies: (1) to identify or prevent fraudulent claims, (2) for national security purposes relating to an individual application, or (3) for the investigation or prosecution of a felony not related to immigration status.

title: Capitalizing on American Methane Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) include in the tax credit for investment in a qualifying gasification project any qualified methane conversion technology, and (2) allow an alternative fuel excise tax credit for liquid fuel produced through qualified methane conversion technology at a facility the construction of which begins before October 1, 2027. The bill defines "qualified methane conversion technology" as a process for the molecular conversion of a fuel consisting principally of methane into hydrocarbons and the use of such hydrocarbons to replace or reduce the quantity of petroleum present in motor vehicle fuel and for the production of chemicals.

title: Life at Conception Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND]]
texts: This bill declares that the right to life guaranteed by the Constitution is vested in each human being at all stages of life, including the moment of fertilization, cloning, or other moment at which an individual comes into being.

title: A bill to terminate the EB-5 Visa Program and to reallocate the employment creation visas to the other employment-based visa classifications.
sponsers: [Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL]]
texts: The number of fiscal year immigrant visas available for the following employment categories is increased: (1) priority workers; (2) members of the professions with advanced degrees or persons of exceptional ability; (3) skilled workers, professionals, and certain unskilled workers; and (4) certain special immigrants.

title: Providing Veterans Overdue Care Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. texts: This bill authorizes the Department of Veterans Affairs to carry out major medical facility leases in specified amounts for:

title: End Outsourcing Act
sponsers: [Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], None, Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN]]
texts: This bill modifies provisions of tax, labor, and federal contracting laws related to the outsourcing of jobs.

title: CHOICE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL]]
texts: This bill amends the Scholarships for Opportunity and Results Act to include among the eligibility criteria for opportunity scholarships, a requirement that a student in Washington, DC is enrolled, or will be enrolled for the next school year, in a public or private elementary or secondary school. (Opportunity scholarships are provided to low-income DC students to enable them to attend a participating private school of their choice.)

title: Lawsuit Abuse Reduction Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: This bill amends the sanctions provisions in Rule 11 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure to require the court to impose an appropriate sanction on any attorney, law firm, or party that has violated, or is responsible for the violation of, the rule with regard to representations to the court. Any sanction must compensate parties injured by the conduct in question.

title: A bill to authorize the President to award the Medal of Honor to James Megellas, formerly of Fond du Lac, Wisconsin, and currently of Colleyville, Texas, for acts of valor on January 28th, 1945, during the Battle of the Bulge in World War II.
sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], None, Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI]]

title: S. 239, Energy Savings Through Public-Private Partnerships Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], None, Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: This bill amends the National Energy Conservation Policy Act to revise requirements for energy savings performance contracts and utility energy service contracts (performance contracts). These contracts allow federal agencies to work with private contractors on energy efficiency upgrades to federal facilities, unless the facilities are dams, reservoirs, or hydropower facilities owned or operated by federal agencies.

Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to provide each veteran who submits a claim for VA benefits with an opportunity to permit a covered congressional employee in the office of the veteran's Member of Congress to have read-only access to all of the veteran's records in the Veterans Benefits Administration databases. A Member may designate up to two such covered congressional employees.

title: Rural Hospital Regulatory Relief Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Jones, Doug  [D-AL]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to permanently extend the application by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services of an instruction against the enforcement of certain physician supervision requirements with respect to outpatient therapeutic services in critical access hospitals and small rural hospitals.

title: Davis-Bacon Repeal Act
sponsers: [Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], None, Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT]]
texts: This bill repeals the Davis-Bacon Act (which requires that the locally prevailing wage rate be paid to various classes of laborers and mechanics working under federally-financed or federally-assisted contracts for construction, alteration, and repair of public buildings or public works).

title: S. 245, Indian Tribal Energy Development and Self-Determination Act Amendments of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: This bill amends the Energy Policy Act of 1992 to revise the Department of Energy (DOE) Indian energy education planning and management assistance program, including to make intertribal organizations eligible for grants.

title: Campus Fire Safety Education Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Education (ED) to establish a program to award grants, on a competitive basis, to institutions of higher education or consortiums of such institutions, in a collaborative partnership with a nonprofit organization or a public safety department (eligible entity), for: (1) initiating, expanding, or improving fire safety education programs; and (2) increasing fire safety awareness among enrolled students.

title: Bring Jobs Home Act
sponsers: [Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) grant business taxpayers a tax credit for up to 20% of insourcing expenses incurred for eliminating a business located outside the United States and  relocating it within the United States, and (2) deny a tax deduction for outsourcing expenses incurred in relocating a U.S. business outside the United States. The bill requires an increase in the taxpayer's employment of full-time employees in the United States in order to claim the tax credit for insourcing expenses.

title: A bill to provide that the pueblo of Santa Clara may lease for 99 years certain restricted land, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [None, Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM]]
texts: (Sec. 1) This bill amends the Indian Long-Term Leasing Act to expand the land of the Pueblo of Santa Clara and Ohkay Owingeh pueblo that may be leased for up to 99 years with the approval of the Department of the Interior, from lands held in trust, to all of the lands of the Pueblo of Santa Clara and Ohkay Owingeh pueblo.

title: A bill to prohibit any hiring freeze from affecting any Department of Defense position at, or in support of, a public shipyard.

Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], None, Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR]]
texts: This bill amends the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA) to terminate the Independent Payment Advisory Board (IPAB). Under PPACA, the IPAB is tasked with developing proposals to reduce the per capita rate of growth in Medicare spending.

title: Medicare Drug Savings Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], None, Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill requires drug manufacturers to issue rebates to the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) for prescription drugs dispensed to eligible low-income individuals under the Medicare prescription drug benefit or a Medicare Advantage (MA) prescription drug plan (PDP).

texts: This bill repeals existing caps on Medicare payment for certain outpatient physical-therapy services and speech-language pathology services. Under current law, annual payment for such services is capped at $1,980 in 2017, with specified percentage increases to that limit in subsequent years.

title: Esther Martinez Native American Languages Preservation Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], None, Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], None, Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND]]
texts: This bill amends the Native American Programs Act of 1974 to reauthorize through FY2022 and revise a grant program administered by the Administration for Native Americans at the Department of Health and Human Services to ensure the survival and continuing vitality of Native American languages.

title: FAIR Act
sponsers: [Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR]]
texts: This bill increases by 3.2% in FY2018 the rate of basic pay for federal employees under the statutory pay systems (relating to the General Schedule, the U.S. Foreign Service, and the Veterans Health Administration) and for prevailing rate employees.

title: SOAR to Health and Wellness Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to replace the existing Stop, Observe, Ask, and Respond to Health and Wellness Training (or SOAR to Health and Wellness Training) program with a pilot program that includes the same functions and additional initiatives. The pilot program must train health care providers and other related providers to: (1) identify potential human trafficking victims, (2) work with law enforcement to report and facilitate communication with such victims, (3) refer victims to social or victims service agencies or organizations, and (4) provide such victims with coordinated care tailored to their circumstances.

title: Acadia National Park Boundary Clarification Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME]]
texts: This bill confirms that the boundary of Acadia National Park in Maine includes approximately 1,441 acres of land and interests in the Schoodic Peninsula.

title: Holocaust Insurance Accountability Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill allows a beneficiary of a Holocaust-era life, dowry, education, annuity, property, or other insurance policy to bring a civil action in a U.S. district court against the insurer for the covered policy to recover proceeds due or, otherwise, to enforce any rights under the policy.

title: No Stolen Trademarks Honored in America Act
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC]]
texts: This bill amends the Department of Commerce and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999 to prohibit U.S. courts from recognizing, enforcing, or otherwise validating any assertion of rights by an individual (under current law, by a designated Cuban national) of a mark, trade name, or commercial name that was used in connection with a business or assets that were confiscated by the Cuban government unless the original owner of such mark or name, or such owner's bona fide successor, has expressly consented. The bill applies such prohibition only if the individual asserting the rights knew or had reason to know at the time of acquiring the rights asserted that the mark or name was the same or substantially similar to the mark or name used in connection with the business or assets that were confiscated.

title: Protecting Seniors' Access to Medicare Act of 2017

texts: This bill amends the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA) to terminate the Independent Payment Advisory Board (IPAB). Under PPACA, the IPAB is tasked with developing proposals to reduce the per capita rate of growth in Medicare spending.

title: Common Sense Nutrition Disclosure Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to revise the nutritional information that restaurants and retail food establishments must disclose. The nutrient content disclosure statement on the menu or menu board must include: (1) the number of calories contained in the whole menu item; (2) the number of servings and number of calories per serving; or (3) the number of calories per common unit of the item, such as for a multi-serving item that is typically divided before presentation to the consumer. Nutritional information may be provided solely by a remote-access menu (e.g., an Internet menu) for food establishments where the majority of orders are placed by customers who are off-premises.

title: Steel Industry Preservation Act
sponsers: [Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to extend and modify the production tax credit for steel industry fuel.

title: Ozone Standards Implementation Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], None, Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV]]
texts: This bill amends the Clean Air Act by revising the National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS) program.

title: The Free Speech Fairness Act
sponsers: [Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], None, Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to permit a tax-exempt organization to make certain statements related to a political campaign without losing its tax-exempt status. An organization may not lose its tax-exempt status under section 501(c)(3) or be deemed to have participated in, or intervened in any political campaign on behalf of (or in opposition to) any candidate for public office, solely because of the content of any statement that: (1) is made in the ordinary course of the organization's regular and customary activities in carrying out its exempt purpose, and (2) results in the organization incurring not more than de minimis incremental expenses.

title: Financial Services Conflict of Interest Act
sponsers: [Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI]]
texts: This bill amends the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 and other laws to:

texts: This bill directs the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the President pro tempore of the Senate to arrange for the posthumous award of a Congressional Gold Medal to Anwar Sadat in recognition of his achievements and heroic actions to attain comprehensive peace in the Middle East.

title: A bill to provide for the correction of a survey of certain land in the State of Alaska.
sponsers: [Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: (Sec.1)This bill directs the Department of the Interior, after consulting with the U.S. Forest Service, to modify the boundary of the Swan Lake Hydroelectric Project (FERC No. 2911) in southeast Alaska and to convey any additional land necessary for the project to the state of Alaska.

title: Investing in Student Success Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR]]
texts: This bill authorizes an individual (i.e., a student) and another person (i.e., an investor) to enter an income-share agreement (ISA) in which the student agrees to pay a percentage of future income, for a specified period of time, in exchange for funds to pay for postsecondary education, workforce development, or other purposes.

title: S. 269, a bill to provide for the conveyance of certain property to the Tanana Tribal Council located in Tanana, Alaska and to the Bristol Bay Area Health Corporation located in Dillingham, Alaska, and for other purposes
sponsers: [None, Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: HHS shall convey to the Bristol Bay Area Health Corporation in Dillingham, Alaska, all interest of the United States in and to certain property included in the Dental Annex Subdivision (including all land, improvements, and appurtenances) containing 1.474 acres more or less, also for use in connection with health and social services programs.

title: Pension and Budget Integrity Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], None, Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY]]
texts: This bill prohibits provisions that increase or extend an increase of Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation (PBGC) premiums from being counted as an offset to determine budget points of order for legislation in the House or the Senate.

title: Build USA Infrastructure Act
sponsers: [Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE]]
texts: This bill requires, for the five-year period beginning on October 1, 2020, the deposit of the first $21.4 billion of revenues collected by the U.S. Customs and Border Protection of the Department of Homeland Security into the Highway Trust Fund (HTF).

title: Strengthening American Transportation Security Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], None, Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI]]
texts: This bill expresses the sense of Congress that the personnel system used by the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) provides insufficient workplace protections for its workforce and such personnel should be entitled to protections under the civil service system applicable to all federal employees.

title: Greater Sage-Grouse Protection and Recovery Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY]]
texts: This bill addresses the October 2, 2015, finding of the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS) that the greater sage grouse is not an endangered or threatened species. Until September 30, 2027, the USFWS may not modify or invalidate the finding.

title: A bill to nullify the effect of the recent executive order that temporarily restricted individuals from certain countries from entering the United States.
sponsers: [Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen.
