Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO]]
texts: NA

title: Agricultural Export Expansion Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL]]
texts: This bill amends the Trade Sanctions Reform and Export Enhancement Act of 2000 to permit a person subject to the jurisdiction of the United States to provide payment or financing for sales of agricultural commodities to Cuba or to an individual or entity in Cuba.

title: Judicial Administration and Improvement Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill divides the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit into: (1) a new Ninth Circuit, to be composed of California, Hawaii, Oregon, Guam, and the Northern Mariana Islands; and (2) a newly established Twelfth Circuit, to be composed of Alaska, Arizona, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, and Washington.

title: Rural Telecommunications and Broadband Service Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV]]
texts: This bill amends the Communications Act of 1934 to establish within the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) a Rural Telecommunications and Broadband Advisory Committee to:

title: Support for Rapid Innovation Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: This bill amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to direct the Under Secretary for Science and Technology of the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to support the research, development, testing, evaluation, and transition of cybersecurity technologies.

title: SAND Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the Water Resources Development Act of 1986 to eliminate the limitation that the Army Corps of Engineers may acquire fill material for beach erosion and nourishment for an authorized water resources project from non-domestic sources only if such material is not available from domestic sources for environmental or economic reasons.

title: S. 280, Crags, Colorado Land Exchange Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Agriculture (USDA), if the Broadmoor Hotel, Inc., (BHI) offers to convey to the USDA 320 acres of specified nonfederal land in the Pike National Forest in Teller County, Colorado, and a permanent trail easement for the Barr Trail in El Paso County, Colorado, to accept the offer and convey to BHI 83 acres of specified federal land within the Forest, together with a nonexclusive perpetual access easement for BHI to and from such land on Forest Service Road 371.

title: Fairness for High-Skilled Immigrants Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO]]
texts: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to: (1) eliminate the per country numerical limitation for employment-based immigrants, and (2) increase the per country numerical limitation for family based immigrants from 7% to 15% of the total number of family-sponsored visas.

title: Public Land Renewable Energy Development Act
sponsers: [Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill amends the Energy Policy Act of 2005 to extend through FY2022 the authorization for deposit and use of lease revenues under the Geothermal Steam Act of 1970. Such funds shall be available to the Department of the Interior for FY2017 and afterwards to implement both the Energy Policy Act of 2005 and the Geothermal Steam Act of 1970.

title: Mark Takai Atomic Veterans Healthcare Parity Act
sponsers: [Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], None, Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN]]
texts: This bill includes veterans who participated in the cleanup of Enewetak Atoll in the Marshall Islands between January 1, 1977, and December 31, 1980, as radiation exposed veterans for purposes of the Department of Veterans Affairs presumption of service-connection for specified cancers.

title: End Surprise Billing Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to require a critical access hospital or other hospital to comply, as a condition of participation in Medicare, with certain requirements related to billing for out-of-network services.

title: S. 285, Bolts Ditch Access and Use Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Agriculture to permit by special use authorization nonmotorized access and use of the Bolts Ditch headgate and the Bolts Ditch within the Holy Cross Wilderness in Colorado for the diversion of water and use, maintenance, and repair of the ditch and headgate by the town of Minturn, Colorado.

title: S. 286, Elkhorn Ranch and White River National Forest Conveyance Act
sponsers: [Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO]]
texts: This bill requires all interest of the United States in 148 acres of identified land to be conveyed by patent to the Gordman-Leverich Partnership (GLP), a Colorado Limited Liability Partnership.

title: A bill to update the map of, and modify the maximum acreage available for inclusion in, the Florissant Fossil Beds National Monument.
sponsers: [Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO]]
texts: (Sec. 1) This bill revises the title, number, and date of the map depicting the Florissant Fossil Beds National Monument in Colorado and increases from 6,000 to 6,300 the maximum number of acres that may be made available for inclusion in the monument.

title: Regulatory Predictability for Business Growth Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT]]
texts: This bill adds the definitions of "longstanding interpretative rule" and "revise" to the Administrative Procedure Act (APA). A longstanding interpretative rule is distinguished from an "interpretative rule" if it has been in effect for at least one year. If a rule is a longstanding interpretative rule, it remains subject to the general notice of proposed rulemaking and comment and publication provisions of the APA.

title: Arapaho National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: This bill adjusts the boundary of the Arapaho National Forest in Colorado to incorporate approximately 92.95 acres of land. The Department of Agriculture shall include all federal land within the boundary in the Bowen Gulch Protection Area established under the Colorado Wilderness Act of 1993.

title: HOME Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a taxpayer who uses a residence to conduct a trade or business a standard tax deduction equal to the lesser of $1,500 or the taxpayer's gross trade or business income derived from the business use of such residence. The bill provides for an inflation adjustment to the standard deduction amount in calendar years beginning after 2017.

title: Strengthening Oversight of National Security Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI]]
texts: This bill amends the National Security Act of 1947 to add the Director of National Intelligence and the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff as statutorily required members of the National Security Council (NSC). (The current NSC members required by statute are the President, the Vice President, the Secretary of State, the Secretary of Defense, and the Secretary of Energy.)

title: Childhood Cancer STAR Act
sponsers: [Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Smith, Tina  [D-MN], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Jones, Doug  [D-AL]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to authorize the National Institutes of Health (NIH) to provide support to collect the medical specimens and information of children, adolescents, and young adults with selected cancers that have the least effective treatments in order to achieve a better understanding of these cancers and the effects of treatment.

title: Investing in Opportunity Act
sponsers: [Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to authorize the designation of opportunity zones in low-income communities and to provide tax incentives for investments in the zones, including deferring the recognition of capital gains that are reinvested in the zones.

title: Traditional Cigar Manufacturing and Small Business Jobs Preservation Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to exempt traditional large and premium cigars from regulation by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and from user fees assessed on tobacco products by the FDA.

title: Circuit Court of Appeals Restructuring and Modernization Act
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: This bill divides the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit into: (1) a new Ninth Circuit, to be composed of California, Guam, Hawaii, and Northern Mariana Islands; and (2) a newly established Twelfth Circuit, to be composed of Alaska, Arizona, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, Oregon, and Washington.

title: Federal Courts of Appeals Modernization Act
sponsers: [Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: This bill establishes a Commission on Structural Alternatives for the Federal Courts of Appeals to: (1) study the present division of the U.S. courts of appeals, with particular references to the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit; and (2) submit to the President and Congress recommendations for changes in circuit boundaries or structure for the expeditious and effective disposition of the caseload of such courts.

title: Increasing Competition in Pharmaceuticals Act
sponsers: [Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to revise provisions regarding review and approval of generic drug applications or supplements to generic drug applications for drugs: (1) for which there is a shortage, or (2) that have not been recently introduced to the market by more than one manufacturer and for which tentative approval has not been granted to more than two applications.

title: Senate Campaign Disclosure Parity Act
sponsers: [Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Warner, Mark R. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to require Senate candidates to file designations, statements, and reports directly with the Federal Election Commission, instead of with the Senate as currently required.

title: Agency Accountability Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX]]
texts: This bill requires any agency that receives a fee, fine, penalty, or proceeds from a settlement to deposit the amount in the general fund of the Treasury.

title: Sunlight for Unaccountable Non-profits (SUN) Act
sponsers: [Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to require: (1) the annual tax return information for tax-exempt organizations and deferred compensation plans to be made available to the public at no charge and in an open structured data format that is processable by computers, with the information easy to find, access, reuse, and download in bulk; and (2) the disclosure of the names and addresses of contributors of $5,000 or more to tax-exempt organizations that participate or intervene in political campaigns on behalf of, or in opposition to, any candidate for public office.

title: Conscience Protection Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to codify the prohibition against the federal government and state and local governments that receive federal financial assistance for health-related activities penalizing or discriminating against a health care provider based on the provider's refusal to be involved in, or provide coverage for, abortion. Health care providers include health care professionals, health care facilities, social services providers, health care professional training programs, and health insurers.

title: John P. Smith Act
sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], None, Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY]]
texts: This bill modifies the approval process used for certain transportation projects on Indian reservations by allowing categorical exclusions from National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA) requirements.

title: A bill to discontinue a Federal program that authorizes State and local law enforcement officers to investigate, apprehend, and detain aliens in accordance with a written agreement with the Director of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement and to clarify that immigration enforcement is solely a function of the Federal Government.
sponsers: [Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], None, Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ]]
texts: DHS authority to enter into written agreements with a state or state subdivision to perform immigration-related investigations, apprehensions, or detentions of aliens in the United States is eliminated. The bill exempts from the restriction under this bill DOJ authority to enter into other state and local agreements: (1) in the event of an actual or imminent mass influx of aliens representing urgent circumstances; and (2) with respect to immigration-related detentions in non-federal facilities, including personnel and facilities construction. The bill also exempts from such restriction state and local enforcement authority to arrest and detain certain previously-deported illegal aliens who have been convicted of a felony.

title: Tribal Veterans Health Care Enhancement Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Thune, John [R-SD]]
texts: This bill amends the Indian Health Care Improvement Act to permit the Indian Health Service (IHS) to pay copayments owed to the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) by Indian veterans for medical services authorized under the Purchased/Referred Care program and administered at a VA facility.

title: Vietnam War Veterans Recognition Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA]]
texts: This bill includes National Vietnam War Veterans Day, March 29, among those days on which the flag should especially be displayed.

title: Biennial Budgeting and Appropriations Act
sponsers: [Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV]]
texts: This bill amends the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to require biennial budget resolutions, appropriations bills, and government strategic and performance plans, instead of the annual budget process required under current law.

title: Department of Defense Emergency Response Capabilities Database Enhancement Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], None, Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA]]
texts: This bill amends the John Warner National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2007 to require the Department of Defense (DOD) to establish and maintain within one year a database of DOD emergency response capabilities that includes the cyber capabilities of the reserves and the National Guard of each state and territory that are important to national security and for response to domestic natural or man made disasters.

title: Provider Payment Sunshine Act
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT]]
texts: This bill amends title XI (General Provisions) of the Social Security Act to expand reporting requirements related to the transparency of physician ownership or investment interests.

title: Community-Based Independence for Seniors Act
sponsers: [Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], None, Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: This bill establishes a Community-Based Institutional Special Needs Plan demonstration program, through which the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) shall target home- and community-based services to low-income seniors who are unable to perform two or more activities of daily living and are eligible for Medicare Advantage (MA) but not for Medicaid.

title: A bill to clarify that nonprofit organizations such as Habitat for Humanity may accept donated mortgage appraisals, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [None, Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: NA

title: Alzheimer's Caregiver Support Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to authorize the Department of Health and Human Services to make grants to public and nonprofit private health care providers to expand training and support services for families and caregivers of individuals living with Alzheimer's disease or a related dementia.

title: Saint-Gaudens National Historical Park Redesignation Act
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH]]
texts: This bill redesignates the Saint-Gaudens National Historic Site, in New Hampshire, as the "Saint-Gaudens National Historical Park."

title: NA
sponsers: [Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA]]
texts: This bill amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to exclude from the meaning of "employee" subject to minimum wage and maximum hours requirements any individuals who volunteer their services at a children's consignment event with or without the assistance of a facilitator and meet certain other conditions.

title: FIX Act
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: NA

title: Vietnam Helicopter Crew Monument Act
sponsers: [Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of the Army to place in Arlington National Cemetery a monument honoring helicopter pilots and crew members who were killed while serving on active duty in the Armed Forces during the Vietnam era, subject to an agreement with the Vietnam Helicopter Pilots Association under which the association shall pay all site preparation, construction, installation, and maintenance costs for the memorial.

title: Protecting States' Rights to Promote American Energy Security Act
sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], None, Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT]]
texts: This bill amends the Mineral Leasing Act to prohibit the Department of the Interior from enforcing any federal regulation, guidance, or permit requirement regarding hydraulic fracturing (including any component of that process), relating to oil, gas, or geothermal production activities on or under any land in any state that has regulations, guidance, or permit requirements for that activity.

title: S. 317, Taxpayers Right-To-Know Act
sponsers: [Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA]]
texts: This bill requires that the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) website include an inventory that identifies each federal program for which there is more than $1 million in annual budget authority.

title: COPS Improvements Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: This bill amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to codify the establishment of the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services within the Department of Justice (DOJ).

title: Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to establish a center of excellence in the prevention, diagnosis, mitigation, treatment, and rehabilitation of health conditions relating to exposure to burn pits and other environmental exposures in Afghanistan or Iraq.

title: NextGen Accountability Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: This bill amends the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012 to direct the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to establish annual Next Generation Air Transportation System (NextGen) performance goals for each of the national airspace system performance metrics to meet identified performance metric baselines with respect to NextGen projects.

title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt amounts paid for aircraft management services from the excise taxes imposed on transportation by air.
sponsers: [None, Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: Aircraft management services include assisting an aircraft owner with administrative and support services; obtaining insurance; maintenance, storage and fueling of aircraft; hiring, training, and provision of pilots and crew; establishing and complying with safety standards; or other services necessary to support flights operated by an aircraft owner.

title: Pet and Women Safety Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], None, Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to broaden the definition of stalking to include conduct that causes a person to experience a reasonable fear of death or serious bodily injury to his or her pet.

title: Universal Savings Account Act
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow for the establishment of Universal Savings Accounts. These accounts shall be tax-exempt and may be opened by any individual who is at least 18 years of age and a U.S. citizen or legal permanent resident. Contributions to these accounts must be in cash and may not exceed $5,500 (adjusted annually for inflation) in any calendar year. Distributions from a Universal Savings Account are excluded from the gross income of the account holder for income tax purposes.

title: State Veterans Home Adult Day Health Care Improvement Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], None, Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to enter into an agreement or a contract with each state home to pay for medical supervision model adult day health care for a veteran for whom the home is not receiving VA nursing home care payments.

title: Permanently Protecting Tenants at Foreclosure Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], None, Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT]]
texts: This bill restores and revives the Protecting Tenants at Foreclosure Act of 2009, and any regulations promulgated pursuant to it, as if the Act had not expired after 2014.

title: Public Buildings Renewal Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to permit the tax-exempt financing of certain government-owned buildings by expanding the definition of "exempt facility bond" to include bonds used for qualified government buildings.

title: Fair Access to Investment Research Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], None, Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill directs the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to establish and implement a "safe harbor" for certain investment fund research reports published by brokers and dealers. Such reports shall be deemed not to be "offers" under specified provisions of securities law, even if the broker or dealer participates in the registered offering of the investment fund's securities.

title: Equal Justice Under Law Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ]]
texts: This bill states that an indigent individual facing criminal prosecution or juvenile delinquency in a state court is entitled to the effective assistance of counsel, as guaranteed by the Sixth and Fourteenth Amendments, at the state's expense.

title: MERCY Act
sponsers: [Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to prohibit juvenile solitary confinement, except as a temporary response to behavior that poses a serious and immediate risk of harm.

title: Gideon Act
sponsers: [Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to establish a private, nonmembership, nonprofit corporation to assist and advocate on behalf of individuals in certain noncapital criminal cases before the U.S. Supreme Court and the highest state court.

title: A bill to remove the use restrictions on certain land transferred to Rockingham County, Virginia, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA]]
texts: NA

title: A bill to restrict funding for the Preparatory Commission for the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty Organization, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR]]
texts: No U.S. funds may be made available to the Preparatory Commission for the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty Organization, except for the organization's international monitoring system.

title: Stop Settlement Slush Funds Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], None, Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK]]
texts: This bill prohibits federal government officials from entering into or enforcing a settlement agreement on behalf of the United States (resolving a civil action, a plea agreement, a deferred prosecution agreement, or a nonprosecution agreement) that provides for a payment or loan to any person or entity other than the United States. The bill provides exceptions to allow payments or loans that: (1) remedy actual harm (including to the environment) caused by the party making the payment or loan, or (2) constitute a payment for services rendered in connection with the case or a payment that a court may order for restitution to victims in certain criminal cases or other persons in plea agreements.

title: Fracturing Regulations are Effective in State Hands Act
sponsers: [Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX]]
texts: This bill gives states the sole authority to promulgate or enforce any regulation, guidance, or permit requirement regarding hydraulic fracturing on or under any land within their boundaries. Hydraulic fracturing or fracking is a process to extract underground resources such as oil or gas from a geologic formation by injecting water, a propping agent (e.g., sand), and chemical additives into a well under enough pressure to fracture the geological formation.

title: Federal Land Freedom Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], None, Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK]]
texts: This bill authorizes a state with an established oil and gas leasing program to take responsibility from the federal government for leasing and regulating the exploration and development of oil, gas, and other forms of energy on federal land in the state.

title: Department of Veterans Affairs Employee Fairness Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], None, Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: This bill repeals provisions excluding any matter or question concerning professional conduct or competence, peer review, or the establishment, determination, or adjustment of employee compensation from the applicability of collective bargaining rights for Veterans Health Administration employees.

title: FAMILY Act
sponsers: [Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Smith, Tina  [D-MN], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH]]
texts: This bill establishes the Office of Paid Family and Medical Leave within the Social Security Administration (SSA).

title: Scientific Integrity Act
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA]]
texts: This bill requires, subject to the exemptions for disclosures of information under the Freedom of Information Act, each federal agency that funds or conducts scientific research to: (1) promote and maximize the communication and open exchange of data and findings to other agencies, policymakers, and the public of research conducted by a scientist employed or contracted by such an agency; and (2) prevent the intentional or unintentional suppression or distortion of such data and findings.

title: NA
sponsers: [Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Jones, Doug  [D-AL], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], None, Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill repeals certain provisions which require the offset of amounts paid in dependency and indemnity compensation from Survivor Benefit Plan (SBP) annuities for the surviving spouses of former military personnel who are entitled to military retired pay or who would be entitled to such pay, except for being under 60 years of age.

title: Sensible Environmental Protection Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], None, Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (FIFRA) and the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (commonly known as the Clean Water Act) to prohibit the Environmental Protection Agency or a state from requiring a permit under the National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) for a discharge of a pesticide from a point source into navigable waters if the discharge is approved under FIFRA. Point source pollution is waste discharged from a distinct place, such as a pipe, channel, or tunnel. The bill establishes exemptions from this prohibition.

title: Russia Sanctions Review Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: This bill provides that the following executive orders, as in effect on January 1, 2017, and any sanctions imposed pursuant to such orders, shall remain in effect: (1) Executive Order 13694 (relating to blocking property of certain persons engaging in significant malicious cyber-enabled activities); (2) Executive Orders 13660, 13661, and 13662 (relating to blocking property of certain persons contributing to the situation in Ukraine); and (3) Executive Order 13685 (relating to blocking property of certain persons and prohibiting certain transactions with respect to the Crimea region of Ukraine).

title: Gold Star Families Forever Stamp Act
sponsers: [Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA]]
texts: This bill directs the Postmaster General to provide for the issuance of a forever stamp to honor the sacrifices of families who have lost a loved one who was a member of the Armed Forces in combat.

title: S. 343, RESPECT Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD]]
texts: Repealing Existing Substandard Provisions Encouraging Conciliation with Tribes Act or the RESPECT Act

title: Strong Families Act
sponsers: [Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) allow certain employers a business-related tax credit for up to 25% of the amount of wages paid to their employees during any period (not exceeding 12 weeks) in which such employees are on family and medical leave, (2) limit the allowable amount of such credit to $3,000 per employee for any taxable year, and (3) terminate such credit two years after the enactment of this bill.

title: Workplace Advancement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV]]
texts: This bill amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to prohibit discharging or retaliating against any employee because such employee has inquired about, discussed, or disclosed comparative compensation information for the purpose of determining whether the employer is compensating an employee in a manner that provides equal pay for equal work.

title: National Volcano Early Warning and Monitoring System Act
sponsers: [Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI]]
texts: This bill directs the United States Geological Survey (USGS) to establish the National Volcano Early Warning and Monitoring System to monitor, issue warnings of, and protect U.S. citizens from undue and avoidable harm from, volcanic activity.

title: Investing in America's Small Manufacturers Act
sponsers: [Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], None, Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE]]
texts: This bill amends the Small Business Act to authorize the Small Business Administration (SBA) to guarantee 90% of a loan to a small business manufacturing concern.

title: Prescription Drug and Health Improvement Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], None, Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN]]
texts: This bill requires the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) to negotiate lower prices on behalf of Medicare and Medicare Advantage (MA) beneficiaries for covered prescription drugs that the CMS deems appropriate for negotiation based on: (1) program and per-beneficiary spending, (2) unit price increases over the preceding years, (3) initial launch price, (4) availability of similarly effective alternative treatments, (5) status of the drug as a follow-on to previously approved drugs, and (6) any other criteria determined by the CMS.

title: A bill to clarify the rights of all persons who are held or detained at a port of entry or at any detention facility overseen by U.S. Customs and Border Protection or U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
sponsers: [Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], None, Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA]]
texts: A person held or detained at a port of entry may not submit a valid Record of Abandonment of Lawful Permanent Resident Status or Withdrawal of Application for Admission if such person has been denied access to counsel.

title: End Congressional Stock Market Abuse Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT]]
texts: This bill amends the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to prohibit Members of Congress, in securities transactions, from receiving a discounted purchase price or a premium sales price.

title: Comprehensive Student Achievement Information Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY]]
texts: This bill amends title I (General Provisions) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to modify consumer information disclosure requirements related to completion or graduation rates.

title: Master Sergeant Roddie Edmonds Congressional Gold Medal Act
sponsers: [Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ]]
texts: This bill directs the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the President pro tempore of the Senate to arrange for the posthumous award of a Congressional Gold Medal to Roddie Edmonds in recognition of his achievements and heroic actions during World War II.

title: Preserve Access to Medicare Rural Home Health Services Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME]]
texts: This bill amends the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003 to extend through 2022 the rural add-on, which is a payment increase for Medicare home health services furnished to patients in rural areas.

title: RAISE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA]]
texts: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to eliminate the diversity immigrant visa category.

title: Wounded Veterans Recreation Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Lands Recreation Enhancement Act to instruct the Department of the Interior and the Department of Agriculture (USDA) to make the National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Pass available, without charge and for the lifetime of the passholder, to any veteran with a service-connected disability.

title: Hallways to Health Act
sponsers: [Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY]]
texts: This bill amends titles XIX (Medicaid) and XXI (Children's Health Insurance Program [CHIP]) of the Social Security Act to:

title: Santa Ana River Wash Plan Land Exchange Act
sponsers: [Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of the Interior: (1) to quitclaim to the San Bernardino Valley Water Conservation District in California approximately 327 acres of identified federal land administered by the Bureau of Land Management; and (2) in exchange for such land, to accept from the Conservation District a conveyance of approximately 310 acres of its land.

title: Stop Terrorist Operational Resources and Money Act
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH]]
texts: This bill expresses the sense of Congress regarding the importance of the United States and its partners curtailing the financial resources of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

title: Fishing Equipment Tax Relief Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to reduce from 10% to 3% the excise tax rate that applies to the sale of portable, electronically-aerated bait containers by the manufacturer, producer, or importer.

title: Same Day Registration Act
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA]]
texts: This bill amends the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to require states with a voter registration requirement to make same-day voter registration available at the polling place on any day voting is permitted.

title: Expatriate Terrorist Act
sponsers: [Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], None, Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX]]
texts: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to include among the grounds for loss of U.S. nationality by a native-born or naturalized citizen:

title: Federal Employees Paid Parental Leave Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA]]
texts: This bill allows executive branch employees to substitute any available paid leave for any leave without pay for either: (1) the birth of a child, or (2) the placement of a child for adoption or foster care. It makes available for any of the 12 weeks of leave an employee is entitled to for such purposes: (1) six administrative weeks of paid parental leave in connection with the birth or placement involved, and (2) any accumulated annual or sick leave.

title: S. 363, North Country National Scenic Trail Route Adjustment Act
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Smith, Tina  [D-MN], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: This bill amends the National Trails System Act to revise the authorized route of the North Country National Scenic Trail to extend it to the Appalachian Trail in Vermont and to modify the route in northeastern Minnesota.

title: Improving Access to Farm Conservation Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT]]
texts: This bill amends the Food Security Act of 1985 to exempt certain recipients of Department of Agriculture (USDA) conservation assistance from specified reporting requirements. The bill exempts producers or landowners eligible to participate in any USDA conservation program from reporting requirements related to subawards, executive compensation, the Universal Identifier, and the System for Award Management.

title: A bill to amend the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to remove the funding cap relating to the transfer of funds from the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System to the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [None, Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD]]
texts: Under current law, amounts from civil penalties obtained by the CFPB must be used for payments to the victims of the activities for which the civil penalties were imposed; to the extent that such payments are impracticable, the CFPB may instead use those amounts for the purpose of consumer education and financial literacy programs. The bill eliminates these requirements and instead specifies that such amounts must be credited to the Treasury.

title: TAILOR Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK]]
texts: This bill requires federal financial regulatory agencies to: (1) in general, tailor a regulatory action so as to limit the regulatory impact and other burdens on the institutions involved, with consideration of the risk profiles and business models of those institutions; and (2) report to Congress on specific actions taken to do so, as well as on other related issues.

title: Mexican Gray Wolf Recovery Plan Act
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ]]
texts: This bill:

title: BRAVE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], None, Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI]]
texts: This bill authorizes the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), in awarding a contract for the procurement of goods or services, to give preference to offerors based on the percentage of the offeror's full-time employees who are veterans.

title: Repeal CFPB Act
sponsers: [Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], None, Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX]]
texts: This bill repeals the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010, which established the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

title: Department of State Authorities Act, Fiscal Year 2017, Improvements Act
sponsers: [Rep. Royce, Edward R. [R-CA-39], None, Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], None, Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN]]
texts: This bill makes technical changes to the Department of State Authorities Act, Fiscal Year 2017 and other related Acts.

title: STOP Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], None, Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: This bill amends the Tariff Act of 1930 to make the Postmaster General the consignee (i.e., the entity financially responsible for the receipt of a shipment) for merchandise, excluding documents, imported through the mail into the United States. The Postmaster General must designate licensed customs brokers to file required documents or information for such shipments.

title: A bill to require the Secretary of Defense to submit to Congress a report on hearing loss, tinnitus, and noise pollution due to small arms fire.
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: NA

title: S. 374, Concrete Masonry Products Research, Education, and Promotion Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], None, Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Commerce to issue orders applicable to U.S. manufacturers of concrete masonry products. Any such order must provide for the establishment of a Concrete Masonry Products Board to carry out a program of generic promotion, research, and education regarding concrete masonry products.

title: A bill to amend the Endangered Species Act of 1973 to establish a procedure for approval of certain settlements.
sponsers: [Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], None, Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX]]
texts: The court is prohibited from: (1) awarding litigation costs in a citizen suit that is settled by a consent decree, or (2) awarding litigation costs to a plaintiff in a citizen suit that is settled.

title: 21st Century Endangered Species Transparency Act
sponsers: [Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], None, Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX]]
texts: This bill amends the Endangered Species Act of 1973 to require the Department of the Interior or the Department of Commerce, as appropriate, to make publicly available on the Internet the best scientific and commercial data available that are the basis for the determination of whether a species is an endangered species or a threatened species, including each proposed regulation for the listing of a species.

title: Trafficking In Persons Report Integrity Act
sponsers: [Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], None, Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ]]
texts: This bill amends the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000 to revise provisions regarding the Department of State's determination of whether countries are meeting the minimum standards for elimination of human trafficking, including provisions regarding: (1) the State Department's annual Trafficking in Persons Report, (2) additional requirements for meeting minimum standards, (3) actions against governments failing to meet minimum standards, (4) the tier ranking process for meeting such standards, and (5) congressional oversight of such process.

title: Open Book on Equal Access to Justice Act
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], None, Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY]]
texts: This bill amends the Equal Access to Justice Act and the federal judicial code to require the Administrative Conference of the United States to create and maintain online searchable databases with information about the attorney's fees and other expenses awarded to prevailing parties other than the United States in certain: (1) agency-conducted adversary adjudication proceedings, and (2) civil action court cases (excluding tort cases) or settlement agreements to which the United States is a party.

title: ALS Disability Insurance Access Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. texts: This bill amends title II (Old Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to eliminate the five-month waiting period for disability insurance benefits for individuals with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (a progressive neurodegenerative disease, also known as Lou Gehrig's disease, that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord). Under current law, individuals must wait five months after becoming disabled before their disability insurance benefit payments can begin.

title: Outsourcing Accountability Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: This bill amends the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to require an issuer that is registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to disclose to the SEC specified information related to the number of domestic and foreign employees of the issuer and its subsidiaries.

title: NA
sponsers: [Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], None, Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: (Sec. 1) This bill repeals the Act entitled "An Act to confer jurisdiction on the State of Iowa over offenses committed by or against Indians on the Sac and Fox Indian Reservation."

sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. texts: This bill requires the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to develop and maintain a voluntary registry of firefighters to collect history and occupational information that can be linked to existing data in state cancer registries. The registry must be used to improve monitoring of cancer among firefighters and to collect and publish epidemiological information regarding cancer among firefighters. The CDC should seek to include specified information in the registry, including the number and type of fire incidents attended by an individual.

title: Streamlining Energy Efficiency for Schools Act
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], None, Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME]]
texts: This bill amends the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to direct the Department of Energy (DOE), acting through the Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy, to act as the lead federal agency for coordinating and disseminating information on existing federal programs and assistance that may be used to help initiate, develop, and finance energy efficiency, renewable energy, and energy retrofitting projects for schools.

title: New Markets Tax Credit Extension Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Smith, Tina  [D-MN]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) make permanent the new markets tax credit, (2) provide for an inflation adjustment to the limitation amount for such credit after 2016, and (3) allow an offset against the alternative minimum tax for such credit (determined with respect to qualified equity investments initially made after 2016).

title: Energy Savings and Industrial Competitiveness Act
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH]]
texts: This bill revises a variety of programs to encourage energy efficiency in buildings, industry, the federal government, and certain appliances, including by:

title: Judgment Fund Transparency and Terrorism Financing Prevention Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK]]
texts: This bill requires the Department of the Treasury to disclose details after payments are made from the Judgment Fund. (The Judgment Fund is a permanent and indefinite appropriation to pay judgments against the United States.)

title: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Accountability Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], None, Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA]]
texts: This bill amends the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to change the source of funding for the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) from Federal Reserve System transfers to annual appropriations. Under current law, the transfers from the Federal Reserve System permit the CFPB to be funded outside of the annual appropriations process.

title: A bill for the relief of Maha Dakar.
sponsers: [Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: NA

title: KOMBUCHA
sponsers: [Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], None, Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to exempt the production of kombucha for consumption or sale from excise taxes imposed on alcoholic beverages. Kombucha is a beverage that: (1) is fermented solely by a symbiotic culture of bacteria and yeast; (2) contains not more than 1.25% of alcohol by volume; (3) is sold or offered for sale as kombucha; and (4) is derived from sugar, malt or malt substitute, tea, or coffee, and not more than 20% other wholesome ingredients.

title: Buffalo Tract Protection Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM]]
texts: This bill withdraws specified Bureau of the Land Management (BLM) lands in Placitas, New Mexico, from all forms of mineral development under all laws pertaining to mineral leasing or mineral materials, including locatable minerals.

title: African Burial Ground International Memorial Museum and Educational Center Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY]]
texts: This bill establishes the African Burial Ground International Memorial Museum and Educational Center at the African Burial Ground National Monument in New York, New York.

title: S. 392, 400 Years of African-American History Commission Act
sponsers: [Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], None, Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA]]
texts: This bill establishes the 400 Years of African-American History Commission to develop and carry out activities throughout the United States to commemorate the 400th anniversary of the arrival of Africans in the English colonies at Point Comfort, Virginia, in 1619.

title: LEAP Act
sponsers: [Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow employers a business-related tax credit of $1,500 for hiring an apprentice who has not attained age 25 at the close of the taxable year or $1,000 for an apprentice who has attained age 25. The bill allows such credit for no more than two taxable years with respect to any apprentice. An "apprentice" is an employee who is employed in an officially-recognized apprenticeable occupation pursuant to an apprentice agreement registered with the Office of Apprenticeship of the Employment and Training Administration of the Department of Labor or a recognized state apprenticeship agency.

title: Protect Our Military Families' 2nd Amendment Rights Act
sponsers: [Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], None, Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to allow a licensed gun dealer, importer, or manufacturer to sell or ship a firearm to the spouse of a member of the U.S. Armed Forces on active duty. (Current law already allows a licensed dealer, importer, or manufacturer to sell a firearm to a member of the U.S. Armed Forces on active duty.)

title: GPS Act
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR]]
texts: This bill makes it unlawful to intentionally intercept the geolocation information of another person; intentionally disclose or use geolocation information knowing or having reason to know that it was obtained in violation of this bill; or intentionally disclose geolocation information knowing or having reason to know it was obtained as part of a criminal investigation with the intent to improperly obstruct with a duly authorized criminal investigation.

title: A bill to make technical amendments to certain marine fish conservation statutes, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV]]
texts: Under current law, billfish caught by U.S. vessels that land (number or poundage of fish unloaded onshore by commercial fisherman) in Hawaii or Pacific Insular Areas (American Samoa, Baker Island, Guam, Howland Island, Jarvis Island, Johnston Atoll, Kingman Reef, Midway Island, the Northern Mariana Islands, Palmyra Atoll, and Wake Island) may be sold and exported to non-U.S. markets or transported to other U.S. markets.

title: Fair Medicare Hospital Payments Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Shelby, Richard C. [R-AL], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to establish, with respect to hospitals not located in a frontier state, a floor on the area wage adjustment factor for hospital inpatient and outpatient services covered under Medicare. (Such a floor already applies with respect to hospitals located in frontier states.)

title: A bill to direct the Secretary of the Army to provide for modification of certain Federal water resources development projects on the Apalachicola, Chattahoochee, and Flint Rivers, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: The term "freshwater flows" is defined as the quality, quantity, timing, and variability of freshwater flows required to: (1) support and reestablish the ecological integrity of the rivers, commercial and recreational fisheries dependent on freshwater flows into Apalachicola Bay and adjacent waters, and thriving and diverse fish, wildlife, and plant populations similar to those found prior to construction of the projects; (2) restore and recover species that are endangered, threatened, or at risk; and (3) prevent significantly harmful adverse impacts to the Chattahoochee and Apalachicola River ecosystems.

title: Chief Manufacturing Officer Act
sponsers: [Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA]]
texts: This bill: (1) expresses the sense of Congress that a well-designed national manufacturing strategy would benefit the U.S. economy, and (2) directs the President to appoint a United States Chief Manufacturing Officer, which shall be a member of the National Economic Council.

title: Susquehanna National Heritage Area Act
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA]]
texts: This bill establishes the Susquehanna National Heritage Area in Pennsylvania.

title: Appalachian Forest National Heritage Area Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], None, Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV]]
texts: The bill designates the Appalachian Forest Heritage Area, Inc., as the local coordinating entity for the area.

title: A bill to direct the Joint Committee on the Library to enter into an agreement with the Harriet Tubman Statue Commission of the State of Maryland for the acceptance of a statue of Harriet Tubman for display in a prominent location in the United States Capitol.
sponsers: [None, Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD]]
texts: After receiving the statue, the joint committee shall place it in a prominent permanent location in the U.S. Capitol.

title: Health Savings Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to health savings accounts (HSAs), to:

title: A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to improve the process for inspections of device establishments for granting export certifications.
sponsers: [Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN]]
texts: The biannual inspection schedule for medical device establishments handling higher risk devices is replaced with a risk-based schedule. In establishing the risk-based schedule, the FDA must consider an establishment's participation in international medical device audit programs.

title: Stop Taxing Death and Disability Act
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], None, Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude from the gross income of an individual the discharge of student loans or private education loans due to the death or disability of the student.

title: Stopping Mass Hacking Act
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT]]
texts: This bill repeals an amendment to rule 41 (Search and Seizure) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure that took effect on December 1, 2016. The amendment allows a federal magistrate judge to issue a warrant to use remote access to search computers and seize electronically stored information located inside or outside that judge's district in specific circumstances.

sponsers: [Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen.
