texts: NA

title: A bill to prohibit any reduction in the amount of the per diem allowance to which members of the Army, Navy, Air Force, and Marine Corps or civilian employees of the Department of Defense are entitled based on the duration of temporary duty assignments or official travel, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], None, Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI]]
texts: The bill nullifies the DOD policy implemented on November 1, 2014, regarding reductions in per diem allowances based on the duration of temporary duty assignments or civilian travel.

title: DHS Acquisition Authorities Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO]]
texts: This bill amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to designate the Department of Homeland Security's (DHS's) Under Secretary for Management as DHS's Chief Acquisition Officer. Such officer's duties shall include: (1) establishing acquisition policies that implement an approach that takes into account risks of failure to achieve cost, schedule, or performance parameters for all DHS components; and (2) ensuring that each major acquisition program has a DHS-approved acquisition program baseline. The bill specifies criteria governing the Under Secretary's delegation of acquisition decision authority to the relevant Component Acquisition Executive for such programs.

title: A bill to amend the Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010 to extend and expand the pilot program on the use of community-based organizations and local and State government entities to ensure that veterans receive care and benefits for which they are eligible and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: NA

title: Strengthening State and Local Cyber Crime Fighting Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Shelby, Richard C. [R-AL], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL]]
texts: This bill amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to establish within the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) a National Computer Forensics Institute, to be operated by the U.S. Secret Service.

title: Syrian War Crimes Accountability Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL]]
texts: This bill: (1) condemns the violence and human rights violations carried out by the Syrian government and pro-government forces; (2) urges all parties to halt civilian attacks; and (3) calls on the President to support efforts to ensure accountability for war crimes, crimes against humanity, and genocide committed during the conflict.

title: Reducing DHS Acquisition Cost Growth Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], None, Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO]]
texts: This bill amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to require the program manager of a major acquisition program (a Department of Homeland Security [DHS] acquisition program estimated to require an eventual total expenditure of at least $300 million over its life cycle cost) to notify the program's Component Acquisition Executive (CAE) (the senior acquisition official within a DHS component designated to lead a process and staff to provide acquisition and program management oversight, policy, and guidance to ensure that statutory, regulatory, and higher level policy requirements are fulfilled), the head of the component concerned, the Executive Director of the Program Accountability and Risk Management division, the Under Secretary for Management, and the Deputy Secretary of DHS within 30 days after any breach in such program is identified.

title: Second Division Memorial Modification Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: This bill allows the Second Indianhead Division Association, Inc., Scholarship and Memorials Foundation to place additional commemorative elements or engravings on the raised platform or stone work of the Second Division Memorial located in President's Park in the District of Columbia to honor further the members of the Second Infantry Division who have given their lives in service to the United States.

title: Make it in America Act
sponsers: [Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], None, Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI]]
texts: This bill directs the Office for Federal Procurement Policy (OFPP) to promulgate specified regulations to standardize and simplify how federal agencies comply with, report on, and enforce the Buy American Act, including rules to ensure that a project is not disaggregated for purposes of avoiding the applicability of such requirements.

title: Conservation Program Improvement Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Thune, John [R-SD]]
texts: This bill amends the Food Security Act of 1985 to modify the Conservation Reserve Program (CRP) and conservation easement programs administered by the Department of Agriculture (USDA).

title: Disability Integration Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], None, Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY]]
texts: This bill prohibits states or local governments that provide institutional placements for individuals with disabilities who need long-term assistance with daily living activities or health-related tasks, and prohibits insurance providers that fund such long-term services, from denying community-based services that would enable such individuals to live in the community and lead an independent life.

title: Saracini Aviation Safety Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ]]
texts: This bill requires the Federal Aviation Administration to issue an order to require: (1) the installation of secondary barriers, other than the cockpit door, to prevent access to the flight deck of each covered aircraft; (2) such barriers on the aircraft with a cockpit door to remain locked while the aircraft is in flight and the cockpit door separating the flight deck and the passenger area is open; and (3) such barriers on the aircraft without a cockpit door to remain locked as determined by the pilot in command.

title: Tax Filing Simplification Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to require the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) to establish and operate the following programs free of charge:

title: Senior Home Modification Assistance Initiative Act
sponsers: [Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA]]
texts: This bill amends the Older Americans Act of 1965 to direct the Administration on Aging to:

title: Safe Drinking Water Assistance Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], None, Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: NA

title: Social Security Fairness Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Smith, Tina  [D-MN]]
texts: This bill amends title II (Old Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) of the Social Security Act to repeal the "government pension offset" and the "windfall elimination provision." Under current law, those provisions reduce OASDI benefits for individuals who receive a pension based on earnings in government employment that was not covered under the Social Security program.

title: S. 916, Protecting Patient Access to Emergency Medications Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], None, Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA]]
texts: This bill amends the Controlled Substances Act to direct the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) to register an emergency medical services (EMS) agency to administer controlled substances if the agency submits an application demonstrating that it is authorized to conduct such activity in the state in which the agency practices. The DEA may deny an application if it determines that the registration is inconsistent with the public interest.

title: Silver Star Service Banner Day Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO]]
texts: This bill designates May 1 as Silver Star Service Banner Day.

title: End Government Shutdowns Act
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS]]
texts: This bill provides specified continuing appropriations to prevent a government shutdown if any appropriations measure for a fiscal year has not been enacted or a joint resolution making continuing appropriations is not in effect after the fiscal year begins. The appropriations are provided to continue to fund programs, projects, and activities for which funds were provided in the preceding fiscal year.

title: S. 920, National Clinical Care Commission Act
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], None, Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: This bill establishes within the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) a National Clinical Care Commission to evaluate and make recommendations regarding improvements to the coordination and leveraging of federal programs related to complex metabolic or autoimmune diseases that result from issues related to insulin and represent a significant disease burden (e.g., diabetes). The commission must report on: (1) HHS programs that focus on prevention, (2) current activities and gaps in federal efforts to support clinicians in providing integrated care, (3) improvement in federal education and awareness activities related to prevention and treatment, and (4) methods for outreach and dissemination of education and awareness materials.

title: Duty First Act
sponsers: [Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], None, Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS]]
texts: This bill requires the Department of the Treasury to issue up to 20,000 $5 gold coins, 100,000 $1 silver coins, and 200,000 half-dollar clad coins, emblematic of the 100-year anniversary of the 1st Infantry Division.

title: Climate Change Adapt America Fund Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL]]
texts: This bill requires the Department of the Treasury to issue climate change obligations. The proceeds from the debt obligations must be deposited in the Adapt America Fund established by this bill within the Department of Commerce.

title: Reforming Finance for Local Economies Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA]]
texts: This bill exempts banks, credit unions, and savings associations with $10 billion or less in total consolidated assets from all regulations issued under the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act.

title: National Security Diversity and Inclusion Workforce Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], None, Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD]]
texts: This bill requires each national security agency to make available to the public, appropriate congressional committees, and the national security agency workforce a report on its diversity and inclusion efforts. The bill defines "diversity" as diversity of persons based on gender, race, ethnicity, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, and other demographic categories.

title: VETS Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], None, Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA]]
texts: This bill allows a licensed health care professional of the Department of Veterans Affairs to practice his or her profession using telemedicine at any location in any state, regardless of where the professional or patient is located.

title: Global War on Terrorism War Memorial Act
sponsers: [Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI]]
texts: This bill allows the Global War on Terror Memorial Foundation to establish the National Global War on Terrorism Memorial as a commemorative work on federal land in the District of Columbia to commemorate and honor the members of the Armed Forces who served on active duty in support of the Global War on Terrorism.

title: Patents for Humanity Program Improvement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: This bill allows the holder or successor of an acceleration certificate issued pursuant to the Patents for Humanity Program (a pilot awards program established by the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office [USPTO] entitling awardees to accelerate certain USPTO proceedings for patented technologies addressing humanitarian needs among an impoverished population or for further research on humanitarian technologies) to transfer, including by sale, the entitlement to such certificate to another person.

title: Therapeutic Fraud Prevention Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV]]
texts: This bill prohibits sexual orientation or gender identity conversion therapy from being provided in exchange for compensation. It bars advertisements for such therapy that claim to: (1) change an individual's sexual orientation or gender identity, (2) eliminate or reduce sexual or romantic attractions or feelings toward individuals of the same gender, or (3) be harmless or without risk.

title: S. 929, Invest in Rural Small Business Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], None, Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: This bill amends the Small Business Act to modify the definition of qualified Historically Underutilized Business Zone (HUBZone) small business concern to reduce from 35% to 33% the number of a small firm's employees required to live within a HUBZone.

title: Western Area Power Administration Transparency Act
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME]]
texts: This bill directs the Western Area Power Administration (WAPA)to establish a pilot project to provide increased transparency for its customers.

title: A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 4910 Brighton Boulevard in Denver, Colorado, as the "George Sakato Post Office".
sponsers: [None, Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: NA

title: Budgetary Accuracy in Scoring Interest Costs Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT]]
texts: This bill amends the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974 to require any cost estimates prepared by the Congressional Budget Office or the Joint Committee on Taxation to include the cost of servicing the public debt.

title: Express Appeals Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to: (1) carry out a five-year pilot program to provide the option of an alternative appeals process to determine appeals of claims for disability compensation more quickly, and (2) inform claimants about such program.

title: FDA Reauthorization Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA]]
texts: Prescription Drug User Fee Amendments of 2017

title: Endangered Species Management Self-Determination Act
sponsers: [Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT]]
texts: This bill amends the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (ESA) to require the Department of the Interior and the Department of Commerce to obtain the consent of each state for adding species to the list of threatened or endangered plants and animals when the species is present in the state.

title: Northern Rockies Ecosystem Protection Act
sponsers: [Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT]]
texts: This bill designates specified National Forest System lands, National Park System lands, and public lands in Idaho, Montana, Oregon, Washington, and Wyoming as wilderness and as components or additions to existing components of the National Wilderness Preservation System.

title: Adoption Tax Credit Refundability Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to make the tax credit for adoption expenses refundable.

title: Procurement Fraud Prevention Act
sponsers: [Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO]]
texts: This bill directs the General Services Administration to establish procedures to ensure that any notice regarding registration of a small business concern in a procurement system contains information about cost-free federal procurement technical assistance services that are available through the Small Business Administration, Procurement Technical Assistance Centers of the Defense Logistics Agency, the Department of Commerce, and other federal agencies and programs.

title: EL CHAPO Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX]]
texts: This bill requires the forfeited profits of Joaquin Archivaldo Guzman Loera (El Chapo) from his illicit drug trafficking enterprise to be reserved for border security measures between the United States and Mexico, including the completion of a wall.

title: SEAL Act
sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to loans made from a qualified employer plan, to: (1) extend the period for repayment of loans if a plan terminates or a plan participant becomes unemployed, and (2) prohibit qualified employer plans from making loans using credit cards or any other similar arrangement.

title: Yellowstone Gateway Protection Act
sponsers: [Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: This bill withdraws specified National Forest System land in the Custer Gallatin National Forest in Park County, Montana, identified on the map titled "Emigrant Crevice Proposed Withdrawal Area," dated November 10, 2016, from: (1) location, entry, and patent under mining laws; and (2) disposition under all laws pertaining to mineral and geothermal leasing.

title: Counterterrorism Screening and Assistance Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill expresses the sense of Congress that: (1) the U.S. government must ensure that capacity-building assistance to combat terrorist travel is coordinated among agencies as well as with foreign implementing partners, and (2) such assistance should be prioritized for the highest-risk countries for travel by terrorists and foreign fighters.

title: NA
sponsers: [Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI]]
texts: This bill requires the Department of the Interior to provide an updated and ongoing count of eligible Indian students for the Johnson-O'Malley Program (JOM Program) to ensure full participation of all qualified students. (The JOM Program awards contracts to support the cultural and academic needs of Native American students.)

title: American Renewable Fuel and Job Creation Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. texts: The bill: (1) makes the credits available to domestic producers of the fuels rather than the policy under current law of providing a mixture credit to the blender of the fuel, (2) increases the income tax credit for certain small biodiesel producers, and (3) extends the credits through 2020.

title: New HOPE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME]]
texts: This bill amends the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 to require state leadership activities funded by the Act to include consulting and coordinating with other state agencies for the identification, consolidation, or elimination of licenses or certifications that pose an unnecessary barrier to entry for aspiring workers and provide limited consumer protection.

title: Veterans Treatment Court Improvement Act of 2018
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], None, Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI]]
texts: This bill requires the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to hire at least 50 Veterans Justice Outreach Specialists, place each one at an eligible VA medical center, and ensure that each one serves as part of a justice team in a veterans treatment court or other veteran-focused court.

title: TICKETS Act
sponsers: [Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV], Sen. texts: This bill prohibits an air carrier from denying the boarding of a flight by a passenger who has been cleared to board, without the passenger's consent, unless such passenger presents a safety, security, or health risk.

title: America's Red Rock Wilderness Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. texts: This bill designates specified lands in the following areas of Utah as components of the National Wilderness Preservation System: (1) Great Basin, (2) Grand Staircase-Escalante, (3) Moab-La Sal Canyons, (4) Henry Mountains, (5) Glen Canyon, (6) San Juan-Anasazi, (7) Canyonlands Basin, (8) San Rafael Swell, and (9) Book Cliffs and Uinta Basin.

title: Wildland Firefighter Recognition Act
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR]]
texts: This bill requires the Office of Personnel Management to develop a distinct wildland firefighter occupational series. The series must apply to the following positions:

title: Wildland Firefighter Fairness Act
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR]]
texts: This bill requires the Departments of the Interior and Agriculture to work with states and the Workforce Development Committee of the National Wildfire Coordinating Group to merge the Incident Qualification System and the Incident Qualification and Certification System into a single system by September 30, 2025.

title: Regulatory Accountability Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC]]
texts: This bill codifies and revises notice-and-comment rulemaking procedures to require federal agencies to consider: (1) whether a rulemaking is required by statute or is within the discretion of the agency, (2) whether existing federal laws or rules could be amended or rescinded to address the problem, and (3) reasonable alternatives for a new rule.

title: End Banking for Human Traffickers Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK]]
texts: This bill amends the Victims of Trafficking and Violence Protection Act of 2000 to add the Secretary of the Treasury as a member of the President's Interagency Task Force to Monitor and Combat Trafficking. The task force must submit to Congress recommendations for the revision of anti-money laundering programs to specifically target money laundering related to human trafficking.

title: White House Visitor Logs Transparency Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to require the following records created or maintained by the U.S. Secret Service in carrying out protective services to be made available to the public upon request:

title: Tyler Clementi Higher Education Anti-Harassment Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], None, Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA]]

title: Paying a Fair Share Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to require an individual taxpayer whose adjusted gross income exceeds $1 million (high-income taxpayer) to pay a minimum tax rate of 30% of the excess of the taxpayer's adjusted gross income over the taxpayer's modified charitable contribution deduction for the taxable year (tentative fair share tax). The amount of the tax is the excess (if any) of the tentative fair share tax over the excess of: (1) the sum of the taxpayer's regular tax liability, the alternative minimum tax (AMT) amount, and the payroll tax for the taxable year; over (2) certain tax credits.

title: OCEAN Act
sponsers: [Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], None, Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA]]
texts: This bill amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to limit the President's authority to prohibit oil and gas leasing on the outer Continental Shelf.

title: Access to Contraception for Women Servicemembers and Dependents Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE]]
texts: This bill expands the TRICARE health care program to entitle additional female beneficiaries and dependents to care related to the prevention of pregnancy. (Currently, such care is limited to certain female members of the uniformed service or a reserve component performing active duty or certain servicewomen performing inactive-duty training.)

title: Coral Reef Sustainability Through Innovation Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE]]
texts: This bill amends the Coral Reef Conservation Act to authorize the 12 federal agencies on the U.S. Coral Reef Task Force, which includes the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, to carry out, either individually or cooperatively, prize competitions that promote coral reef research and conservation. The prize competitions should be designed to help the United States achieve its goal of developing new and effective ways to advance the understanding, monitoring, and sustainability of coral reef ecosystems.

title: Protection of Social Security Benefits Restoration Act
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to prohibit the application of, and repeal authority for, administrative offsets to Social Security, railroad retirement, and black lung benefits. (An administrative offset is the withholding of funds payable by or held by the United States to satisfy a debt.)

title: Preserving Data in Government Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], None, Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI]]
texts: This bill requires that any open government data that is made available to the public for at least 90 consecutive days must: (1) remain machine-readable, available in an open format, and part of the worldwide public domain or, if necessary, be published with an open license; and (2) not be altered in such a way as to decrease its machine-readable nature.

title: Using Evidence to Move Welfare Recipients into Work Act
sponsers: [Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN]]
texts: This bill amends title IV (Temporary Assistance for Needy Families) (TANF) of the Social Security Act to direct the Department of Health and Human Services, in consultation with the Department of Labor, to develop a database of projects that have used a proven or promising approach in moving TANF recipients into work. The database shall be called the "What Works Clearinghouse of Proven and Promising Projects to Move Welfare Recipients into Work."

title: Empowering State Forestry to Improve Forest Health Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: This bill amends the Cooperative Forestry Assistance Act of 1978 to direct the Forest Service to establish a landscape-scale restoration program to provide financial and technical assistance for landscape-scale restoration projects on state and private forest lands that maintain or improve benefits from trees and forests on such lands.

title: Social Impact Partnerships to Pay for Results Act
sponsers: [Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE]]
texts: This bill allows the Department of the Treasury to enter into agreements with state and local governments for social-impact partnership projects for which federal funds shall be awarded only if a project achieves certain agreed-upon outcomes resulting in both social benefit and federal savings. In carrying out these agreements, Treasury must consult with the Federal Interagency Council on Social Impact Partnerships and the Commission on Social Impact Partnerships (both newly established by the bill). Treasury may transfer to another federal agency the authority to administer the agreements.

title: MY DATA Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT]]
texts: This bill prohibits providers of Internet broadband services or of Internet content, applications, or devices from using unfair or deceptive acts or practices relating to privacy or data security.

title: Cruise Passenger Protection Act
sponsers: [Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Transportation (DOT) to determine whether any of the enumerated rights in the international cruise line passenger bill of rights (adopted by the members of the Cruise Lines International Association) is enforceable under federal law.

title: National Historic Vehicle Register Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: This bill directs the National Park Service (NPS) to establish and maintain a National Historic Vehicle Register which shall include: (1) a narrative describing each historic vehicle and its historical significance, (2) a photographic record of the vehicle, and (3) a line drawing or engineering drawing of the vehicle. Such register shall be archived in the Library of Congress.

title: Medicare Ambulance Access, Fraud Prevention, and Reform Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA]]
texts: NA

title: Veterans Access to Care Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to automatically designate medical facilities of the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) as health professional shortage areas.

title: Supporting Children of the National Guard and Reserve Act
sponsers: [Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], None, Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: NA

title: Newborn Care Improvement Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC]]
texts: This bill increases from 7 to 14 the number of days that the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) may furnish health care services, including post-delivery care, to the newborn child of a woman veteran who delivered the child in a VA facility or another facility pursuant to a VA contract for such services.

title: REPAIR Act
sponsers: [Sen. Thune, John [R-SD]]
texts: NA

title: Nicaraguan Investment Conditionality Act (NICA) of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA]]
texts: This bill directs the President to instruct the U.S. Executive Director at each international financial institution to use U.S. influence to oppose any loan for the government of Nicaragua's benefit, other than for basic human needs or to promote democracy, unless the Department of State certifies that Nicaragua is taking effective steps to:

title: Tennessee Wilderness Act
sponsers: [Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN]]
texts: This bill designates specified federal lands in Cherokee National Forest in Tennessee as wilderness and as additions to the National Wilderness Preservation System.

title: CREATES Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME]]

sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]

sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC]]
texts: This bill authorizes each member state under the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement (the multistate agreement for the administration and collection of sales and use taxes adopted on November 12, 2002) to require all sellers not qualifying for a small-seller exception (applicable to sellers with annual gross receipts in total U.S. remote sales not exceeding $1 million) to collect and remit sales and use taxes with respect to remote sales under provisions of the agreement, but only if such agreement includes minimum simplification requirements relating to the administration of the tax, audits, and streamlined filing.

title: Medicare Home Health Flexibility Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD]]
texts: This bill establishes circumstances under which an occupational therapist may conduct an initial or comprehensive assessment for an individual who is eligible for home health services under Medicare. Specifically, an occupational therapist may conduct the assessment if the physician's referral order does not include skilled nursing care but does include: (1) occupational therapy, and (2) physical therapy or speech language pathology.

title: Recognizing Achievement in Classified School Employees Act
sponsers: [Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Education (ED) to grant "Recognizing Inspirational School Employees (RISE)" awards to classified public school employees, within certain occupational specialties, who provide exemplary service to students in prekindergarten through higher education.

title: A bill for the relief of Arturo Hernandez-Garcia.
sponsers: [Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO]]
texts: NA

title: Rural Access to Hospice Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. [D-DE], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to allow payment under Medicare for certain services furnished to hospice patients by rural health clinics and federally qualified health centers (FQHCs).

title: A bill to require the Secretary of Energy to establish an energy efficiency materials pilot program.
sponsers: [Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], None, Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: The bill reduces the authorization of appropriations for the zero net energy commercial buildings initiative for FY2018.

title: Speak Up to Protect Every Abused Kid Act
sponsers: [Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], None, Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA]]
texts: This bill amends the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act to direct the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to make grants to eligible entities to carry out educational campaigns and provide evidence-based or evidence-informed training regarding state laws for mandatory reporting of incidents of child abuse or neglect.

title: Helping to Encourage Real Opportunities (HERO) for At-Risk Youth Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to the work opportunity tax credit, to:

title: Creating Pathways for Youth Employment Act
sponsers: [Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL]]
texts: This bill amends the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act to authorize the Department of Labor to make available the following amounts for youth employment programs:

title: A bill to prohibit the Secretary of the Interior from revising the approved oil and gas leasing program for fiscal years 2017 through 2022.
sponsers: [Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. texts: NA

title: Fairness for Our Hospitals Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to allow a hospital that meets specified criteria and is located in a state with no rural areas to be considered a Medicare-dependent hospital. The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services shall establish and implement a process for reimbursing impacted hospitals for any underpayments resulting from this bill's implementation.

title: 100 by '50 Act
sponsers: [Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI]]
texts: This bill calls for the United States to aggressively reduce carbon pollution as rapidly as practicable and achieve 100% clean and renewable energy by 2050.

title: Agriculture Environmental Stewardship Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow energy tax credits through 2021 for investments in: (1) qualified biogas property, or (2) qualified manure resource recovery property. The bill also permits new clean renewable energy bonds to be used for such properties.

title: Ensuring Children's Access to Specialty Care Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to include pediatric subspecialties in primary health services for purposes of the National Health Service Corps (NHSC). Psychiatrists who are pediatric subspecialists are included in behavioral and mental health professionals. (These amendments make pediatric subspecialists, including psychiatrists, eligible for the NHSC fellowship program for the delivery of primary health services in health professional shortage areas, the NHSC Scholarship Program, and the NHSC Loan Repayment Program.)

title: MGT Act
sponsers: [Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA]]
texts: This bill authorizes each of specified agencies for which there are Chief Financial Officers to establish an information technology system modernization and working capital fund to:

title: Stop Arctic Ocean Drilling Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA]]
texts: This bill declares that it is the policy of the United States that the Arctic Ocean should be managed for the best interests of the people of the United States, including by keeping fossil fuels in the ground to avoid the dangerous impacts of climate change.

title: Veteran Overmedication Prevention Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN]]
texts: This bill requires the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to contract with the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine to review the deaths of all covered veterans who died by suicide during the last five years, regardless of whether information relating to such deaths has been reported by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. A "covered veteran" is any veteran who received VA hospital care or medical services during the five-year period preceding the veteran's death.

title: Restoring Internet Freedom Act
sponsers: [Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA]]
texts: This bill nullifies the rule adopted by the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) on February 26, 2015, relating to the reclassification of broadband Internet access service as a telecommunications service.

title: Protecting Religiously Affiliated Institutions Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to modify prohibitions with respect to intentionally defacing, damaging, or destroying religious real property.

title: Spokane Tribe of Indians of the Spokane Reservation Equitable Compensation Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA]]
texts: This bill establishes the Spokane Tribe of Indians Recovery Trust Fund to compensate the Spokane Business Council for the use of tribal lands for the generation of hydropower from the Grand Coulee Dam.

title: Flexibility for Working Families Act
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA]]
texts: This bill allows an employee to request from an employer a temporary or permanent change in the terms or conditions of the employee's employment if the request relates to: (1) the number of hours the employee is required to work, (2) the times when the employee is required to work or be on call for work, (3) where the employee is required to work, or (4) the amount of notification the employee receives of work schedule assignments. The bill sets forth certain employer duties with respect to such requests.

title: Moving Americans Privacy Protection Act
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY]]
texts: This bill amends the Tariff Act of 1930 to revise requirements regarding the public disclosure of personally identifiable information contained in the manifest of vessels or aircraft entering any U.S. port or place to direct the U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) to ensure that any such information, including social security numbers, passport numbers, and residential addresses, are removed from any manifest signed and transmitted to the CBP before it is disclosed to the public.

title: COAST Anti-Drilling Act
sponsers: [Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL]]
texts: This bill amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to prohibit the Department of the Interior from issuing a lease or other authorization for the exploration, development, or production of oil, natural gas, or any other mineral in the Mid-Atlantic, South Atlantic, North Atlantic, or the Straits of Florida planning areas.

title: Protecting America's Workers Act
sponsers: [Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA]]
texts: This bill amends the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 (OSHA) to increase the scope of the Act by applying its coverage to federal, state, and local government employees. However, the bill makes OSHA inapplicable to working conditions covered by the Federal Mine Safety and Health Act of 1977.

title: Ambulatory Surgical Center Quality and Access Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to: (1) require the payment system for ambulatory surgical center (ASC) services to feature certain positive annual adjustments equivalent to those made with respect to hospital outpatient department (OPD) services; (2) revise quality reporting requirements to permit publicly available, side-by-side comparisons of quality measures for ASCs and OPDs in the same geographic area; and (3) require the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), when excluding requested procedures from the list of those approved to be performed in ASCs, to cite specified reasons for doing so.

sponsers: [None, Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: Specifically, such compendia shall include compendia that, as determined by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services: (1) are used by health care providers and utilized nationwide by the health insurance industry, (2) have a publicly available policy on disclosures of conflicts of interest,  and (3) are accepted by at least one state board of pharmacy or equivalent licensing body.

title: Modernization of Derivatives Tax Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to modify the tax treatment of derivatives. A "derivative" is any contract (including any option, forward contract, futures contract, short position, swap, or similar contract) the value of which, or any payment or other transfer with respect to which, is (directly or indirectly) determined by reference to another specified item.

texts: This bill amends federal copyright law to require the President, with the advice and consent of the Senate, to appoint a Register of Copyrights from a list of at least three individuals recommended by a panel composed of:

title: Mahan Air and Terrorism Prevention Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Homeland Security to submit an annual report to Congress through 2020 that includes: (1) a list of all airports at which aircraft owned or controlled by Mahan Air (a Tehran-based commercial airline under U.S. sanctions) have landed during the preceding two years; and (2) for each such airport, an assessment of whether such aircraft continue operations at that airport, an assessment of whether any of the landings were emergency landings, a determination of whether additional security measures should be imposed on flights to the United States that originate from that airport, and an explanation of the rationale for such determination.

title: New Mexico Drought Preparedness Act of 2017
sponsers: [None, Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM]]
texts: This bill directs the Bureau of Reclamation to carry out a water acquisition program in specified basins in New Mexico, under which the bureau shall: (1) make acquisitions of water by lease or purchase of water rights or contractual entitlements from willing lessors or sellers, consistent with the Rio Grande Compact and applicable state and federal law; and (2) take other actions to enhance stream flow to benefit fish and wildlife, water quality, and river ecosystem restoration and to enhance stewardship and conservation of working land, water, and watersheds.

title: Gigabit Opportunity Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to authorize the designation of qualified gigabit opportunity zones in low-income communities and to provide tax incentives for investments in the zones.

title: PAWS Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Strange, Luther [R-AL], Sen. Kennedy, John [R-LA], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], None, Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to carry out a five-year pilot program under which it awards grants to eligible nonprofit organizations to provide service dogs to veterans who suffer from post-traumatic stress disorder after completing other evidence-based treatment.

title: National Suicide Hotline Improvement Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: This bill requires the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to coordinate with the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration and to consult with the Department of Veterans Affairs to examine: (1) the feasibility of designating a three-digit dialing code for a national suicide prevention and mental health crisis hotline system; and (2) the effectiveness of the current National Suicide Prevention Lifeline (1-800-273-TALK), including how well it addresses the needs of veterans.

Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) set forth a special rule for the inclusion in gross income of partnership interests transferred in connection with the performance of services, (2) treat as ordinary income the net capital gain with respect to an investment services partnership interest except to the extent such gain is attributable to a partner's qualified capital interest, (3) exempt income from investment services partnership interests from treatment as qualifying income of a publicly traded partnership, (4) exempt certain family partnerships from the application of this bill; (5) increase the penalty for underpayments of tax resulting from failure to treat income from an investment services partnership interest as ordinary income, and (6) include income and loss from an investment services partnership interest for purposes of determining net earnings from self-employment and applicable self-employment taxes.

title: United States Coast Guard Commemorative Coin Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], None, Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of the Treasury to mint and issue in commemoration of the U.S. Coast Guard: (1) $5 gold coins, (2) $1 silver coins, and (3) half-dollar clad coins.

title: MISSION ZERO Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], None, Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to require the Office of the Assistant Secretary for Preparedness and Response to award grants to certain trauma centers to enable military trauma care providers and trauma teams to provide trauma care and related acute care at those trauma centers. Funds may be used to train and incorporate military trauma care providers into the trauma center, including expenditures for malpractice insurance, office space, information technology, specialty education and supervision, trauma programs, and state license fees. Grantees must allow the military trauma care providers to be deployed for military operations, training, or response to a mass casualty incident.

title: Tropical Forest Conservation Reauthorization Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI]]

title: Crowdfunding Enhancement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: This bill amends the Securities Act of 1933 to allow a crowdfunding issuer to sell shares through a crowdfunding vehicle. (Crowdfunding is a method of capital formation in which groups of people pool money either to invest in a company or to support an effort by others to accomplish a specific goal.)

title: National Forest Good Neighbor Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS]]
texts: This bill amends the Cooperative Forestry Assistance Act of 1978 to authorize the Department of Agriculture (USDA) to enter into good neighbor agreements with states to carry out specified similar and complementary forest, rangeland, and watershed restoration services on certain National Forest System (NFS) lands.

title: A bill to amend the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 to provide for stewardship contracting projects, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS]]
texts: The bill states that the land management goals of a project may include: (1) road and trail maintenance or obliteration to restore or maintain water quality; (2) soil productivity, habitat for wildlife and fisheries, or other resource values; (3) setting of prescribed fires to improve the composition, structure, condition, and health of stands or to improve wildlife habitat; (4) removing vegetation or other activities to promote healthy forest stands, reduce fire hazards, or achieve other land management objectives; (5) watershed restoration and maintenance; (6) restoration and maintenance of wildlife and fish; or (7) control of noxious and exotic weeds and reestablishing native plant species.

title: Agricultural Worker Program Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Harris, Kamala D. [D-CA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NJ]]
texts: This bill authorizes the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to confer blue card status upon an alien who: (1) has performed specified periods of U.S. agricultural employment or is a qualifying alien's spouse or child, (2) has been physically present in the United States for a qualifying period, (3) applied for such status during the application period, (4) is not ineligible under specified grounds for such status, (5) has passed security and law enforcement clearances, and (6) has paid the required fees and penalties.

title: PROSPERS Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Van Hollen, Chris [D-MD], Sen. texts: This bill amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) to specify that states and certain political subdivisions may establish and administer voluntary payroll deduction retirement savings programs for private sector employees that are not considered employee pension benefit plans or pension plans covered by ERISA if the plans meet certain requirements.

title: Marine Energy Act
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI]]
texts: This bill amends the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 to revise and reauthorize through FY2022 the program of research, development, demonstration, and commercial application to accelerate the introduction of marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy production. The program must give priority to fostering accelerated research, development, and commercialization of technology.

title: FAIR Fees Act
sponsers: [Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Transportation to prescribe regulations: (1) prohibiting an air carrier from imposing any specified fees relating to a flight in interstate air transportation that are unreasonable or disproportional to the costs it incurs, and (2) establishing standards for assessing whether such fees are reasonable and proportional to those costs.

title: A bill to indemnify local law enforcement entities for complying with valid detainers issued by immigration officers.
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ]]
texts: Subject to available appropriations, the Department of Homeland Security shall be responsible to pay the costs of any legally-cognizable injuries to third parties by any state or local law enforcement officer resulting from a request from Immigration and Customs Enforcement to temporarily detain an alien or transport the alien to a federal detention center.

title: State Sponsored Visa Pilot Program Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ]]
texts: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to establish a three-year renewable nonimmigrant W-visa for state-sponsored aliens (and their spouses and children) coming temporarily to the United States to reside in a state to perform services, provide capital investment, direct an enterprise, or otherwise contribute to the state's economic development.

title: Florida Shores Protection and Fairness Act
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the Gulf of Mexico Energy Security Act of 2006 to include Florida in the Gulf of Mexico Outer Continental Shelf revenue sharing program.(Currently, only Alabama, Louisiana, Mississippi, and Texas are included in the program.)

title: Eastern Nevada Economic Development and Land Management Improvement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Cortez Masto, Catherine  [D-NV]]
texts: This bill amends the Lincoln County Land Act of 2000 (LCLA) to require implementation of a multispecies habitat conservation plan in Lincoln County, Nevada.

title: Lumbee Recognition Act
sponsers: [Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC]]
texts: This bill amends the Act of June 7, 1956, to extend federal recognition to the Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina and make its members eligible for the services and benefits provided to members of federally recognized tribes.

title: Enhanced Clinical Trial Design Act of 2017
sponsers: [Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], None, Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT]]
texts: This bill requires the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), in coordination with the National Institutes of Health, to convene a meeting to discuss clinical trial inclusion and exclusion criteria. The FDA must report on the meeting and issue guidance regarding eligibility criteria for clinical trials.

title: Opioid Addiction Risk Transparency Act
sponsers: [Sen. Hassan, Margaret Wood [D-NH], Sen. Young, Todd C. [R-IN]]
texts: NA

title: Chinese-American World War II Veteran Congressional Gold Medal Act
sponsers: [Sen. Duckworth, Tammy [D-IL], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen.
