Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI]]
texts: Prohibits the wages or other remuneration earned by an employee who performs employment duties in more than one state from being subject to income tax in any state other than: (1) the state of the employee's residence, and (2) the state within which the employee is present and performing employment duties for more than 30 days during the calendar year. Exempts employers from withholding of tax and information reporting requirements for employees not subject to income tax under this Act. Allows an employer, for purposes of determining penalties related to employer withholding or reporting requirements, to rely on an employee's annual determination of the time such employee will spend working in a state in the absence of fraud or collusion by such employee.

title: Safe Skies for Unmanned Aircraft Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], None, Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: This bill requires the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration, for purposes of determining whether an unmanned aircraft (drone) used for aeronautical research qualifies as a public aircraft, to use definitions under federal aviation safety law for determining whether the aircraft is used for:

title: AWARE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Reid, Harry [D-NV], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA]]
texts: This bill amends the Animal Welfare Act to apply standards for humane treatment to farm animals at federal research or laboratory animal facilities.

title: All Students Count Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Reid, Harry [D-NV], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], None, Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI]]
texts: Amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to require information on the annual state report cards on student achievement at each proficiency level to be disaggregated by the same major racial groups as the decennial census of the population. (Currently, that information is to be disaggregated by race, but the racial groups are not specified.)

title: Making Public Land Public Access Act
sponsers: [Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: Requires the Department of the Interior and the Department of Agriculture (USDA) to ensure that a specified portion of the Land and Water Conservation Fund is allocated to secure recreational public access to existing federal public land that has significantly restricted access for hunting, fishing, and other recreational purposes. Requires Interior and USDA to annually develop a priority list for sites for such funds.

title: National Right-to-Work Act
sponsers: [Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK]]
texts: Amends the National Labor Relations Act and the Railway Labor Act to repeal those provisions that permit employers, pursuant to a collective bargaining agreement that is a union security agreement, to require employees to join a union as a condition of employment (including provisions permitting railroad carriers to require, pursuant to such an agreement, payroll deduction of union dues or fees as a condition of employment).

title: Stop Drugs at the Border Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV]]
texts: Directs the Office of National Drug Control Policy to ensure that the first update of the National Southwest Border Counternarcotics Strategy published after enactment of this Act specifically addresses any increased heroin and methamphetamine trafficking occurring along the international border between the United States and Mexico.

title: Berryessa Snow Mountain National Monument Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA]]
texts: Establishes the Berryessa Snow Mountain National Monument, to consist of federal land and interests in federal land within Napa, Lake, Mendocino, Solano, Glenn, Colusa, and Yolo counties in California.

title: Depreciation Fairness Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], None, Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to make permanent the 15-year recovery period for qualified leasehold improvement property, qualified restaurant property, and qualified retail improvement property for purposes of the tax deduction for depreciation.

title: Medicare Residential Care Coordination Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO]]
texts: Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to establish and implement a demonstration project under titles XVIII (Medicare) and XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act to evaluate the use of capitated payments made to eligible continuing care retirement communities for residential care coordination programs.

title: Proprietary Education Oversight Coordination Improvement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA]]
texts: Establishes the Proprietary Education Oversight Coordination Committee to:

title: Foreign Earnings Reinvestment Act
sponsers: [Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) extend the election allowed to a domestic corporation to deduct current and accumulated dividends received from a controlled foreign corporation to the corporation's last taxable year beginning before the enactment of this Act or the first taxable year which begins during the one-year period beginning on such enactment date, (2) reduce tax rates on foreign earnings of domestic corporations that reinvest such earnings in the United States and that expand their payrolls over 2014 levels, and (3) increase the taxable income of domestic corporations that fail to maintain employment levels in the 23-month period after receiving a reduction in tax rates under this Act.

title: Chiropractic Care Available to All Veterans Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], None, Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS]]
texts: Amends the Department of Veterans Affairs Health Care Programs Enhancement Act of 2001 to require a program under which the Secretary of Veterans Affairs provides chiropractic care and services to veterans through Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) medical centers and clinics to be carried out at: (1) no fewer than 75 medical centers by December 31, 2016, and (2) all medical centers by December 31, 2018.

title: Budget and Accounting Transparency Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE]]
texts: This bill amends the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to revise the budgetary treatment of federal loans and loan guarantees to account for them on a fair value basis. Under a fair value approach, costs are measured using market rates rather than the lower Treasury interest rates currently used.

title: Notice for Organizations That Include Charities is Essential (NOTICE) Act
sponsers: [Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD]]
texts: NA

title: Lawsuit Abuse Reduction Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: Amends the sanctions provisions in Rule 11 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure to require the court to impose an appropriate sanction on any attorney, law firm, or party that has violated, or is responsible for the violation of, the rule with regard to representations to the court. Requires any sanction to compensate parties injured by the conduct in question.

title: STEM Master Teacher Corps Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ]]
texts: Amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to direct the Secretary of Education to award competitive matching grants to consortia of local educational agencies (LEAs) or states, acting in partnership with institutions of higher education or nonprofit organizations to establish a STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics) Master Teacher Corps program.

title: North Country National Scenic Trail Route Adjustment Act
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND]]
texts: This bill amends the National Trails System Act to revise the authorized route of the North Country National Scenic Trail to extend it to the Appalachian Trail in Vermont and to modify the route in northeastern Minnesota.

title: Child Interstate Abortion Notification Act
sponsers: [Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], None, Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: Amends the federal criminal code to prohibit transporting a minor child across a state line to obtain an abortion (deems such transporting to be a de facto abridgment of the right of a parent under any law in the minors state of residence that requires parental involvement in the minors abortion decision). Makes an exception for an abortion necessary to save the life of the minor.

title: Bipartisan Sportsmen's Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: This bill revises a variety of existing programs to expand access to, and opportunities for, hunting, fishing, and recreational shooting.

title: Disaster Assistance Recoupment Fairness Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], None, Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ]]
texts: Requires the Federal Emergency Management Agency to: (1) waive a debt owed to the United States related to federal assistance provided under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to an individual or household in relation to a major disaster declared by the President between January 1, 2012, and the date of enactment of this Act, unless the debt involves fraud, the intentional presentation of a false claim, or intentional misrepresentation by the debtor or any party having an interest in the claim; and (2) reimburse a debtor for any payments already made on such a debt.

title: Large Capacity Ammunition Feeding Device Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA]]
texts: Amends the Brady Handgun Violence Prevention Act to prohibit the importation, sale, manufacture, transfer, or possession, in or affecting interstate or foreign commerce, of a large capacity ammunition feeding device.

title: Empowering Jobs Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to tax-exempt enterprise zone facility bonds and empowerment zones, to: (1) include as employees of a qualified business entity employees who are residents of an empowerment zone, an enterprise community, or a qualified low-income community; and (2) extend the period of designation for empowerment zones through December 31, 2016 (thus extending the eligibility of such zones for certain tax benefits).

title: Military Sex Offender Reporting Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], None, Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC]]
texts: Amends the Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act to direct the Department of Defense to provide to the Attorney General information required under such Act to be provided by a sex offender or by the jurisdiction in which an offender registers for inclusion in the National Sex Offender Registry regarding persons who are: (1) released from military corrections facilities or convicted if the sentences adjudged by courts-martial under the Uniform Code of Military Justice do not include confinement, and (2) required to register under such Act.

title: Building upon Unique Indian Learning and Development Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM]]
texts: Directs the Department of the Interior to establish a contest to encourage institutions of higher education (IHEs) to consider how to improve Indian school facilities.

title: Natural Gas Gathering Enhancement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], None, Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY]]
texts: Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to grant a right of way for natural gas pipelines through a unit of the National Park System for a maximum term of 30 years, and a maximum width of 50 feet.

title: Success Act
sponsers: [Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI]]
texts: Amends part A of title I (Improving the Academic Achievement of the Disadvantaged) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (ESEA) to require local educational agencies (LEAs) to work with public and private state and local entities to provide children and families with services that are integrated with services from specialized instructional support personnel and LEA homeless liaisons to address the academic and nonacademic factors that affect student achievement.

title: Government Settlement Transparency and Reform Act
sponsers: [Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to expand provisions relating to the nondeductibility of fines and penalties to prohibit a tax deduction for any amount paid or incurred to any governmental entity relating to the violation of any law or the investigation or inquiry into a potential violation of law. Exempts from such prohibition: (1) restitution or amounts paid to come into compliance with any law that was violated or otherwise involved in the investigation or inquiry, (2) amounts paid pursuant to a court order in a suit in which the governmental entity was not a party, and (3) amounts paid or incurred as taxes due. Imposes new reporting requirements on governmental entities relating to amounts paid as fines or for restitution.

title: California Desert Conservation and Recreation Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA]]
texts: Amends the California Desert Protection Act of 1994 to, among other things: (1) establish or designate national monuments, wilderness areas, a special management area, off-highway vehicle recreation areas, a national scenic area, and an area of critical environmental concern; (2) release specified wilderness study areas; (3) adjust national park and preserve boundaries; and (4) specify land withdrawals, exchanges, and acquisitions.

title: IDEA MOE Adjustment Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM]]
texts: Amends the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act to alter the formula for reallocating the federal special education funding that is denied to states that reduce their level of special education funding from one fiscal year to the next.

title: Pregnant and Parenting Students Access to Education Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM]]
texts: Authorizes the Secretary of Education to make formula grants to states and, through them, competitive subgrants to local educational agencies (LEAs) to establish or enhance educational programs and related services that enable expectant and parenting students to enroll in, attend, and succeed in school.

title: Rural Spectrum Accessibility Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS]]
texts: Directs the Federal Communications Commission to establish a program under which a wireless carrier receiving a license under specified provisions of the Communications Act of 1934 may partition or disaggregate the license in order to make unused spectrum available to small carriers or carriers serving certain rural areas.

title: Promoting Health as Youth Skills in Classrooms and Life Act
sponsers: [Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD]]
texts: Amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to include health education and physical education in the definition of "core academic subjects."

title: STEM 2 Act
sponsers: [Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM]]
texts: Amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to direct the Secretary of Education to award competitive planning grants to states, Indian tribes or tribal organizations, nonprofit organizations, or institutions of higher education (IHEs) to develop effective state or tribal science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) networks that coordinate STEM education efforts by: (1) facilitating communication and collaboration among public and private STEM stakeholders, and (2) identifying STEM occupational skills needed in the future.

title: Protecting Volunteer Firefighters and Emergency Responders Act
sponsers: [Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude services rendered by bona-fide volunteers providing firefighting and prevention services, emergency medical services, or ambulance services to a state or local government or a tax-exempt charitable organization from the category of services usually rendered by an employee of an applicable large employer subject to the mandate to provide minimum essential health care coverage under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA), thus exempting such employers from PPACA requirements with respect to such volunteers.

title: Federal Communications Commission Process Reform Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to require the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to establish procedural rules concerning: (1) public notices for rulemakings, petitions, and applications; (2) minimum periods for comments and replies; (3) FCC Commissioners' deliberations; and (4) the FCC reports, decisions, budgets, and other agency documents to be made publicly available in the Federal Register or on the FCC's website.

title: A bill to amend title 31, United States Code, to clarify the use of credentials by enrolled agents.
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: NA

title: Privacy Notice Modernization Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: Amends the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act to exempt from its annual written privacy policy notice requirement any financial institution which: (1) provides nonpublic personal information only in accordance with specified requirements, (2) has not changed its policies and practices with respect to disclosing nonpublic personal information from those disclosed in the most recent disclosure sent to consumers, and (3) otherwise provides customers access to such most recent disclosure in electronic or other form permitted by specified regulations.

title: Wi-Fi Innovation Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: Requires the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to provide additional unlicensed spectrum in the 5850-5925 megahertz band under technical rules suitable for the widespread commercial development of unlicensed operations.

title: Jason Simcakoski Memorial Act
sponsers: [Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], None, Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR]]
texts: Reauthorizes Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) homeless veterans reintegration programs through FY2020. Includes among those for whom job training, counseling, and placement services are to be provided to expedite their reintegration into the labor force: (1) veterans participating in the VA supported housing program for which rental assistance is provided under the United States Housing Act of 1937, (2) Indians who are veterans receiving assistance under the Native American Housing Assistance and Self Determination Act of 1996, and (3) veterans who are transitioning from being incarcerated.

title: Small Business Regulatory Flexibility Improvements Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH]]
texts: This bill modifies the rule making requirements and procedures of federal agencies (excluding Congress, U.S. courts, U.S. territories and possession, and the District of Columbia) under the Regulatory Flexibility Act of 1980 (RFA) and the Small Business Regulatory Enforcement Fairness Act of 1996 (SBREFA). The definition of "rule" under RFA is expanded to include all agency rules, except for rules that pertain to the protection of the rights of, or benefits for, veterans or rules of particular (and not general) applicability relating to rates, wages, and other financial indicators. Under a new definition of "economic impact," agencies are required to consider any direct economic effect of a proposed rule on small entities and any indirect economic effect on small entities that is reasonably foreseeable and that results from such rule.

title: DRIVE LESS Act
sponsers: [Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], None, Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: Requires the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to determine: (1) the total number of civilian vehicles purchased and leased by each executive agency in FY2010, (2) the total dollar amount obligated by each executive agency to purchase and to lease civilian vehicles in FY2010, and (3) the amount that would be 20% less than such total dollar amount. Prohibits each executive agency from obligating more than the reduced dollar amount for FY2010 to purchase and lease civilian vehicles in each of FY2016-FY2020. Exempts the purchase or procurement of any vehicle determined by the President to be essential for reasons of national security.

title: Stabilize Medicaid and CHIP Coverage Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], None, Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: Amends title XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act (SSAct) to require a state Medicaid plan to provide 12-month continuous enrollment for an eligible individual, regardless of age.

title: Family-Based Foster Care Services Act
sponsers: [Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], None, Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI]]
texts: Amends title XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act to extend medical assistance coverage to therapeutic foster care services.

title: Protecting Children from Electronic Cigarette Advertising Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY]]
texts: Prohibits electronic cigarette advertisements that appeal to children younger than 18 years of age in states in which the sale of an electronic cigarette to such children is prohibited by federal or state law. Bars electronic cigarette advertisements, promotions, or marketing in those states in a manner that is: (1) known, or should be known, to contribute toward initiating or increasing the use of electronic cigarettes by children under 18; or (2) determined by the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to affect or appeal to such children regardless of when or where the advertising, promotion, or marketing occurs.

title: Internet Tax Freedom Forever Act
sponsers: NA
texts: Amends the Internet Tax Freedom Act to make permanent the ban on state and local taxation of Internet access and on multiple or discriminatory taxes on electronic commerce.

title: Small Business Fairness in Health Care Act
sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code, as amended by the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA), to: (1) exempt a small business concern, as defined by the Small Business Act, from the PPACA employer mandate to provide employees with minimum essential health care coverage; and (2) redefine "full-time employee," for purposes of such mandate, as an employee who is employed on average at least 40 (currently, 30) hours a week.

title: Currency Undervaluation Investigation Act
sponsers: [Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], None, Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL]]
texts: Amends the Tariff Act of 1930 to require the administering authority, upon the filing of a petition by an interested party, to initiate a countervailing duty investigation or review to determine whether currency undervaluation by the government of, or any public entity within, a foreign country is providing, directly or indirectly, a countervailable subsidy to its exporters or products.

title: Security Clearance Accountability, Reform, and Enhancement Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: Deems a federal agency employee to be unfit for federal employment if the agency determines that the employee has engaged in misconduct affecting the integrity of a background investigation, including falsification of any information relating to such an investigation (covered misconduct). Prohibits an individual who has engaged in covered misconduct from being appointed to or continuing to occupy a position that requires the performance of background investigations.

title: State Marriage Defense Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL], Sen. Shelby, Richard C. [R-AL], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], None, Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX]]
texts: Prohibits, for purposes of determining the meaning of any Act of Congress or of any ruling, regulation, or interpretation of U.S. administrative bureaus and agencies as applied with respect to individuals domiciled in a state or in any other territory or possession of the United States: (1) the term "marriage" from including any relationship that the state, territory, or possession does not recognize as a marriage; and (2) the term "spouse" from including an individual who is a party to a relationship that is not recognized as a marriage by that state, territory, or possession.

title: SAFE PLAY Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ]]
texts: Amends the Public Health Service Act to require the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to develop public education and awareness materials and resources concerning cardiac health, including:

title: Improved National Monument Designation Process Act
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], None, Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: Before a national monument can be designated on public land, the President must obtain congressional approval, certify compliance with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (NEPA), and receive notice from the governor of the state in which the monument is to be located that the state legislature has enacted legislation approving its designation.

title: S. 438, IRRIGATE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], None, Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY]]
texts: Establishes the Indian Irrigation Fund from which the Commissioner of Reclamation may make expenditures to carry out this Act. Requires the Secretary of the Treasury to deposit into such Fund for each of FY2015-FY2036 specified amounts of revenues that would otherwise be deposited in the reclamation fund established by the Reclamation Act of 1902. Terminates the Fund on September 30, 2036, and requires the unexpended and unobligated balance to be transferred to the reclamation fund.

title: Student Non-Discrimination Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Reid, Harry [D-NV], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL]]
texts: Prohibits public school students from being excluded from participating in, or subject to discrimination under, any federally-assisted educational program on the basis of their actual or perceived sexual orientation or gender identity or that of their associates.

title: Veterinary Medicine Loan Repayment Program Enhancement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], None, Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude from gross income payments under the federal veterinary medicine loan repayment program or any other state loan repayment or forgiveness program that is intended to provide for increased access to veterinary services in such state.

title: Traditional Cigar Manufacturing and Small Business Jobs Preservation Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], None, Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: Amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to exempt traditional large and premium cigars from regulation by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and from user fees assessed on tobacco products by the FDA.

title: Innovation Inspiration School Grant Program Act
sponsers: [Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Reid, Harry [D-NV], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], None, Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: Authorizes the Secretary of Education to award competitive matching grants to local educational agencies (LEAs) through an Innovation Inspiration grant program to: (1) promote science, technology, engineering (including robotics), and mathematics (STEM) in secondary schools and after school programs; (2) support the participation of secondary school students in nontraditional STEM teaching methods; and (3) broaden secondary school students' access to STEM careers.

title: A bill to prohibit the long-term storage of rail cars on certain railroad tracks unless the Surface Transportation Board has approved the rail carrier's rail car storage plan.
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: NA

title: Supporting Afterschool STEM Act
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR]]
texts: Requires the Director of the National Science Foundation (NSF) to establish an afterschool STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) grant program awarding competitive grants to afterschool or STEM networks to:

title: Simplifying Access to Student Loan Information Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: Amends the Truth in Lending Act to require private educational lenders to submit to the Secretary of Education information regarding each private education loan they make.

title: Right Start Child Care and Education Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) increase the rates and maximum allowable amount of the tax credit for employer-provided child care facilities; (2) increase the eligibility threshold amount and rate of the household and dependent care tax credit and make such credit refundable; (3) allow a new $2,000 tax credit for child care providers who hold a bachelor's degree in early childhood education, child care, or a related degree and who provide at least 1,200 hours of child care services in a taxable year; and (4) increase the tax exclusion for employer-provided dependent care assistance.

title: Jury ACCESS Act
sponsers: [Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], None, Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: Amends the federal judicial code to prohibit the exclusion of citizens from service as a grand or petit juror in U.S. district courts or the Court of International Trade on account of sexual orientation or gender identity (thereby expanding the current prohibition on exclusion on account of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or economic status).

title: Veterans TRICARE Choice Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS]]
texts: Allows an individual who is eligible to participate in the TRICARE program (a Department of Defense [DOD] managed health care program) to: (1) elect to be ineligible to enroll in such program, (2) make tax deductible contributions to a health savings account during the period such individual elects to be ineligible for TRICARE coverage, and (3) enroll in the TRICARE program at a later date during a special enrollment period.

title: A bill to reduce recidivism and increase public safety.
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: Amends the federal criminal code to require a presentence report to include: (1) information about the defendant's history of substance abuse and addiction; (2) information about the defendant's service in the Armed Forces and veteran status; and (3) a detailed plan that the probation officer determines will reduce the likelihood that the defendant will abuse drugs or alcohol, will reduce the defendant's likelihood of recidivism by addressing the defendant's specific recidivism risk factors, and will assist the defendant in preparing for reentry into the community.

title: Tobacco Tax Equity Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], None, Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to the excise tax on tobacco products, to tax pipe tobacco, smokeless tobacco products, and large cigars at the same level as cigarettes. Revises the definition of "tobacco products," for purposes of such tax, to include any other product determined to be a tobacco product by the Food and Drug Administration. Makes smokeless tobacco products sold in discrete single-use units subject to an excise tax of $50.33 per thousand. Provides for an inflation adjustment in calendar years beginning after 2015 to the dollar amounts of tobacco products subject to the excise tax.

title: Enhancing Education Through Technology Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], None, Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI]]
texts: Replaces part D (Enhancing Education Through Technology) of title II of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (ESEA) with a new part D (Achievement Through Technology and Innovation).

title: Defense of Ukraine Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX]]
texts: This bill authorizes the President to provide lethal weapons to the government of Ukraine in order to defend itself against Russian-backed rebel separatists in eastern Ukraine.

title: Veteran Emergency Medical Technician Support Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], None, Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA]]
texts: Amends the Public Health Service Act to direct the Department of Health and Human Services to establish a demonstration program for states with a shortage of emergency medical technicians (EMTs) to streamline state requirements and procedures to assist veterans who completed military EMT training to meet state EMT certification, licensure, and other requirements.

title: ExaSCALE Computing Leadership Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL]]
texts: Renames the Department of Energy High-End Computing Revitalization Act of 2004 as the Exascale Computing for Science, Competitiveness, Advanced Manufacturing, Leadership, and the Economy Act of 2015.

title: Innovators Job Creation Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], None, Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a qualified small business to elect to use a portion of its tax credit for increasing research expenditures as an offset against its payroll tax liability under the Federal Insurance Contributions Act.

title: Cyber Threat Sharing Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE]]
texts: Amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to permit private entities to: (1) disclose lawfully obtained cyber threat indicators to a private information sharing and analysis organization and the national cybersecurity and communications integration center (NCCIC); and (2) receive indicators disclosed by private entities, the federal government, or state or local governments.

title: Civil Rights Voting Restoration Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Reid, Harry [D-NV]]
texts: Declares that the right of a U.S. citizen to vote in any election for federal office shall not be denied or abridged because the individual has been convicted of a non-violent criminal offense, unless, at the time of the election, the individual is serving a sentence in a correctional facility or a term of probation.

title: Emergency Port of Entry Personnel and Infrastructure Funding Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX]]
texts: Directs the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to hire, train, and assign to duty, by September 30, 2020: (1) 5,000 additional full-time U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) officers to serve on all inspection lanes and enforcement teams at U.S. land ports of entry on the northern and southern borders; and (2) 350 full-time support staff for all U.S. ports of entry.

title: Provider Tax Administrative Simplification Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR]]
texts: Requires the Secretary of Health and Human Services to approve a waiver of the uniform tax requirement (whether or not the tax is broad based), regardless of whether the state concerned satisfies certain requirements, for any state with a provider tax that does not apply to continuing care retirement communities or life care communities that: (1) have no beds certified to provide medical assistance under title XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act, or (2) do not provide services for which Medicaid payment may be made.

title: Drinking Water Protection Act
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: This bill amends the Safe Drinking Water Act to direct the Environmental Protection Agency to develop and submit to Congress a strategic plan for assessing and managing risks associated with algal toxins in drinking water provided by public water systems. Cyanobacteria, also known as blue-green algae, have the ability to produce cyanotoxins, or algal toxins. When certain conditions are favorable, algae can rapidly multiply causing blooms, or dense surface scums, that may be toxic.

title: Cross-Border Trade Enhancement Act of 2016
sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], None, Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM]]
texts: Authorizes the Commissioner of U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) to enter into agreements with certain persons for the CBP to provide customs, agricultural processing, border security, or inspection-related immigration services at a land border port of entry, subject to payment of a fee to reimburse the CBP for providing such services.

title: Safe and Secure Drinking Water Protection Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: This bill requires the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to develop and publish within 180 days a health advisory with recommendations on: (1) the level of microcystins (toxins produced by freshwater cyanobacteria, also known as blue-green algae) in drinking water that is safe for human consumption; (2) feasible treatment techniques and other means for achieving a safe level; and (3) standardized procedures for testing for microcystins in drinking water.

title: A bill to amend the Federal Crop Insurance Act to prohibit the paying of premium subsidies on policies based on the actual market price of an agricultural commodity at the time of harvest.
sponsers: [None, Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ]]
texts: NA

title: Native Hawaiian Education Reauthorization Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: Amends the Native Hawaiian Education Act to revise the duties and composition of the Native Hawaiian Education Council. (The Native Hawaiian Education Council coordinates the educational and related services and programs available to Native Hawaiians.)

title: Thomasina E. Jordan Indian Tribes of Virginia Federal Recognition Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA]]
texts: Extends federal recognition to the following Indian tribes of Virginia and establishes their relationship with the federal government as described below: (1) the Chickahominy Tribe, (2) the Chickahominy Indian Tribe--Eastern Division, (3) the Upper Mattaponi Tribe, (4) the Rappahannock Tribe, Inc., (5) the Monacan Indian Nation, and (6) the Nansemond Indian Tribe.

title: S. 466, Quality Care for Moms and Babies Act
sponsers: [Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], None, Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI]]
texts: Amends title XI of the Social Security Act (SSAct) to direct the Secretary of Health and Human Services, as part of the pediatric quality measures program and the Medicaid Quality Measurement Program (MQMP), to: (1) review certain quality measures endorsed under the Medicare program under SSAct XVIII that relate to the care of childbearing women and newborns, particularly with respect to their application to the programs under SSAct title XIX (Medicaid) and XXI (State Children's Health Insurance Program) (CHIP), identifying omissions and deficiencies in such applications; (2) develop and publish a set of maternity care quality measures for the Medicaid and CHIP programs in accordance with specified requirements; and (3) review the Mother and Infant Care (MIC) quality measures and develop, on an ongoing basis, any modifications of, or additions to, them that reflect the development, testing, validation, and consensus process.

title: CORRECTIONS Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN]]
texts: Directs the Department of Justice (DOJ) to: (1) conduct a review of recidivism reduction programming and productive activities, including prison jobs, offered in correctional institutions; (2) conduct a survey to identify products currently manufactured overseas that could be manufactured by prisoners without reducing job opportunities for other U.S. workers; and (3) submit to the House and Senate Committees on Appropriations and the Judiciary a strategic plan for the expansion of recidivism reduction programming and productive activities, including prison jobs, in Bureau of Prison facilities.

title: Sage-Grouse and Mule Deer Habitat Conservation and Restoration Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT]]
texts: This bill provides a categorical  exclusion under the National Environmental  Policy Act of 1969 (NEPA) for a vegetation management project by the  Bureau of Land  Management or the Forest Service involving removal or  treatment of  any Pinyon or Juniper tree to conserve or restore the  habitat of the greater sage-grouse or mule deer.

title: Women Veterans and Families Health Services Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], None, Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA]]
texts: Directs the Department of Defense (DOD) to furnish fertility treatment and counseling, including through the use of assisted reproductive technology, to a spouse, partner, or gestational surrogate of a severely wounded, ill, or injured member of the Armed Forces who has an infertility condition incurred or aggravated while serving on active duty in the Armed Forces.

title: Safeguarding Classrooms Hurt by ObamaCare's Obligatory Levies
sponsers: [Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude any elementary or secondary school, state or local educational agency, and institution of higher education from the definition of "applicable large employer" for purposes of the employer mandate to provide health care coverage for employees.

title: Women Veterans Access to Quality Care Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: Directs the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to: (1) establish standards to ensure that all VA medical facilities have the structural characteristics necessary to adequately meet the gender-specific health care needs of veterans at such facilities, including privacy, safety, and dignity; (2) integrate such standards into its prioritization methodology with respect to requests for funding major medical facility projects and major medical facility leases; and (3) report on such standards, including regarding the facilities that fail to meet such standards and the costs of projects and leases required to meet them.

title: Douglas County Conservation Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Reid, Harry [D-NV]]
texts: Directs the Forest Service to convey approximately 67 acres of certain Forest Service land (Lake Tahoe-Nevada State Park) to the state of Nevada to be used for the conservation of wildlife or natural resources or for a public park.

title: SONG Act
sponsers: [Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM]]
texts: Expresses the sense of the Senate that the federal programs most critical to improving child well-being should be fully funded.

title: Protecting Students from Sexual and Violent Predators Act
sponsers: [Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], None, Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA]]
texts: Requires states that receive funds under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (ESEA) to:

title: Sugar Reform Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], None, Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: This bill revises the Department of Agriculture (USDA) sugar program to decrease price support levels and make other modifications.

title: School Principal Recruitment and Training Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN]]
texts: Amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to establish a principal recruitment and training grant program awarding renewable, matching grants to states, local educational agencies (LEAs), educational service agencies, nonprofit organizations, institutions of higher education, and partnerships of those entities to recruit, prepare, place, and support principals in eligible schools.

title: Firearms Manufacturers and Dealers Protection Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK]]
texts: This bill declares that funds appropriated or otherwise made available, including amounts derived from any fee or other source, are denied to the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, the Department of Justice, or any other federal agency to carry out Operation Choke Point or any other program designed to discourage the provision or continuation of credit or the processing of payments by financial institutions for dealers and manufacturers of firearms and ammunition.

title: Career Ready Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: Amends the school improvement program under part A of title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to allow states to include certain career readiness indicators in their determination as to whether students are making adequate yearly progress toward state academic performance standards.

title: A bill to amend the National Trails System Act to direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study on the feasibility of designating the Chief Standing Bear National Historic Trail, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [None, Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE]]
texts: Requires Interior to consider input from owners of private land within or adjacent to such study area.

title: National All Schedules Prescription Electronic Reporting Reauthorization Act of 2016
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME]]
texts: Amends the National All Schedules Prescription Electronic Reporting Act of 2005 to include as a purpose of state-administered controlled substance monitoring systems ensuring access to prescription history information for the investigative purposes of appropriate law enforcement, regulatory, and state professional licensing authorities.

title: Improving Regulatory Transparency for New Medical Therapies Act
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act and the Public Health Service Act to delay the effective date of approval of a drug, biological product, or animal drug for which the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) recommends controls under the Controlled Substances Act until the Department of Justice (DOJ) issues a final interim rule for the drug. This delay also applies to conditional approval and indexing of animal drugs.

title: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Examination and Reporting Threshold Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA]]
texts: Amends the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to raise the examination threshold that brings an insured depository institution or insured credit union within its supervisory purview from assets of $10 billion or more to assets of $50 billion or more.

title: Ensuring Patient Access and Effective Drug Enforcement Act of 2016
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA]]
texts: Amends the Controlled Substances Act to define: (1) "factors as may be relevant to and consistent with the public health and safety," for purposes of the Attorney General's determination of whether registering an applicant to manufacture or distribute a controlled substance in schedule I or II is in the public interest, as factors that are relevant to and consistent with the findings of such Act; and (2) "imminent danger to the public health or safety," for purposes of the suspension of such a registration, to mean that in the absence of an immediate suspension order, controlled substances will continue to be distributed or dispensed by a registrant who knows or should know, through fulfilling the obligations of the registrant under such Act, that the dispensing is outside the usual course of professional practice, that the distribution or dispensing poses a present or foreseeable risk of adverse health consequences or death due to the abuse or misuse of the controlled substances, or that the controlled substances will continue to be diverted outside of legitimate distribution channels.

title: PATIENTS Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: Prohibits the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) from using data obtained from comparative effectiveness research, including any conducted or supported using funds appropriated under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 or authorized or appropriated under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, to deny or delay coverage of an item or service under a federal health care program.

title: APPROVAL Act
sponsers: NA
texts: This bill amends the Energy Policy Act of 2005 to prohibit the Secretary of Energy and the Administrators of the Western Area Power Administration and of the Southwestern Power Administration from using the power of eminent domain to implement modernization of electricity transmission infrastructure, unless they have received explicit permission to do so by: (1) the state governor and the head of each applicable public utility commission or public service commission of the affected state, and (2) the head of the governing body of each Indian tribe whose land would be affected.

title: Head Start on Vaccinations Act
sponsers: [Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA]]
texts: Amends the Head Start Act to prohibit the enrollment of a child in a Head Start or Early Head Start program unless the child's parent or guardian: (1) provides the program with information establishing that the child is vaccinated in accordance with the pediatric vaccine list; or (2) submits a signed agreement to provide such information and consents to the provision, by a program employee or other health care provider, of any vaccines on the pediatric vaccine list that the child has not yet received. Requires that information to be provided on an annual basis in order for a child to maintain enrollment in such program.

title: Fire-Damaged Home Rebuilding Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA]]
texts: Amends the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 to allow local variances for certain residential structures substantially damaged by a fire or other disaster, not including a flood, in a covered area having special flood hazards.

title: A bill to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to allow physician assistants, nurse practitioners, and clinical nurse specialists to supervise cardiac, intensive cardiac, and pulmonary rehabilitation programs.
sponsers: [Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: NA

title: Low Value Shipment Regulatory Modernization Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], None, Sen. Thune, John [R-SD]]
texts: Expresses the sense of Congress that the United States Trade Representative should encourage other countries, through bilateral, regional, and multilateral fora, to establish commercially meaningful de minimis values for express and postal shipments of articles that are exempt from customs duties and certain entry documentation requirements, as appropriate.

title: Federal Land Freedom Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill permits a state that has an established leasing, permitting, and regulatory program to: (1) declare to the Secretaries of the Interior, of Agriculture, and of Energy that it has either established or amended the program; and (2) seek to transfer to itself, and to implement, existing federal responsibilities for leasing, permitting, and regulating oil, natural gas, and other forms of energy development.

title: Freedom to Export to Cuba Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. [D-CO]]
texts: This bill repeals or amends current laws restricting trade with Cuba.

title: No Child Left Inside Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI]]
texts: Amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (ESEA) to direct the Secretary of Education to award grants to states and, through them, competitive subgrants to eligible partnerships to support the implementation of state environmental literacy plans that include environmental education standards and teacher training.

title: Balanced Budget Accountability Act
sponsers: [Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], None, Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: Requires each house of Congress to adopt a concurrent budget resolution for a fiscal year which provides that, for each fiscal year for which a budget is provided under the resolution (beginning by FY2025), total outlays do not exceed total receipts and are not more than 18% of the gross domestic product for such fiscal year.

title: Authorizing Alaska Production Act
sponsers: [Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK]]
texts: Authorizes the exploration, leasing, development, production, and economically feasible and prudent transportation of oil and gas in and from the Coastal Plain of Alaska.

title: Mortgage Finance Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA]]
texts: Appoints the Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA) receiver of the Federal National Mortgage Association (Fannie Mae) and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (Freddie Mac) (government sponsored enterprises or GSEs) and places them into irrevocable receivership, effective on the date on which the Mortgage Finance Agency (MFA) established by this Act is operational and able to perform the guarantee function for qualified mortgage-backed securities collateralized by qualified residential mortgages.

title: A bill to prohibit the use of any Federal funds to finalize, implement, or enforce the proposed rule entitled "Standards for the Growing, Harvesting, Packing, and Holding of Produce for Human Consumption".
sponsers: [Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID]]
texts: NA

texts: Requires certain employers, who employ 15 or more employees for each working day during 20 or more workweeks a year, to permit each employee to earn at least 1 hour of paid sick time for every 30 hours worked.

sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. texts: Amends the federal criminal code to authorize a person who is not prohibited from possessing, transporting, shipping, or receiving a firearm under federal law, who is entitled and not prohibited from carrying a concealed firearm in his or her state of residence or who is carrying a valid state license or permit to carry a concealed weapon, and who is carrying a government-issued photographic identification document, to carry a concealed handgun (which has been shipped or transported in interstate or foreign commerce, other than a machine gun or destructive device) in any state in accordance with the restrictions of that state.

title: Social Security Disability Insurance and Unemployment Benefits Double Dip Elimination Act
sponsers: [Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], None, Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT]]
texts: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to declare that for any week in whole or in part within a month that an individual is paid or determined to be eligible for unemployment compensation he or she shall be deemed to have engaged in substantial gainful activity and so be disqualified from receiving Social Security disability benefits after a certain period has elapsed.

title: State Mineral Revenue Protection Act
sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: Amends the Mineral Leasing Act to direct the Secretary of the Interior, on the request of a state (other than Alaska) and in lieu of any payments to the state under the Federal Oil and Gas Royalty Management Act of 1982 (FOGRMA), to convey to the state all right, title, and interest in and to the percentage specified in the FOGRMA for that state of all amounts otherwise required to be paid into the Treasury from sales, bonuses, royalties (including interest charges), and rentals for all public land or deposits located in the state. (Current law requires payment to a state of 50% of all money derived from such sales, bonuses, royalties, and rentals.)

title: New Mexico Navajo Water Settlement Technical Corrections Act
sponsers: [Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM]]
texts: Amends the Omnibus Public Land Management Act of 2009 to expand the current authorization for the construction or rehabilitation and operation and maintenance of conjunctive use wells in the San Juan River Basin, Little Colorado River Basin, and Rio Grande Basin in New Mexico to include the planning and design of those wells.

texts: Amends the federal criminal code to direct the court to impose a sentence for specified controlled substance offenses without regard to any statutory minimum sentence if the court finds that the criminal history category for the defendant is not higher than category two. (Currently, the court may disregard the statutory minimum if the defendant does not have more than one criminal history point.)

title: Haitian Partnership Renewal Act
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the Caribbean Basin Economic Recovery Act to extend: (1) the 60% applicable percentage requirement for duty-free entry of apparel articles assembled in Haiti and imported from Haiti or the Dominican Republic to the United States, and (2) duty-free entry of such articles through December 19, 2030.

texts: This bill amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (commonly known as the Clean Water Act) to expand the purpose of the Act to include achieving the goals established in the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative Action Plan and the Great Lakes Regional Collaboration Strategy.

texts: Amends the National Labor Relations Act to declare that neither its prohibition against interference by an employer with employees' right to bargain collectively, nor the terms of a collective bargaining agreement entered into between employees and an employer after enactment of this Act, shall prohibit an employer from paying an employee higher wages, pay, or other compensation than the agreement provides for.

title: FLAME Act Amendments of 2015

texts: Amends the FLAME Act of 2009 to revise how the FLAME Funds for the Department of the Interior and the Department of Agriculture (USDA) are funded.

texts: Establishes the African Burial Ground International Memorial Museum and Educational Center at the African Burial Ground National Monument in New York, New York.

texts: Amends title IV (21st Century Schools) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to establish a new part D, entitled "the Promise Neighborhoods Act of 2015."

title: Sequestration Relief Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL]]
texts: This bill amends the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to revise the discretionary spending limits for FY2016 and FY2017 and eliminate spending reductions required by sequestration. Current law requires a sequestration, or automatic across-the-board spending cuts, to enforce deficit reduction requirements.

title: Every Child Counts Act
sponsers: [Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA]]
texts: Amends the school improvement program under part A of title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to allow states to establish alternate academic achievement standards and assessments for students who have the most significant cognitive disabilities.

texts: This bill extends the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Program through FY2016 at FY2011 funding levels. This Program provides payments to state jurisdictions to compensate for the cost of providing services in tax-exempt federal lands within such jurisdictions.

sponsers: [Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD]]
texts: Requires each state to develop for approval a state highway stormwater management program consisting of management measures to prevent, reduce, or control highway runoff from federal-aid highway projects.

texts: Directs the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a special resource study of the President Street Station, a railroad terminal in Baltimore, Maryland, to evaluate the terminal's national significance and determine its feasibility for designation as a unit of the National Park System.

title: COMPETE Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to the tax credit for research expenditures, to: (1) increase the rate of such credit to 25% of so much of the taxpayer's qualified research expenses in a taxable year as exceeds 50% of the average expenses for the three preceding taxable years; (2) allow such credit for the basic research expenditures of educational institutions, scientific research organizations, and certain grant organizations; and (3) make such tax credit, as revised by this Act, permanent.

title: Idaho Safe and Efficient Vehicle Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID]]
texts: Prohibits application of federal weight limitations to a longer combination vehicle operating on a segment of the Interstate System in Idaho if it: (1) has a gross vehicle weight of 129,000 pounds or less; and (2) complies with certain single axle, tandem axle, and bridge formula weight limits.

title: School Food Modernization Act
sponsers: [Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA]]
