Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: Includes as part of the Republic of Vietnam its territorial seas for purposes of the presumption of service connection for diseases associated with exposure by veterans to certain herbicide agents while in Vietnam.

title: Preserving Access to Manufactured Housing Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL], Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], None, Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN]]
texts: Amends the Truth in Lending Act to revise the exclusion from the meaning of "mortgage originator" of any employee of a retailer of manufactured homes who does not for compensation or gain take residential mortgage loan applications, for compensation or gain offer or negotiate terms of a residential mortgage loan, or advise a consumer on loan terms (including rates, fees, and other costs).

title: Compassionate Access, Research Expansion, and Respect States Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN]]
texts: Amends the Controlled Substances Act (CSA) to provide that control and enforcement provisions of such Act relating to marijuana shall not apply to any person acting in compliance with state law relating to the production, possession, distribution, dispensation, administration, laboratory testing, or delivery of medical marijuana.

title: Homeless Veterans Prevention Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], None, Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC]]
texts: Increases the per diem payment for transitional housing assistance for homeless veterans who are placed in housing that will become permanent upon the termination of such assistance to a maximum of 150% of the per diem rate authorized for veterans receiving domiciliary care in state homes.

title: Autocycle Safety Act
sponsers: [Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA]]
texts: This bill defines "autocycle" as a motor vehicle with three wheels, an enclosed occupant compartment, and a steering wheel, which meets applicable federal motor vehicle safety standards.

title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a limitation on certain aliens from claiming the earned income tax credit.
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR]]
texts: NA

title: American Dream Accounts Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE]]
texts: Authorizes the Secretary of Education to award competitive grants to eligible entities so each can establish and administer American Dream Accounts for a group of at least 30 low-income public school students who, at the time the entities apply for a grant, are attending a grade no higher than ninth grade.

title: Establishing Beneficiary Equity in the Hospital Readmission Program Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act (SSAct) with respect to the hospital readmissions reduction program under the inpatient (hospital) prospective payment system (IPPS).

title: Sports Medicine Licensure Clarity Act
sponsers: [Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA]]
texts: Provides that for purposes of medical professional liability insurance or civil and criminal malpractice liability determinations, a physician or athletic trainer (covered sports medicine professional) who is authorized to practice medicine in a state (primary state) and who provides medical services to an athlete or athletic team in a state where such professional is not authorized to practice (secondary state) shall be deemed to have provided such medical services in the primary state, provided that prior to providing the covered medical services such professional has disclosed the nature and extent of such services to the entity that provides such professional with medical professional liability insurance in the primary state.

title: Local School Board Governance and Flexibility Act
sponsers: [Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID]]
texts: Expresses the sense of Congress that: (1) the responsibility for education resides with the states and the local educational agencies (LEAs) to which they have delegated authority; and (2) the Secretary of Education should only issue those regulations, rules, guidance materials, grant conditions, or other requirements that are specifically needed to implement federal legislation and are within LEAs' educational, operational, and financial capacity.

title: Nuclear Waste Informed Consent Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Reid, Harry [D-NV]]
texts: This bill prohibits the Nuclear Regulatory Commission from authorizing construction of a nuclear waste repository unless the Secretary of Energy has entered into an agreement to host the repository with the following entities:

title: A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 442 East 167th Street in Bronx, New York, as the "Herman Badillo Post Office Building".
sponsers: [Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY]]
texts: NA

title: Lena Horne Recognition Act
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI]]
texts: Directs the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the President pro tempore of the Senate to arrange for the posthumous presentation of a Congressional Gold Medal in commemoration of Lena Horne in recognition of her achievements and contributions to American culture and the civil rights movement.

title: Future Logging Careers Act
sponsers: [Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME]]
texts: Amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to make the restrictions on oppressive child labor inapplicable to employment of an employee age 16 or 17 by a parent, or a person standing in place of a parent, in a logging or mechanized operation owned or operated by that parent or person.

title: Dignified Interment of Our Veterans Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA]]
texts: Requires the Secretary of Veterans Affairs (VA) to study and report to Congress on matters relating to the interring of veterans' unclaimed remains in national cemeteries under the control of the National Cemetery Administration, including:

title: Next Generation High Schools Act
sponsers: [Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR]]
texts: Directs the Secretary of Education to award competitive grants to local educational agencies (LEAs) or charter schools that partner with at least one institution of higher education, at least one community-based partner, and a qualified intermediary to provide high school students with challenging, engaging, and relevant academic and career-related learning opportunities that are aligned with rigorous, challenging academic content that prepares them to transition to postsecondary education and careers.

title: S. 697, Frank R. Lautenberg Chemical Safety for the 21st Century Act
sponsers: [Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: This bill amends the Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA) to revise the regulation of chemicals.

title: Marketplace Fairness Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA]]
texts: Authorizes each member state under the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement (the multistate agreement for the administration and collection of sales and use taxes adopted on November 12, 2002) to require all sellers not qualifying for a small-seller exception (applicable to sellers with annual gross receipts in total U.S. remote sales not exceeding $1 million) to collect and remit sales and use taxes with respect to remote sales under provisions of the Agreement, but only if such Agreement includes minimum simplification requirements relating to the administration of the tax, audits, and streamlined filing. Defines "remote sale" as a sale of goods or services into a state in which the seller would not legally be required to pay, collect, or remit state or local sales and use taxes unless provided by this Act. Prohibits states from beginning the exercise of the authority granted by this Act for a specified period after enactment.

title: American Opportunity Tax Credit Permanence and Consolidation Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Reid, Harry [D-NV], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to replace the Hope Scholarship and Lifetime Learning tax credits with a new American Opportunity Tax Credit that: (1) allows an income tax credit of up to $3,000 of the qualified tuition and related expenses of a student who is carrying at least one half of a normal course load, (2) increases the income threshold for reductions in the credit amount based upon modified adjusted gross income, (3) imposes a lifetime dollar limitation on such credit of $15,000 for all taxable years, and (4) makes a portion of the credit refundable. Allows an exclusion from gross income of any amount received as a Federal Pell Grant.

title: READ Act
sponsers: [Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], None, Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL]]
texts: This bill amends the Asbestos Information Act of 1988 to require the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to establish and maintain a database of asbestos-containing products. The database must be accessible through EPA's website, publicly available, and searchable. An asbestos-containing product is any product to which asbestos is deliberately or knowingly added or in which asbestos is deliberately used or knowingly present in any concentration.

title: A bill for the relief of Tim Lowry and Paul Nettleton of Owyhee County, Idaho.
sponsers: [None, Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID]]
texts: NA

title: Stop Illegal Insider Trading Act
sponsers: [Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ]]
texts: This bill amends the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 governing manipulative and deceptive devices to make it unlawful for any person to: (1) purchase, sell, or cause the purchase or sale of any security on the basis of material information that the person knows or has reason to know is not publicly available; or (2) knowingly or recklessly communicate material information that the person knows or has reason to know is not publicly available to any other person under circumstances in which it is reasonably foreseeable that the communication is likely to result in a violation of this prohibition.

title: Weatherization Enhancement and Local Energy Efficiency Investment and Accountability Act
sponsers: [Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: This bill amends the Energy Conservation and Production Act to reauthorize the Weatherization Assistance Program for low-income persons through FY2020.

title: Community Based Independence for Seniors Act
sponsers: [Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], None, Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Health and Human Services to establish a Community-Based Institutional Special Needs Plan demonstration program to target home and community-based care to eligible low-income Medicare beneficiaries age 65 or older.

title: A bill to amend section 213 of title 23, United States Code, relating to the Transportation Alternatives Program.
sponsers: [Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], None, Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS]]
texts: In the allocation of funds for transportation alternatives, 66.67% (increased from 50%) of reserved funds per fiscal year shall be obligated to any eligible entity in proportion to its relative shares of the state population in: (1) urbanized areas with a population of over 200,000, (2) non-urban areas with a population greater than 5,000, and (3) other areas of the state.

title: SOS Campus Act
sponsers: [Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Reid, Harry [D-NV], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], None, Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA]]
texts: Amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to require each institution of higher education (IHE) that participates in the programs under title IV (Student Assistance) to designate an independent advocate for campus sexual assault prevention and response (Advocate) with experience in providing sexual assault victim services.

title: Opioid Overdose Reduction Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], None, Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA]]
texts: This bill exempts individuals from liability for harm caused by the emergency administration of an opioid overdose drug under certain circumstances. (An opioid is a drug with effects similar to opium, such as heroin.) The individuals exempted from liability are:

title: Regulatory Improvement Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND]]
texts: Establishes in the legislative branch the Regulatory Improvement Commission.

title: Restoring Access to Medication Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], None, Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS]]
texts: Repeals provisions of the Internal Revenue Code, as added by the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, that limit payments for medications from health savings accounts, medical savings accounts, and health flexible spending arrangements to only prescription drugs or insulin (thus allowing distributions from such accounts for over-the-counter drugs).

title: S. 710, Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY]]
texts: Amends the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 (the Act) to revise and reauthorize the block grant program through FY2020 with respect to Native Americans and housing, including income and wage requirements and environmental review requirements.

title: Mental Health First Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY]]
texts: Amends the Public Health Service Act to require the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) to award grants to initiate and sustain mental health first aid training programs. Requires such a program to include training on: (1) the skills, resources, and knowledge necessary to assist individuals in crisis to connect with appropriate local mental health care services; (2) mental health resources, including the location of community mental health centers; and (3) protocols for referral to mental health resources.

title: Passenger Fee Restructuring Exemptions Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], None, Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI]]
texts: Revises aviation security service fee requirements.

title: International Violence Against Women Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], None, Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA]]
texts: Directs the Secretary of State to establish an Office of Global Women's Issues which shall be headed by an Ambassador-at-Large for Global Women's Issues.

title: Frontline Mental Health Provider Training Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN]]
texts: Requires the Department of Defense (DOD) and the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to jointly commence a pilot program to assess the feasibility and advisability of expanding use of physician assistants specializing in psychiatric medicine at DOD and VA medical facilities in order to meet the increasing demand for mental health care providers at such facilities through the completion of two 18-month psychiatry fellowship programs for physician assistants.

title: Military and Veterans Mental Health Provider Assessment Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN]]
texts: Directs the Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs to ensure that all health care providers under their respective jurisdictions receive, at least once every three years, empirically supported training on the recognition and assessment of individuals at risk for suicide and the management of such risk.

title: Seniors' Tax Simplification Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT]]
texts: This bill directs the Internal Revenue Service to make available to taxpayers who have turned age 65 at the close of the taxable year a new federal income tax Form 1040SR (similar to the existing Form 1040EZ). Such taxpayers can use this new form even if their income includes: (1) social security benefits; (2) distributions from qualified retirement plans, annuities, or other such deferred payment arrangements; (3) interest and dividends; or (4) capital gains and losses.

title: Community Provider Readiness Recognition Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA]]
texts: Directs the Departments of Defense and Veterans Affairs to jointly develop a system by which a non-Department mental health care provider who provides health care to members of the Armed Forces or veterans shall receive a mental health provider readiness designation if such provider meets eligibility criteria relating to: (1) knowledge, comfort, and understanding with respect to the culture of members of the Armed Forces, veterans, and family members and caregivers of such members and veterans; and (2) knowledge regarding evidence-based treatments that have been approved by such Departments for the treatment of mental health issues among such members and veterans.

title: A bill to modify the boundary of Petersburg National Battlefield in the Commonwealth of Virginia, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA]]
texts: Transfers from the Department of the Interior to the Department of the Army (DA) administrative jurisdiction over approximately 1.170 acres of land for the Fort Lee Military Reservation.

title: A bill to rename the Armed Forces Reserve Center in Great Falls, Montana, the Captain John E. Moran and Captain William Wylie Galt Armed Forces Reserve Center.
sponsers: [Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: Designates the Armed Forces Reserve Center in Great Falls, Montana, as the "Captain John E. Moran and Captain William Wylie Galt Armed Forces Reserve Center."

title: S. 720, Energy Savings and Industrial Competitiveness Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND]]
texts: This bill revises a variety of programs to encourage energy efficiency in buildings, industry, the federal government, and certain appliances.

title: Target Practice and Marksmanship Training Support Act
sponsers: [Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND]]
texts: This bill amends the Pittman-Robertson Wildlife Restoration Act to facilitate the construction and expansion of public target ranges by: (1) authorizing a state to pay up to 90% of the costs of acquiring land for, expanding, or constructing a public target range; (2) authorizing a state to elect to allocate 10% of a specified amount apportioned to it from the federal aid to wildlife restoration fund for those costs; (3) limiting the federal share of those costs under such Act to 90%; and (4) requiring amounts provided for those costs under such Act to remain available for expenditure and obligation for five fiscal years.

title: A bill to extend the date after which interest earned on obligations held in the wildlife restoration fund may be available for apportionment.
sponsers: [Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS]]
texts: NA

title: Utility Energy Service Contracts Improvement Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE]]
texts: This bill amends the National Energy Conservation Policy Act to make explicit that utility energy service contracts (UESCs) may have a contract period of up to 25 years. UESCs are contracts that allow utilities to provide federal agencies with energy and water efficiency improvements and demand reduction services.

title: Protecting Kids from Candy-Flavored Drugs Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: Amends the Controlled Substances Act to prohibit any person from: (1) manufacturing, creating, distributing, dispensing, or possessing with intent to distribute a schedule I or II controlled substance that is combined with a candy or beverage product, marketed or packaged to appear similar to a candy or beverage product, or modified by flavoring or coloring to appear similar to a candy or beverage product; or (2) manufacturing, distributing, or dispensing, or possessing with intent to manufacture, distribute, or dispense, a controlled substance knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the controlled substance will be distributed, dispensed, or sold to a person under 18 years of age. Imposes enhanced criminal penalties for violations.

title: Alan Reinstein and Trevor Schaefer Toxic Chemical Protection Act
sponsers: [Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD]]
texts: This bill amends the Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA) to revise the regulation of chemicals.

title: Community Financial Protection Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN]]
texts: Amends the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to require the Director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) to request reports through the prudential regulator from a person that is either an insured depository institution or an insured credit union with total assets of $10 billion or less (persons).

title: BTU Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to include 30% of qualified biomass fuel property expenditures made in taxable years beginning before 2021 in the residential energy efficient property tax credit. Defines "qualified biomass fuel property expenditure" as an expenditure for property which uses the burning of biomass fuel (a plant-derived fuel available on a renewable or recurring basis) to heat a dwelling used as a residence, or to heat water for use in such dwelling, and which has a thermal efficiency rating of at least 75%.

title: STOP Act
sponsers: [Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: Amends the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize the program to reduce underage drinking for FY2016-FY2019.

title: Fairness for Struggling Students Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI]]
texts: This bill amends federal bankruptcy law to make privately issued student loans dischargeable in bankruptcy. Under current law, student loans (whether issued privately or by a governmental unit) are dischargeable only if excepting the loans from dischargeability would impose undue hardship on the debtor and the debtor's dependents.

title: Permanently Protecting Tenants at Foreclosure Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ]]
texts: This bill amends the Protecting Tenants at Foreclosure Act of 2009 to repeal its sunset date December 31, 2014 (thus making the Act permanent).

title: Social Security Expansion Act
sponsers: [Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT]]
texts: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to:

title: A bill to amend the Act of June 18, 1934, to reaffirm the authority of the Secretary of the Interior to take land into trust for Indian tribes.
sponsers: [Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], None, Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: Ratifies and confirms any action taken by the Secretary pursuant to such Act for any Indian tribe that was federally recognized on the date of that action.

title: Filipino Veterans Family Reunification Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Reid, Harry [D-NV], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI]]
texts: Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to exempt from worldwide or numerical limitations on immigrant visas the sons and daughters of Filipino World War II veterans who were naturalized under the Immigration Act of 1990 or other specified federal law.

title: USF Equitable Distribution Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH]]
texts: Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to require at least 75% of all amounts collected by interstate telecommunications providers from consumers in a rural state for the purpose of making certain contributions to universal service funds established by the Federal Communications Commission to be allocated to consumers in that rural state.

title: Level Playing Field in Trade Agreements Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR]]
texts: No trade agreement with a country, or implementing bill for one, may receive expedited consideration by Congress under any provision of law, including any limitation on amendments or debate in either the Senate (except under rule XXII of the Standing Rules) or the House of Representatives unless the agreement:

title: State, Tribal, and Local Species Transparency and Recovery Act
sponsers: [Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], None, Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY]]
texts: This bill amends the Endangered Species Act of 1973 to require the Department of the Interior or the Department of Commerce, as appropriate, to provide to affected states all data that is used as the basis of a determination on whether a species is an endangered species or a threatened species before making a determination.

title: Ensuring Access to Primary Care for Women & Children Act
sponsers: [Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA]]
texts: Amends title XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act (SSAct) to require that the primary care services furnished in the two years after enactment of this Act by a physician with a primary specialty designation of family medicine, general internal medicine, or pediatric medicine be paid at a rate that is not less than 100% of the payment rate that applies under Medicare part B (Supplementary Medical Insurance), but only if the physician self-attests as being Board certified in those areas.

title: Genetically Engineered Salmon Risk Reduction Act
sponsers: [Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to require food that contains genetically engineered (commonly called a "genetically modified organism" or "GMO") salmon to bear a label stating that fact.

title: Veterans Access to Extended Care Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD]]
texts: This bill modifies the treatment of Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) agreements with service providers to furnish veterans with nursing home care, adult day health care, or other extended care services.

title: Geospatial Data Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR]]
texts: Establishes in the executive branch: (1) the Federal Geographic Data Committee, which shall be the lead entity for the development, implementation, and review of policies, practices, and standards relating to geospatial data; and (2) the National Geospatial Advisory Committee to provide advice and recommendations to the committee.

title: Water Infrastructure Resiliency and Sustainability Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Reid, Harry [D-NV], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], None, Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD]]
texts: This bill requires the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to establish the Water Infrastructure Resiliency and Sustainability Program to provide grants in each of FY2015-FY2019 for programs or projects to increase the resiliency or adaptability of water systems to any ongoing or forecasted changes to the hydrologic conditions of a U.S. region. A water system is a community water system, a treatment works, a decentralized wastewater treatment system for domestic sewage, a groundwater storage and replenishment system, a system for transport and delivery of water for irrigation or conservation, or a natural or engineered system that manages floodwater.

title: S. 742, Stop Wasteful Federal Bonuses Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: Prohibits a federal agency from awarding a bonus to any employee for five years after the end of a fiscal year in which the Inspector General of the agency or another senior ethics official or the Comptroller General makes an adverse finding relating to the employee. Requires repayment of a bonus awarded in any year in which an adverse finding is made.

title: Honor America's Guard-Reserve Retirees Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], None, Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR]]
texts: Honors as a veteran any person who is entitled to retired pay for nonregular (reserve) service or who would be so entitled, but for age.

title: REFUND Act
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO]]
texts: This bill rescinds federal funds identified by a state as unwanted and requires the funds to be used for debt reduction. The bill applies to federal funds required to be allocated by formula among all states that agree to use the funds for a specified purpose. To identify the funds as unwanted, a state legislature must pass a concurrent resolution, and the state must then notify the head of the federal agency responsible for allocating the funds. The Department of the Treasury must deposit the rescinded funds in the Gifts to the United States for Reduction of the Public Debt account, use the funds to reduce the debt, and submit an annual report to Congress identifying funds received.

title: National Debt and Taxation Transparency Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of the Treasury, beginning not later than October 1, 2017, to provide each individual who has a valid social security number, who received a Form W-2 in the previous taxable year, and who has filed a tax return in any previous taxable year (eligible individual) with a taxpayer account statement. An initial statement must be provided to each eligible individual with a current mailing address not later than September 30, 2020.

title: Accelerating the End of Breast Cancer Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: Establishes the Commission to Accelerate the End of Breast Cancer to help end breast cancer by January 1, 2020.

title: American Innovation Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL]]
texts: This bill amends the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to require certain adjustments to discretionary spending limits in FY2016-FY2021 to accommodate increases in appropriations for agencies that perform basic science research.

title: Amnesty Bonuses Elimination Act
sponsers: [Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA]]
texts: This bill amends the Social Security Act to prohibit the Social Security Administration from issuing a Social Security account number to any alien granted deferred action pursuant to specified deferred action policies of the Department of Homeland Security.

title: Honest Scoring Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: This bill requires the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) and the Joint Committee on Taxation (JCT) to provide estimates of the macroeconomic effects of major legislation. These estimates are frequently referred to as dynamic scoring and include estimates of the budgetary effects from changes in economic output, employment, capital stock, interest rates, and other macroeconomic variables resulting from the legislation.

title: S. 750, Arizona Borderlands Protection and Preservation Act
sponsers: [Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Homeland Security, the Department of Agriculture (USDA), and the Department of the Interior to provide U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) personnel with access to federal lands for security activities, including: (1) routine motorized patrols; and (2) deployment of communications, surveillance, and detection equipment.

title: CASE Act
sponsers: [Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI]]
texts: This bill prohibits the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) from lowering its national ambient air quality standards (NAAQS) for ozone until at least 85% of counties that are in nonattainment areas (counties that are exceeding the limit) have attained the standard.

title: A bill to establish a scorekeeping rule to ensure that increases in guarantee fees of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac shall not be used to offset provisions that increase the deficit.
sponsers: [Sen. Shelby, Richard C. [R-AL], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. texts: NA

title: Social Security and Marriage Equality Act
sponsers: [Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. texts: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) of the Social Security Act with respect to the determination of a valid marriage to account for marriages in jurisdictions other than a state.

texts: Requires the Director of National Intelligence (DNI), the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), the Department of Defense (DOD), and the Department of Justice (DOJ) to develop and promulgate procedures to promote: (1) the timely sharing of classified and declassified cyber threat indicators in possession of the federal government with private entities, non-federal government agencies, or state, tribal, or local governments; (2) the sharing of unclassified indicators with the public; and (3) the sharing of cybersecurity threats with entities to prevent or mitigate adverse effects.

title: Tennessee Wilderness Act
sponsers: [Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN]]
texts: Designates specified federal lands in Cherokee National Forest in Tennessee as wilderness and as additions to the National Wilderness Preservation System.

title: Syrian War Crimes Accountability Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE]]
texts: Declares that Congress:

title: No Stolen Trademarks Honored in America Act
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL]]
texts: Amends the Department of Commerce and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1999 to prohibit U.S. courts from recognizing, enforcing, or otherwise validating any assertion of rights by an individual (under current law, by a designated Cuban national) of a mark, trade name, or commercial name that was used in connection with a business or assets that were confiscated by the Cuban government unless the original owner of such mark or name, or such owner's bona fide successor, has expressly consented. Applies such prohibition only if the individual asserting the rights knew or had reason to know at the time of acquiring the rights asserted that the mark or name was the same or substantially similar to the mark or name used in connection with the business or assets that were confiscated.

title: Trade Enforcement Act of 2015
sponsers: NA
texts: Amends the Trade Act of 1974 to establish within the Office of the United States Trade Representative (USTR) an Interagency Trade Enforcement Center to:

title: Expedited Consideration of Cuts, Consolidations, and Savings Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: This bill amends the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974 to establish expedited procedures for congressional consideration of legislation to carry out recommendations included in the Office of Management and Budget's annual Cuts, Consolidations, and Savings report. The report lists proposals included in the President's budget to cut, consolidate, or otherwise produce savings from mandatory and discretionary spending programs. The authority provided by this bill terminates on the date of the sine die adjournment of Congress during 2018.

title: Federal Communications Commission Collaboration Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to allow a bipartisan majority of Commissioners of the Federal Communications Commission (FCC), notwithstanding a specified open meeting provision, to hold a meeting that is closed to the public to discuss official business if: (1) no agency action is taken, (2) each person present is an FCC Commissioner or employee or a member or person on the staff of a joint board or conference to which the FCC has referred a matter, and (3) an attorney from the FCC's Office of General Counsel is present.

title: Veterans Access to Care Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to automatically designate medical facilities of the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) as health professional shortage areas.

title: Innovation in Surface Transportation Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], None, Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS]]
texts: Directs the Secretary of Transportation, in coordination with state transportation departments, to establish an innovation in surface transportation program.

title: Trauma Systems and Regionalization of Emergency Care Reauthorization Act
sponsers: [Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize trauma care programs through FY2020.
