texts: This bill amends the National Sea Grant College Program Act to reauthorize through FY2021 the National Sea Grant College Program.

title: A bill to appropriately determine the budgetary effects of energy savings performance contracts and utility energy service contracts.
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: Under an energy savings performance contract, a private party agrees to fund energy-efficient upgrades for a federal facility, and the federal agency agrees to pay the private party from reductions in the agency's energy costs. Under a utility energy service contract, the services and equipment are provided by a utility.

title: Driver Privacy Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], None, Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND]]
texts: Declares that any data in an event data recorder required to be installed in a passenger motor vehicle (as provided for under Department of Transportation [DOT] regulations concerning the collection, storage, and retrievability of onboard motor vehicle crash event data) is the property of the owner or lessee of the vehicle in which the recorder is installed, regardless of when the vehicle was manufactured.

title: Let Seniors Work Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to: (1) eliminate the payroll tax for individuals who have attained retirement age, and (2) remove the limitation on the amount of outside income which a beneficiary may earn (earnings test) without incurring a reduction in benefits.

title: Steve Gleason Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to cover as durable medical equipment any eye tracking and gaze interaction accessories for speech generating devices furnished to individuals with a demonstrated medical need for them.

title: Track, Railroad, and Infrastructure Network Act
sponsers: [Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill exempts improvements to, maintenance, rehabilitation, or operation of railroad or rail transit lines (but not stations) that are in use or were historically used for the transportation of goods or passengers from federal policies and requirements for the preservation of public park and recreation lands, wildlife and waterfowl refuges, and historic sites. This permits such activities without the necessity to: (1) demonstrate there is no feasible and prudent alternative to the use of such land, and (2) plan to minimize harm to a historic site.

title: Escambia County Land Conveyance Act
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: Authorizes Escambia County, Florida, to convey its interest in any part of the former Santa Rosa Island National Monument land that was conveyed to it by the federal government in 1947 to any person or entity, without restriction.

title: Manufacturing Universities Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], None, Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE]]
texts: Authorizes the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) to establish a program to designate up to 25 institutions of higher education as U.S. manufacturing universities that are to be awarded funds over a four-year period.

title: Democracy Restoration Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Reid, Harry [D-NV], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA]]
texts: Declares that the right of a U.S. citizen to vote in any election for federal office shall not be denied or abridged because that individual has been convicted of a criminal offense unless, at the time of the election, such individual is serving a felony sentence in a correctional institution or facility. Provides for enforcement of, and remedies for violations of, this Act.

title: Tyler Clementi Higher Education Anti-Harassment Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], None, Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA]]
texts: Amends title IV (Student Assistance) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to require each institution of higher education (IHE) participating in a title IV program (except a foreign school) to include in its annual security report a statement of policy regarding harassment that includes: (1) a prohibition of harassment of students by other students, faculty, and staff; (2) a description of its programs to prevent harassment; (3) a description of the procedures that students should follow if harassment occurs; and (4) a description of the procedures it will follow once an incident of harassment has been reported.

title: Financial Institutions Examination Fairness and Reform Act
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], None, Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS]]
texts: Amends the Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act of 1978 to require a federal financial institutions regulatory agency to make a final examination report to a financial institution within 60 days of the later of: (1) the exit interview for an examination of the institution, or (2) the provision of additional information by the institution relating to the examination.

title: Self-Insurance Protection Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act, the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA), and the Internal Revenue Code to exclude from the definition of "health insurance coverage" a stop-loss policy obtained by a self-insured health plan or a sponsor of a self-insured group health plan to reimburse the plan or sponsor for losses incurred in providing health benefits to plan participants in excess of a level set forth in the stop-loss policy.

title: Flexibility for Working Families Act
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA]]
texts: Authorizes an employee to request from an employer a temporary or permanent change in the terms or conditions of the employee's employment if the request relates to: (1) the number of hours the employee is required to work, (2) the times when the employee is required to work or be on call for work, (3) where the employee is required to work, or (4) the amount of notification the employee receives of work schedule assignments. Sets forth certain employer duties with respect to such requests.

title: Guantanamo Bay Recidivism Prevention Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK]]
texts: This bill prohibits assistance under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 and the Arms Export Control Act for five years to a foreign country if: (1) the country received an individual who was released or transferred from United States Naval Station, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, on or after February 1, 2015; and (2) after the date of such release or transfer, the individual is included in a report of individuals confirmed or suspected of returning to terrorist activities.

title: Fair Access to Science and Technology Research Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT]]
texts: Requires each federal agency with extramural research expenditures of over $100 million to develop a federal research public access policy that is consistent with, and that advances, the purposes of the agency and that follows common procedures for the collection and depositing of research papers.

title: Cameras in the Courtroom Act
sponsers: [Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN]]
texts: Requires the Supreme Court to permit television coverage of all open sessions of the Court unless it decides by majority vote that allowing such coverage in a particular case would violate the due process rights of any of the parties involved.

title: Empowering Student Borrowers Act
sponsers: [Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC]]
texts: Amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to direct the Secretary of Education to establish, maintain, and periodically update best practices for institutions of higher education in: (1) teaching financial literacy skills, and (2) providing students with useful and necessary information to assist them in making financial decisions related to student borrowing.

title: Grand Canyon Bison Management Act
sponsers: [Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ]]
texts: Directs the Department of the Interior to publish a management plan to reduce, through humane lethal culling by skilled public volunteers and other nonlethal means, the population of bison in the Grand Canyon National Park in Arizona that Interior determines are detrimental to the uses of the Park.

title: Sunshine in the Courtroom Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], None, Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: Authorizes the presiding judge of a U.S. appellate court or U.S. district court to permit the photographing, electronic recording, broadcasting, or televising to the public of court proceedings over which that judge presides, except when such action would constitute a violation of the due process rights of any party.

title: Microlab Technology Commercialization Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: Authorizes the Secretary of Energy (DOE), in collaboration with the directors of national laboratories, to establish a program meeting specified criteria under which DOE sets up microlabs located in close proximity to national laboratories and accessible to the public in order to: (1) enhance collaboration with regional research groups, such as institutions of higher education and industry groups; (2) accelerate technology transfer from national laboratories to the marketplace; and (3) promote regional workforce development through science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) instruction and training.

title: FRAC Act
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN]]
texts: This bill repeals the exemption for hydraulic fracturing operations relating to oil and natural gas production activities under the Safe Drinking Water Act. Hydraulic fracturing or fracking is a process to extract underground resources such as oil or gas from a geologic formation by injecting water, a propping agent (e.g., sand), and chemical additives into a well under enough pressure to fracture the geological formation.

title: Family and Medical Insurance Leave Act
sponsers: [Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], None, Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY]]
texts: Establishes the Office of Paid Family and Medical Leave within the Social Security Administration (SSA), to be headed by the Deputy SSA Commissioner.

title: NTIS Elimination Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO]]
texts: Repeals the National Technical Information Act of 1988, which provided for establishment of the National Technical Information Service (NTIS), effective one year after the enactment of this Act.

title: A bill to require the termination of any employee of the Department of Veterans Affairs who is found to have retaliated against a whistleblower.
sponsers: [None, Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO]]
texts: NA

title: Dorothy I. Height and Whitney M. Young, Jr., Social Work Reinvestment Act
sponsers: [Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD]]
texts: This bill directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to establish the Social Work Reinvestment Commission to provide independent counsel to Congress and the Secretary on policy issues related to recruitment, retention, research, and reinvestment in the profession of social work.

title: Economic Freedom Zones Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY]]
texts: Prohibits federal assistance (e.g., loans, loan guarantees, or purchases) from being provided to: (1) a municipality or a zip code (eligible entity), other than an entity that is designated an Economic Free Zone by this Act; (2) a municipality that is a debtor in a bankruptcy proceeding; or (3) a municipality that is insolvent.

title: American Energy Renaissance Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX]]
texts: Amends the Natural Gas Act regarding natural gas exports to exclude from the expedited application and approval process any nation subject to sanctions or trade restrictions imposed by the United States.

title: Nuclear Weapon Free Iran Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Shelby, Richard C. [R-AL]]
texts: Expresses the sense of Congress that:

title: Bank on Students Emergency Loan Refinancing Act
sponsers: [Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Reid, Harry [D-NV], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], None, Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA]]
texts: Amends title IV (Student Assistance) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to direct the Secretary of Education to establish a program to refinance the unpaid principal, accrued unpaid interest, and late charges on: (1) the William D. Ford Federal Direct Loans (DLs) of qualified borrowers if the DLs were first disbursed or, in the case of Direct Consolidation Loans, applied for, before July 1, 2015; and (2) the Federal Family Education Loans (FFELs) of qualified borrowers as DLs. (FFELs were not disbursed after June 30, 2010.)

title: A bill to extend whistleblower protections for defense contractor employees to employees of contractors of the elements of the intelligence community.
sponsers: [Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO]]
texts: Requires courts that receive a disclosure of information required by executive order to be kept classified (in the interests of national defense or the conduct of foreign affairs) to treat the information in a manner consistent with the interests of the national security of the United States, including through the use of summaries or ex parte submissions if the element of the intelligence community concerned advises the court that such procedures are warranted.

title: S. 795, a bill to enhance whistleblower protection for contractor and grantee employees
sponsers: [Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI]]
texts: The bill extends the prohibition against reimbursement of legal fees incurred in defending against reprisal claims brought by whistleblowers to defense and civilian subcontractors and personal services contractors.

title: IN-STATE for Dreamers Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA]]
texts: Amends title IV (Student Assistance) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to direct the Secretary of Education to allot grants to states to offer Dreamer students in-state tuition and expand their access to in-state financial aid.

title: Railroad Infrastructure Financing Improvement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill amends the Railroad Revitalization and Regulatory Reform Act of 1976 to direct the Department of Transportation (DOT) to make direct loans and loan guarantees to:

title: S. 799, Protecting our Infants Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN]]
texts: This bill requires the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality to report on prenatal opioid abuse and neonatal abstinence syndrome (symptoms of withdrawal in a newborn). (An opioid is a drug with effects similar to opium, such as heroin or certain pain medications.) The report must include:

title: S. 800, Enhancing the Stature and Visibility of Medical Rehabilitation Research at the NIH Act
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], None, Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to revise requirements for medical rehabilitation research.

title: Girls Count Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS]]
texts: Authorizes the Secretary of State and the Administrator of the U.S. Agency for International Development to: (1) support programs that will contribute to improved civil registration and vital statistics systems with a focus on birth registration; and (2) promote programs that build the capacity of developing countries' national and local legal and policy frameworks to prevent discrimination against girls, and help increase property rights, social security, land tenure, and inheritance rights for women.

title: Family Friendly and Workplace Flexibility Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], None, Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH]]
texts: Amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to authorize private employers to provide compensatory time off to private employees at a rate of at least 1 1/2 hours per hour of employment for which overtime compensation is required. Authorizes an employer to provide compensatory time off only in accordance with an applicable collective bargaining agreement or, in the absence of such an agreement, an agreement between the employer and employee.

title: Medicare CGM Access Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ]]
texts: The Department of Health and Human Services must establish a fee schedule and ensure that CGM qualified individuals are furnished with appropriate device components.

title: PRISM Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY]]
texts: Makes Hispanic-serving institutions eligible for technical and financial assistance from the Secretary of the Interior to establish preservation training and degree programs.

title: Drug Free Commercial Driver Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI]]
texts: NA

title: Fair BEER Act
sponsers: [Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], None, Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to revise the excise tax on beer brewed or produced, and removed for consumption or sale, within the United States or imported into the United States. The revised tax ranges from $0 for an amount not exceeding 7,143 barrels to $18 per barrel on an amount exceeding 2 million barrels.

title: Surface Transportation Board Reauthorization Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: Removes the Surface Transportation Board from the Department of Transportation (DOT) to establish it as an independent U.S. agency.

title: Educational Opportunities Act
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individual taxpayers a tax credit for charitable contributions to a scholarship granting organization. Allows a maximum credit amount of $4,500 ($2,250 for a married individual filing a separate return). Defines "scholarship granting organization" as a tax-exempt entity whose exclusive purpose is to provide scholarships for the tuition and other expenses of elementary and secondary school students from low income households (i.e., household income not exceeding 250% of federal poverty guidelines).

title: SGR Repeal and Medicare Provider Payment Modernization Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT]]
texts: Amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act (SSAct) to: (1) remove sustainable growth rate (SGR) methodology from the determination of annual conversion factors in the formula for payment for physicians' services, and (2) revise the update in rates for 2015 and subsequent years.

title: Supportive School Climate Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], None, Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT]]
texts: Amends the school improvement program under part A of title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (ESEA) to require each state that wants to use a part A grant to provide students with positive behavioral interventions and support to submit a plan to the Secretary of Education that describes specified steps it will take to: (1) create a positive school climate for all students, (2) improve engagement for disconnected youths, (3) create disciplinary policies that are fair and work to keep students in school, and (4) enable those who are removed from school to resume their education upon returning to school.

title: CLEAR Relief Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], None, Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS]]
texts: Amends the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 to exempt from its rules regarding management assessment of internal controls the following institutions which, as of the end of the preceding fiscal year, had total consolidated assets of $1 billion or less (adjusted annually according to a certain formula): (1) a bank holding company, (2) a savings and loan holding company, or (3) an insured depository institution.

title: Military Sequester Flexibility Act
sponsers: NA
texts: This bill permits the Department of Defense (DOD) to transfer authorizations of funds made available to DOD. DOD may transfer amounts between authorizations for the same fiscal year if: (1) the transfer is necessary to mitigate the effects of spending reductions due to a reduction in the discretionary spending limit or a sequestration under the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985, and (2) it is in the national interest.

title: Oregon Coastal Land Act
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR]]
texts: Requires all interest of the United States in approximately 14,408 acres of land (Oregon Coastal land) to be held in trust for, and to be part of the reservation of, the Confederated Tribes of Coos, Lower Umpqua, and Siuslaw Indians (Tribes).

title: Western Oregon Tribal Fairness Act
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR]]
texts: Requires all interest of the United States in approximately 17,519 acres of land (Council Creek land) to be held in trust for, and to be part of the reservation of, the Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians.

title: A bill to amend the Coquille Restoration Act to clarify certain provisions relating to the management of the Coquille Forest.
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR]]
texts: Continues to apply: (1) federal law relating to the export of unprocessed logs harvested from federal land to any unprocessed logs that are harvested from the Forest, and (2) competitive bidding requirements to sales of timber from the Forest.

title: A bill to provide for the addition of certain real property to the reservation of the Siletz Tribe in the State of Oregon.
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR]]
texts: Requires such land to be considered and evaluated as an on-reservation acquisition and become part of the Tribe's reservation. (Off-reservation land acquisition requests require Interior to give greater scrutiny to the tribe's justification of the anticipated benefits from the acquisition.)

title: A bill to amend the Grand Ronde Reservation Act to make technical corrections, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR]]
texts: States that: (1) Interior shall treat applications to take land into trust within the boundaries of the original 1857 reservation as an on-reservation trust acquisition; (2) the real property taken into trust is not to be eligible, or used, for certain gaming, except for real property within two miles of a specified gaming facility; and (3) all real property taken into trust within those boundaries after September 9, 1988, shall be part of the Tribe's reservation.

title: Export-Import Bank Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA]]
texts: This bill amends the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 to reduce, for each of FY2015-FY2019, the authorized aggregate amount of loans, guarantees, and insurance the Export-Import Bank may have outstanding at any time.

title: Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit Enhancement Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to the tax credit for employment-related expenses incurred for the care of a taxpayer's dependent, to: (1) increase to $120,000, the adjusted gross income threshold level above which such credit is incrementally reduced; (2) increase the dollar limit on the allowable amount of such credit; (3) allow an inflation adjustment to the threshold amount and the maximum credit amounts, beginning after 2016; and (4) make such credit refundable.

title: BPA in Food Packaging Right to Know Act
sponsers: [Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], None, Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA]]
texts: Requires the Department of Health and Human Services to: (1) issue a revised safety assessment for food containers composed in whole or in part of bisphenol A (BPA), taking into consideration different types and uses of such containers; and (2) determine whether there is reasonable certainty that no harm will result from aggregate exposure to BPA through food containers or other items composed in whole or in part of BPA, taking into consideration potential adverse effects from low-dose exposure and the effects of exposure on vulnerable populations, including pregnant women, infants, children, the elderly, and populations with high exposure to BPA.

title: Geothermal Production Expansion Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID]]
texts: This bill amends the Geothermal Steam Act of 1970 to allow the Department of the Interior to award noncompetitive leases on up to 640 acres of federal land for geothermal development if: (1) the land is available for leasing and not already leased or nominated to be leased, (2) the lessee has a legal right to develop geothermal resources on land adjacent to the federal land that will be leased, (3) sufficient data was submitted to Interior to show there is a valid discovery of geothermal resources on the adjacent land and that the thermal feature extends into the adjoining federal land, and (4) the lessee has not previously received a noncompetitive lease for the discovery.

title: A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 206 West Commercial Street in East Rochester, New York, as the "Officer Daryl R. Pierson Post Office".
sponsers: [None, Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY]]
texts: NA

title: Promoting U.S. Jobs Through Exports Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI]]
texts: This bill amends the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 to raise the cap on outstanding loans, guarantees, and insurance of the Export-Import Bank of the United States for FY2015-FY2022 and afterwards, subject to specified formulae.

title: SISA Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX]]
texts: Amends the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996, the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010, the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012, the Iran Threat Reduction and Syria Human Rights Act of 2012, and the Iran Freedom and Counter-Proliferation Act of 2012 to eliminate authority to waive sanctions relating to:

title: REVIEWS Act
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: This bill makes existing rules of a federal agency (i.e. each authority of the federal government, except the Congress, U.S. courts, the governments of U.S. territories or possessions, and the government of the District of Columbia) inoperative 10 years after promulgation, but allows extensions for additional periods of not more than 10 years if the agency promulgates the expiring rule in compliance with the notice and comment requirements of the Administrative Procedure Act.

title: Improving Rural Call Quality and Reliability Act of 2016
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD]]
texts: Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to require an intermediate provider that offers the capability to transmit certain voice communications and signaling information from one destination to another, and that charges a rate to any other entity (including an affiliated entity) for the transmission, to: (1) register with the Federal Communications Commission (FCC), and (2) comply with service quality standards to be established by the FCC.

title: Fracturing Regulations are Effective in State Hands Act
sponsers: [Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill gives states the sole authority to promulgate or enforce any regulation, guidance, or permit requirement regarding hydraulic fracturing on or under any land within their boundaries. Hydraulic fracturing or fracking is a process to extract underground resources such as oil or gas from a geologic formation by injecting water, a propping agent (e.g., sand), and chemical additives into a well under enough pressure to fracture the geological formation.

title: Medicare Orthotics and Prosthetics Improvement Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA]]
texts: This bill directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services shall designate and approve independent accreditation organizations that apply quality standards for suppliers only if they are Boards for Orthotist/Prosthetist Certification or essentially equivalent programs.

title: LDRD Enhancement Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM]]
texts: Amends the Energy and Water Development and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2009 to increase from 8% to 10% the percentage of Department of Energy (DOE) funding for government-owned, contractor-operated laboratories that may be used for laboratory directed research and development.

title: Smarter Approach to Nuclear Expenditures Act
sponsers: [Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN]]
texts: Prohibits the obligation or expenditure of funds authorized to be appropriated to the Department of Defense (DOD) for FY2015-FY2024: (1) for the research, development, test, and evaluation (RDT&E) or procurement of a long-range penetrating bomber aircraft; (2) to procure an SSBN-X submarine (and prohibits the use of such funds for FY2025 and thereafter to procure more than eight such submarines); or (3) for the RDT&E or procurement of a new intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM).

title: CARE for Reservists Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: Authorizes the Secretary of the military department concerned to provide care for behavioral health conditions to any member of the Selected Reserve for whom such Secretary determines, based on the member's most recent medical exam or mental health assessment, that the receipt of such care will ensure that the member meets applicable standards of medical readiness.

title: Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Facility Earthquake Protection and Improvement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA]]
texts: This bill authorizes the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to carry out the major medical facility projects of the VA specified in the explanatory statement accompanying the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015, including by obligating and expending the amounts specified in such statement. (Those projects include seismic corrections to the West Los Angeles Medical Center, replacement of a community living center and mental health facilities in Long Beach, and replacement of an existing spinal cord injury clinic in San Diego, California, all of which are at high risk of sustaining damage during an earthquake, and renovations to address substantial safety and compliance issues and construction of a new clinic and community living center at the VA medical center in Canandaigua, New York.)

title: S. 834, Sport Fish Restoration and Recreational Boating Safety Act
sponsers: [Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD]]
texts: This bill amends the Dingell-Johnson Sport Fish Restoration Act to establish the formula for allocating through FY2023 appropriations from the Sport Fish Restoration and Boating Trust Fund.

title: Tribal Adoption Parity Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow Indian tribes to make the determination that a child is a child with special needs for purposes of the adoption tax credit.

title: Family Health Care Flexibility Act
sponsers: [Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to repeal provisions added by the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act that: (1) restrict payments from health savings accounts, Archer medical savings accounts, and health flexible spending and reimbursement arrangements for medications to prescription drugs and insulin only (thus allowing payments for over-the-counter medications); and (2) impose a $2,500 limitation on salary reduction contributions to a health flexible spending arrangement under a cafeteria plan.

title: A bill to modify the criteria used by the Corps of Engineers to dredge small ports.
sponsers: [Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY]]
texts: NA

title: Protecting Consumers from Unreasonable Credit Rates Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA]]
texts: Amends the Truth in Lending Act to prohibit a creditor from extending credit to a consumer under an open end consumer credit plan (credit card) for which the fee and interest rate exceeds 36%.

title: Preserve Access to Medicare Rural Home Health Services Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA]]
texts: This bill amends the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003 to extend through calendar 2020 the payment increase (add-on) for Medicare home health services in rural areas.

title: Student Loan Borrower Bill of Rights
sponsers: [Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], None, Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL]]
texts: Amends the Truth in Lending Act to require postsecondary educational lenders to disclose to borrowers at least 30 days before the first fully amortized payment on their loan is due:

title: Prioritizing Veterans Access to Mental Health Care Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], None, Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA]]
texts: This bill amends the Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014 to make a veteran seeking mental health care in a non-Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) entity eligible for such care if the veteran provides a written statement (which may be sent electronically or made in person or by fax) that the veteran seeks mental health care from the VA and has not received timely and adequate mental health care through a VA facility or health care provider.

title: Intermountain West Corridor Development Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], None, Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: This bill amends the Intermodal Surface Transportation Efficiency Act of 1991 to designate as a high priority corridor on the National Highway System, as part of Interstate Route I-11, the Intermountain West Corridor from the vicinity of Las Vegas, Nevada, extending:

title: Improving Access to Medicare Coverage Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI]]
texts: Amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to deem an individual receiving outpatient observation services in a hospital to be an inpatient with respect to satisfying the three-day inpatient hospital requirement in order to entitle the individual to Medicare coverage of any post-hospital extended care services in a skilled nursing facility.

title: A bill to repeal the medical device excise tax, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA]]
texts: NA

title: A bill to require the Secretary of the Treasury to implement security measures in the electronic tax return filing process to prevent tax refund fraud from being perpetrated with electronic identity theft.
sponsers: [Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], None, Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: NA

title: Small Business Regulatory Sunset Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL]]
texts: Requires each federal agency to establish a plan for the periodic review (every nine years) of: (1) its rules that have a significant economic impact on a substantial number of small entities, and (2) any small entity compliance guide required to be published by an agency. Sets forth criteria for review of a rule, including the continued need for the rule, the complexity of the rule, and the economic impact of the rule on small entities. Requires: (1) each agency to publish in the Federal Register and on the agency website a list of the rules and small entity compliance guides to be reviewed under the plan, and (2) the agency Inspector General to determine whether the agency has conducted the required review.

title: Transnational Criminal Organization Illicit Spotter Prevention and Elimination Act
sponsers: [Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ]]
texts: Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to make it a crime to: (1) transmit to another person the location, movement, or activities of law enforcement agents while intending to further a federal crime relating to U.S. immigration; and (2) destroy, alter, or damage any physical or electronic device used by the federal government to control the border or any port of entry.

title: Resolving Environmental and Grid Reliability Conflicts Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Power Act with respect to orders by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to generate, transmit, or sell electricity to prevent an emergency in energy reliability, where the order may result in a conflict with environmental law. FERC must ensure that the order: (1) requires generation, delivery, interchange, or transmission of electricity only during hours necessary to meet the emergency and serve the public interest; and (2) be consistent with applicable environmental law and minimize any adverse environmental impacts to the maximum extent practicable.

title: S. 849, Advancing Research for Neurological Diseases Act of 2016
sponsers: [Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: Amends the Public Health Service Act to require the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to: (1) enhance and expand infrastructure and activities to track the epidemiology of neurological diseases, including multiple sclerosis and Parkinson's disease; and (2) incorporate information obtained through those activities into a National Neurological Diseases Surveillance System. Requires the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to ensure that the System facilitates further research on neurological diseases.

title: Horse Transportation Safety Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL]]
texts: Prohibits a person from transporting a horse in interstate commerce in a motor vehicle (except a vehicle operated exclusively on rail or rails) containing two or more levels stacked on top of one another. Prescribes civil penalties for persons who knowingly violate such prohibition.

title: Digital Goods and Services Tax Fairness Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH]]
texts: Prohibits a state or local jurisdiction from imposing multiple or discriminatory taxes on the sale or use of a digital good or service delivered or transferred electronically to a customer. Excludes from the definition of "digital service" a service that is predominantly attributable to the direct, contemporaneous expenditure of live human effort, skill, or expertise, a telecommunications service, an ancillary service, an Internet access service, an audio or video programming service, or a hotel intermediary service.

title: A Voice for Victims Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA]]
texts: This bill makes unenforceable any agreement between an employer and an employee to arbitrate a dispute with respect to a tort claim arising out of rape.

title: Rail Shipper Fairness Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN]]
texts: The Surface Transportation Board (STB) may:

title: Nuclear Waste Administration Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], None, Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN]]
texts: Establishes as an independent agency in the executive branch: (1) the Nuclear Waste Administration (NWA) to provide for the permanent disposal of nuclear waste, including the siting, construction, and operation of additional repositories, a test and evaluation facility, and additional storage facilities; and (2) the Nuclear Waste Oversight Board.

title: Endangered Species Management Self-Determination Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY]]
texts: Amends the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (ESA) to require the consent of the governor of a state in which a species is present for: (1) a determination of endangered or threatened species status by regulation, and (2) listing of the species as endangered or threatened by the Department of the Interior upon a determination by the Department of Commerce.

title: Stop Sexual Abuse by School Personnel Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC]]
texts: Amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (ESEA) to require each state and local educational agency (LEA) that receives funds under the ESEA to have policies and procedures in effect that require a criminal background check for each school employee in the LEA's public elementary and secondary schools.

title: Health Outcomes, Planning, and Education (HOPE) for Alzheimer's Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to cover comprehensive Alzheimer's disease care planning services.

title: Energy Savings Through Public-Private Partnerships Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: This bill amends the National Energy Conservation Policy Act to revise requirements for energy savings performance and utility energy service contracts (performance contracts). (These contracts allow federal agencies to work with private contractors on energy efficiency upgrades to federal facilities.)

Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Shelby, Richard C. [R-AL], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) repeal the estate and generation-skipping transfer taxes, and (2) make permanent the maximum 35% gift tax rate and the lifetime gift tax exemption. Provides for an inflation adjustment to such exemption amount.

title: S. 861, Preventing and Reducing Improper Medicare and Medicaid Expenditures Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. texts: Amends part D (Prescription Drug Benefits) of title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act (SSAct) to direct the Secretary of Health and Human Services (HHS) to prohibit sponsors of prescription drug plans from paying claims for prescription drugs that do not include the valid National Provider Identifier for the drug's prescriber.

title: Paycheck Fairness Act
sponsers: [Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen.
