Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to repeal, beginning with taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017, the excise tax on employer-sponsored health care coverage for which there is an excess benefit (high-cost plans).

title: S. 2046, a bill to authorize the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to issue an order continuing a stay of a hydroelectric license for the Mahoney Lake hydroelectric project in the state of Alaska, and for other purposes
sponsers: [Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: In addition, upon request, FERC must reinstate the construction license and make it effective as of the date the stay is lifted.

title: Protecting Local Fishing Jobs and Communities Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH]]
texts: This bill prohibits the Department of Commerce from requiring sectors of the Northeast Multispecies Fishery to comply with the independent, third-party monitoring program, unless the program is fully funded by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. The program monitors annual catch limits for fishing vessels in that sector. Currently, those sectors are required to develop and implement those programs, and are responsible for the program costs.

title: Keeping Our Commitment to Ending Veteran Homelessness Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR]]
texts: This bill extends through FY2016 authority for the following Department of Veterans Affairs programs:

title: A bill to establish in the Department of Veterans Affairs a continuing medical education program for non-Department medical professionals who treat veterans and family members of veterans to increase knowledge and recognition of medical conditions common to veterans and family members of veterans, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: The program must include education on: (1) dealing with patients who are veterans or family members; (2) identifying and treating common mental and physical conditions of veterans and family members; (3) programs and benefits available to veterans and family members through the VA, the Department of Labor, and other federal agencies and non-federal organizations; and (4) the VA health care system.

title: Private Education Loan Modification Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND]]
texts: This bill temporarily authorizes the Department of the Treasury to establish credit facilities, at no net cost to the federal government, to refinance private student loans to ensure lower interest rates for borrowers. Treasury must first determine that existing borrowers are unable to secure adequate credit accommodations to refinance private student loans.

title: Improving Postal Operations, Service, and Transparency Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], None, Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE]]
texts: This bill directs the Postal Regulatory Commission (PRC) to submit a report on the universal service obligation of the U.S. Postal Service (USPS) that takes into account the changing nature of communications and includes recommendations on better defining such obligation to help keep the USPS relevant in the digital age.

title: Department of Veterans Affairs Billing Accountability Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], None, Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: This bill authorizes the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to waive the requirement that a veteran make copayments for medications, hospital care, nursing home care, and medical services if:

title: Maritime and Energy Workforce Technical Training Enhancement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], None, Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Energy (DOE) to award grants to enable eligible community colleges and other public postsecondary institutions of higher education that are located near marine or port facilities in the Gulf of Mexico, Atlantic Ocean, Pacific Ocean, or Great Lakes to expand upon existing programs in maritime and energy workforce technical training, including by admitting more students, training faculty, expanding facilities, creating new maritime career pathways from an associate degree to a baccalaureate degree, awarding credit for prior learning experience, and increasing cooperation with an appropriate federal agency or the National Science Foundation.

title: Justice is Not For Sale Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT]]
texts: This bill requires federal, state, and local governments and their employees to directly operate and perform core services at adult prisons and detention centers.

title: Medical Countermeasure Innovation Act of 2016
sponsers: [Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to require the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to ensure the issuance of timely and accurate guidelines regarding the use of medical products for countering public health emergencies or material threats.

title: National Volcano Early Warning and Monitoring System Act
sponsers: [Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], None, Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: This bill directs the United States Geological Survey (USGS) to establish the National Volcano Early Warning and Monitoring System to monitor, issue warnings of, and protect U.S. citizens from undue and avoidable harm from, volcanic activity.

title: A bill providing for additional space for the protection and preservation of national collections held by the Smithsonian Institution.
sponsers: [Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], None, Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR]]
texts: NA

title: Metropolitan Weather Hazards Protection Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], None, Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], None, Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Commerce to: (1) maintain and operate at least one Doppler weather radar site within 55 miles of each city in the United States with a population of more than 700,000, and (2) ensure that each such radar is available to the office of the National Weather Service that provides services to that city.

title: Civil Justice Tax Fairness Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow: (1) an exclusion from gross income for amounts received (whether by judgment or settlement, as lump sums or periodic payments) on account of a claim of unlawful discrimination; (2) income averaging for backpay or frontpay amounts received from such claims; and (3) an exemption from the alternative minimum tax (AMT) for any tax benefit resulting from the income averaging of amounts received from an unlawful discrimination claim.

title: Advancing FASD Research, Prevention, and Services Act
sponsers: [Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to revise and extend the Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD) programs (as renamed under this Act, previously the Fetal Alcohol Syndrome and Fetal Alcohol Effect programs). The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) must: (1) carry out research on FASD; (2) facilitate surveillance, public health research, and prevention of FASD; and (3) continue the Interagency Coordinating Committee on Fetal Alcohol Syndrome.

title: National Memorial to Fallen Educators Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS]]
texts: This bill designates as the "National Memorial to Fallen Educators" an existing memorial located at the National Teachers Hall of Fame in Emporia, Kansas. The memorial is not a unit of the National Park System, and its designation shall not require or allow federal funds to be expended for any purpose related to it.

title: A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to extend authority for operation of the Department of Veterans Affairs Regional Office in Manila, the Republic of the Philippines.
sponsers: [Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI]]
texts: NA

title: Gold King Mine Spill Recovery Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO]]
texts: This bill entitles persons to compensation for allowable damages (i.e., property, business, or financial losses) under the Federal Tort Claims Act if they were injured by the spill into Cement Creek from the Gold King Mine near Silverton, Colorado. The spill occurred on August 5, 2015.

title: Career and Technical Education Opportunity Act
sponsers: [Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA]]
texts: This bill amends title IV (Student Assistance) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to expand the programs eligible to participate in federal student aid.

title: Working Student Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: This bill amends title IV (Student Assistance) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to modify the income protection allowance levels used to calculate a student's expected family contribution and need for financial assistance. (An income protection allowance is an amount for basic living expenses that is protected from being considered income available for postsecondary educational expenses.)

title: Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act
sponsers: [Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. McConnell, Mitch [R-KY], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to require any health care practitioner who is present when a child is born alive following an abortion or attempted abortion to: (1) exercise the same degree of care as reasonably provided to any other child born alive at the same gestational age, and (2) ensure that such child is immediately admitted to a hospital. The term "born alive" means the complete expulsion or extraction from his or her mother, at any stage of development, who after such expulsion or extraction breathes or has a beating heart, pulsation of the umbilical cord, or definite movement of voluntary muscles, regardless of whether the umbilical cord has been cut.

title: EUREKA Act
sponsers: [Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to require the National Institutes of Health (NIH) to establish EUREKA prize competitions to achieve high-priority breakthroughs in Alzheimer's disease and dementia prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and care.

title: Fire Sprinkler Incentive Act
sponsers: [Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], None, Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow: (1) 100% expensing in a current taxable year of the cost of automated fire sprinkler system retrofit property, as defined by this Act; and (2) accelerated depreciation (i.e., a 15-year recovery period) of automated fire sprinkler system retrofit property that is installed in a building or structure where the floor of any occupiable story is greater than 75 feet above the lowest level of fire department vehicle access and that has a certain classification by the National Fire Protection Association.

title: Mount Hood Cooper Spur Land Exchange Clarification Act
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR]]
texts: This bill amends the Omnibus Public Land Management Act of 2009 to revise details of the Cooper Spur-Government Camp land exchange between the United States and Oregon.

title: GAP Act
sponsers: [Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC]]
texts: This bill amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to expand exceptions to the prohibition against sex discrimination to include payments pursuant to a differential based on expertise, shift, or a business-related factor other than sex, including but not limited to education, training, or experience.

title: Ambulatory Surgical Center Quality and Access Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to: (1) require the payment system for ambulatory surgical center (ASC) services to feature certain positive annual adjustments equivalent to those made with respect to hospital outpatient department (OPD) services; (2) revise quality reporting requirements to permit publicly available, side-by-side comparisons of quality measures for ASCs and OPDs in the same geographic area; and (3) require the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), when excluding requested procedures from the list of those approved to be performed in ASCs, to cite specified reasons for doing so.

title: A bill to require the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to establish a program under which the Administrator shall defer the designation of an area as a nonattainment area for purposes of the 8-hour ozone national ambient air quality standard if the area achieves and maintains certain standards under a voluntary early action compact plan.
sponsers: [Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT]]
texts: The EPA: (1) must issue a decision on each early action compact plan no later than one year after it is submitted, and (2) may not designate an area as a nonattainment area until it has issued a decision to approve or deny a plan.

title: A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 7715 Post Road in North Kingstown, Rhode Island, as the "Melvoid J. Benson Post Office Building".
sponsers: [Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI]]
texts: NA

title: No Government No Pay Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], None, Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND]]
texts: A Member of Congress may not receive pay, during a government shutdown, equal to the product of the Member's daily rate of pay and the number of 24-hour periods during which the government shutdown is in effect. This prohibition shall apply on and after the convening of the 115th Congress.

title: American Worker Health Care Tax Relief Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to repeal, for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017, the excise tax on employer-sponsored health care coverage for which there is an excess benefit (high-cost plans).

title: Super Pollutants Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT]]
texts: This bill requires the President to establish the Interagency Task Force on Short-Lived Climate Pollutant Mitigation. The Task Force must report on federal agencies' plans for reducing those pollutants, including: (1) black carbon (soot emissions), (2) methane, and (3) hydrofluorocarbons with high global warming potential (high-GWP HFC).

title: Child Support Assistance Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA]]
texts: Amends the Fair Credit Reporting Act, with respect to the permissible purposes of consumer reports, to authorize a consumer reporting agency to furnish a consumer report in response to a request by the head of a state or local child support enforcement agency (or an authorized state or local government official), if the requester certifies that the report is needed for enforcing a child support order, award, agreement, or judgment.

title: United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reauthorization Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN]]
texts: This bill reauthorizes the U.S. Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF) through FY2019.

title: United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reauthorization Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL]]
texts: This bill reauthorizes the U.S. Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF) through FY2019.

title: Pipeline Improvement and Preventing Spills Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Transportation (DOT) to prescribe minimum standards to require the owner or operator of a pipeline facility to notify all owners and residents of property located within 2,000 feet of a transmission line of:

title: A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to extend authorities for the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to expand presumption of service connection for compensation for diseases the Secretary determines are associated with exposure to herbicide agents, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT]]
texts: NA

title: Department of Veterans Affairs Expiring Authorities Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], None, Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT]]
texts: This bill extends specified Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) programs.

title: S. 2083, a bill to extend the deadline for commencement of construction of a hydroelectric project
sponsers: [Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC]]
texts: FERC may also reinstate the license effective as of its expiration date if the period required for commencement of project construction has expired before enactment of this Act. The first extension authorized under this Act shall take effect upon that expiration date.

title: Protecting American Jobs Act
sponsers: [Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK]]
texts: Amends the National Labor Relations Act to repeal the authority of the General Counsel of the National Labor Relations Board to issue, and prosecute before the Board, complaints with respect to unfair labor practices.

title: A bill to clarify that nonprofit organizations such as Habitat for Humanity may accept donated mortgage appraisals, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR]]
texts: NA

title: Justice for Victims of Iranian Terrorism Act
sponsers: [Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill prohibits the President, until Iran has paid each judgment against it, from:

title: S. 2087, Fort Scott National Historic Site Boundary Modification Act
sponsers: [Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS]]
texts: This bill allows the Department of the Interior to acquire by purchase with appropriated funds or by donation (as under current law) the lands and interests in land, together with buildings and improvements, known as Fort Scott in the city of Fort Scott in Bourbon County, Kansas.

title: A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 90 Cornell Street in Kingston, New York, at the "Staff Sergeant Robert H. Dietz Post Office Building".
sponsers: [Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY]]
texts: NA

title: American Energy Innovation Act
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. texts: This bill encourages and establishes requirements concerning:

title: Social Security Earned Benefits Payment Act
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL]]
texts: This bill amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) of the Social Security Act to require allocations to the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund equal to: (1) 2.65% of the amount of wages and self-employment income paid between December 31, 2015, and January 1, 2021; and (2) 1.80% of wages and self-employment income paid after December 31, 2020.

title: JOLT Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC]]
texts: Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to authorize the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to admit into the United States a qualifying Canadian citizen over 50 years old and spouse for a period not to exceed 240 days (in a single 365-day period) if the person maintains a Canadian residence and owns a U.S. residence or has rented a U.S. accommodation for the duration of such stay.

title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt amounts paid for aircraft management services from the excise taxes imposed on transportation by air.
sponsers: [Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: NA

title: A bill to provide that the Secretary of Transportation shall have sole authority to appoint Federal Directors to the Board of Directors of the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority.
sponsers: [Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA]]
texts: The signatory parties to the WMATA Compact shall amend it to reflect such authority.

title: IRGC Terrorist Designation Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX]]
texts: This bill expresses the sense of Congress that Iran's Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) meets the criteria for designation as a foreign terrorist organization and should be so designated by the Secretary of State.

title: Black Lung Benefits Improvement Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA]]
texts: This bill amends the Black Lung Benefits Act to revise requirements for miners' claims for pneumoconiosis (black lung) benefits.

title: HIV Clinical Services Improvement Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI]]
texts: This bill amends title XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act to require payment under the Medicaid program for services furnished by recipients of Ryan White Part C grants, which support comprehensive primary care in outpatient settings for individuals living with HIV.

title: Students Before Profits Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], None, Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT]]
texts: This bill amends title IV (Student Assistance) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to require the Department of Education (ED) to recalculate the cohort default rate and redetermine title IV eligibility for an institution of higher education (IHE) that engages in default manipulation.

title: Student Loan Relief Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], None, Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH]]
texts: This bill authorizes the Department of the Treasury to establish a temporary three-year program to facilitate federal student loan refinancing into the private market, at no cost to the federal government, to ensure payment of lower interest rates on student loans. Private lenders under such refinancing program shall be eligible to receive a federal government guarantee of 95% of loans.

title: Tobacco to 21 Act
sponsers: [Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA]]
texts: This bill prohibits the sale or distribution of tobacco products to individuals under the age of 21.

title: A bill to amend title 54, United States Code, to extend the Land and Water Conservation Fund.
sponsers: [Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], None, Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC]]
texts: NA

title: Standard Merger and Acquisition Reviews Through Equal Rules Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN]]
texts: This bill amends the Clayton Act with respect to actions brought by the Attorney General for violations of antitrust laws. The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) is required, but only under the Clayton Act, to exercise the same authority and procedures of the Attorney General specified in the Act with respect to the prohibition against acquisition by one corporation of the stock of another (merger) that may substantially lessen competition or tend to create a monopoly.

title: A bill to modify a provision relating to adjustments of certain State apportionments for Federal highway programs, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ]]
texts: NA

title: Preserving Medicare Advantage for all Medicare Beneficiaries Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], None, Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to: (1) temporarily prohibit the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid from terminating a Medicare Advantage (MA) plan contract solely because the MA plan fails to achieve a certain minimum quality rating, provided that the MA plan achieves a quality rating of at least two out of five stars; and (2) establish a demonstration project to provide funds to MA organizations for the development or expansion of programs or services to improve health care delivery and outcomes for enrollees of low socioeconomic status.

title: Help Find the Missing Act
sponsers: [Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT]]
texts: This bill authorizes the Department of Justice (DOJ), through the National Institute of Justice, to maintain public databases, known as the National Missing and Unidentified Persons System (NamUs), of missing persons and unidentified remains.

title: Wounded Warrior Employment Improvement Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC]]
texts: Directs the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to develop and publish an action plan for improving the training and rehabilitation services and assistance provided by the VA for veterans with service-connected disabilities.

title: Building a Health Care Workforce for the Future Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to require the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) to award matching grants to enable states to implement scholarship programs to ensure an adequate supply of health professionals.

title: Preserving Patient Access to Post-Acute Hospital Care Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], None, Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to delay by two additional years the application of negative payment adjustments under the "25-percent rule" to certain long-term care hospitals (LTCHs) and satellite facilities. This rule reduces payments to a long-term care facility that admits proportionately more patients from any single hospital.

title: Directing Dollars to Disaster Relief Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], None, Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH]]
texts: This bill directs the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) to:

title: Women's Pension Protection Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA]]
texts: This bill amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) to: (1) extend spousal consent requirements to defined contribution pension plans, and (2) allow certain long-term part-time workers to participate in pension plans that include either a qualified cash or deferred arrangement or a salary reduction agreement.

title: Higher Education Innovation Act
sponsers: [Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to establish a voluntary, alternative accreditation system for higher education providers.

title: Walter Scott Notification Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: This bill requires a state that receives funding under the Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance Grant (JAG) program to report certain data on deadly shootings by law enforcement officers. It reduces by 10% the JAG allocation of a state that fails to comply.

title: Crowdsourcing and Citizen Science Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI]]
texts: This bill authorizes each federal agency, or multiple federal agencies working cooperatively, to use crowdsourcing and citizen science approaches to conduct activities designed to advance the agency's mission or the joint mission of the group of agencies.

title: A bill to correct inconsistencies in the definitions relating to Native Americans in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
sponsers: [Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI]]
texts: Individuals included in the above definition are eligible for special monthly enrollment periods on health insurance exchanges and elimination of cost-sharing under individual health coverage for those whose income is not more than 300% of the poverty line. (Currently, only members of Indian tribes are eligible for these benefits.)

title: Targeted Employment Areas Improvement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ]]
texts: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to increase the number of fiscal year EB-5 (employment creation) visas for qualified immigrants who invest in a new commercial enterprise which, in addition to creating jobs in a targeted employment area, will invest the required capital in such area.

title: S. 2116, Small Business Broadband and Emerging Information Technology Enhancement Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], None, Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: This bill amends the Small Business Act to direct the Small Business Administration (SBA) Office of Investment and Innovation to designate a senior employee to serve as the broadband and emerging information technology (BEIT) coordinator.

title: A bill to prevent certain discriminatory taxation of natural gas pipeline property.
sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX]]
texts: The bill: (1) grants jurisdiction to U.S. district courts to prevent violations of this Act, and (2) sets forth criteria governing relief for claims relating to violations of this Act.

title: Ensuring Enhanced Access to Primary Care Act
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM]]
texts: This bill amends title XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act to: (1) extend the application of the Medicare payment rate floor to certain primary care services furnished under the Medicaid program, and (2) apply the same payment rate floor to primary care services furnished under the Medicaid program by certain other providers.

title: Iran Policy Oversight Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of State, the Department of Defense, the Department of the Treasury, and the Director of National Intelligence to submit to Congress every two years a joint 10-year strategy to counter Iranian activities in the Middle East, North Africa, and beyond.

title: Veterans Justice Outreach Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to carry out a program to support veterans in contact with the criminal justice system by discouraging unnecessary criminalization of mental illness and other nonviolent crimes.

title: Preserving American Access to Information Act
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: This bill directs: (1) the President to take appropriate actions to enhance the authority and capacity of the National Declassification Center under Executive Order 13526, or any successor executive order, to promote a government-wide strategy for the declassification of information; (2) the National Declassification Center to provide for consultation between the Center's advisory panel and the public on a regular basis; (3) federal agencies to make efforts to identify and designate historically valuable records during the initial classification process to ensure preservation and timely access to such records following eventual declassification; (4) the Public Interest Declassification Board to submit reports to Congress on pilot programs to assess the feasibility and advisability of mechanisms to improve the current declassification capabilities of such agencies; and (5) the Public Interest Declassification Board to review the rules of the Senate and the House of Representatives regarding the declassification of classified Committee records and make recommendations to improve declassification efforts.

title: Invest in Our Communities Act
sponsers: [Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY]]
texts: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to: (1) exempt spouses and children of EB-5 investor immigrants from worldwide employment-based immigration limits, and (2) revise the fiscal year worldwide level of employment-based immigrant admissions.

title: CORRECTIONS Act
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Lee, Mike [R-UT], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill permits a court to reduce the mandatory minimum prison term imposed on certain non-violent defendants convicted of a high-level first-time or low-level repeat drug offense (including unlawful import, export, manufacture, or distribution of, or possession with intent to distribute a controlled substance).

title: New Skills for New Jobs Act
sponsers: [Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of the Treasury, on a quarterly basis, to make payments to an eligible community college in an amount equal to the aggregate new job tax withholding matches for qualified training provided to job trainees who are U.S. citizens. The bill defines "qualified training" as education or training to provide an individual with the education or skills necessary to perform the job for which such individual will be employed or with licenses or certificates necessary for such employment. Any job for which a trainee is hired must be a new job.

title: Small Business Lending and Economic Inequality Reduction Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], None, Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA]]
texts: This bill amends the Small Business Act to establish a Community Advantage Program, under which the Small Business Administration (SBA) may guarantee loans up to $350,000 made by specified kinds of institutions, including:

title: NA
sponsers: [Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA]]
texts: This bill amends the Small Business Act to direct the Small Business Administration (SBA) Office of Women's Business Ownership to address issues concerning specified disciplines required for starting, operating, and increasing a small business.

title: Dr. Chris Kirkpatrick Whistleblower Protection Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA]]
texts: This bill directs the Special Counsel: (1) within 10 days after a federal agency terminates a probationary employee who has submitted an allegation of a prohibited personnel practice, to determine whether a substantial likelihood exists that the agency engaged in such practice and that the termination was related; (2) upon determining such likelihood exists, to request the Merit Systems Protection Board (MSPB) to order a stay of the termination for 60 days (and up to an additional 6 months) to complete an investigation; (3) upon determining that the employee's termination was related to such a practice, to request the MSPB to order reinstatement of such employee; and (4) upon determining that the agency did not engage in such a practice or that the employee's termination was not related to such a practice, to request the MSPB to order the immediate enforcement of the termination. An agency must give priority to a request for a transfer submitted by an employee granted such a stay or reinstated.

title: S. 2128, Inspector General Mandates Reporting Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO]]
texts: This bill requires each Office of Inspector General to submit to the Council of Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency a report which: (1) shall include a list of each reporting requirement for such Office, and (2) may include a list of reporting requirements that such Office recommends should be modified or repealed.

title: Transportation, Housing and Urban Development, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2016
sponsers: [Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME]]
texts: Provides FY2016 appropriations to the Department of Agriculture (USDA), the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, the Department of the Interior's Bureau of Reclamation, the Department of Energy (DOE), the Department of Transportation (DOT), the Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD), and several independent and related agencies.

title: Department of State, Foreign Operations, and Related Programs Appropriations Act, 2016
sponsers: [Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], None, Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS]]
texts: Provides FY2016 appropriations for the Department of Defense, energy and water development, the Department of Homeland Security, military construction, the Department of Veterans Affairs, the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs.

title: An Act Making Appropriations for Law Enforcement and for Other Purposes, 2016
sponsers: [Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], None, Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS]]
texts: Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2016

title: D.C. Opportunity Scholarship Program School Certification Requirements Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO]]
texts: Provides FY2016 appropriations for financial services and general government; the Department of the Interior and the Environmental Protection Agency; the Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education; and several related agencies.

title: Fraud Reduction and Data Analytics Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], None, Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE]]
texts: This bill requires the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) to establish guidelines for federal agencies to establish financial and administrative controls to identify and assess fraud risks and design and implement control activities in order to prevent, detect, and respond to fraud, including improper payments.

title: Grow Our Own Directive: Physician Assistant Employment and Education Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to carry out the Grow Our Own Directive or G.O.O.D. pilot program to provide educational assistance to certain former members of the Armed Forces for education and training as VA physician assistants.

title: A bill to address the liability of the Environmental Protection Agency relating to the Animas and San Juan Rivers spill.
sponsers: [Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR]]
texts: Civil actions relating to that spill must be commenced within 10 years after the cause of action accrues.

title: Improving Small Business Innovative Research and Technologies Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE]]
texts: This bill amends the Small Business Act to extend through FY2017 the requirement that the Small Business Administration (SBA) allow each federal agency required to conduct a Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Program to use up to 3% of allocated SBIR funds for the administration of its SBIR or Small Business Technology Transfer (STTR) Program as well as other specified administrative, oversight, and contract processing costs.

title: Military Family Stability Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], None, Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO]]
texts: This bill allows a member of the Armed Forces undergoing a permanent change of station and the member's spouse to jointly elect that the spouse may relocate to the new location at the time during the covered relocation period as the member and spouse jointly select.

title: S. 2138, Small Business Subcontracting Transparency Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA]]
texts: This bill amends the Small Business Act to revise requirements with respect to the Small Business Administration (SBA) review and acceptance of subcontracting plans.

title: Small Contractors Improve Competition Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: This bill expresses the sense of Congress that, when used appropriately, with respect to federal agency procurement, an auction between a group of offerors who compete against each other by submitting offers for a contract or task or delivery order with the ability to submit revised offers with lower prices throughout the course of the auction (reverse auction) may improve the federal government's procurement of commercially available commodities by increasing competition, reducing prices, and improving opportunities for small businesses.

title: Hide No Harm Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to make it a crime for a business entity or business executive to knowingly conceal information about its business practices or products that pose an imminent risk of death or serious physical injury to consumers and workplace danger.

title: TRUST IT Act
sponsers: NA
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to define "information blocking" and "interoperability" for health information technology (IT). Information blocking is preventing, discouraging, or interfering with the access, exchange, or use of electronic health information. Interoperability is the ability of health information systems to exchange information and use exchanged information.

title: Workplace Democracy Act
sponsers: [Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], None, Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT]]
texts: This bill amends the National Labor Relations Act to require the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) to certify without an election an individual or labor organization as the exclusive representative of the employees in a unit appropriate for bargaining if a majority of the employees has signed valid authorizations designating the individual or labor organization specified in a properly filed petition as their bargaining representative and no other individual or labor organization is currently certified or recognized as the exclusive representative of any of the employees in the unit.

title: S. 2143, a bill to provide for the authority for the successors and assigns of the Starr-Camargo Bridge Company to maintain and operate a toll bridge across the Rio Grande near Rio Grande City, Texas, and for other purposes
sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX]]
texts: The authority, which currently expires 66 years after completion of the bridge, is made permanent and expanded to include the successors or assigns of the company. The bridge must not consist of more than 14 lanes.

title: North Korea Sanctions and Policy Enhancement Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. texts: Directs the President to investigate information of sanctionable activities involving North Korea and to designate and apply sanctions with respect to any person that knowingly:

title: Middle East Refugee Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2016
sponsers: [Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], None, Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC]]
texts: This bill provides $1 billion in FY2016 supplemental appropriations to the Department of State's Migration and Refugee Assistance account for expenses to respond to the refugee crisis resulting from conflict in the Middle East, including costs associated with the resettlement of refugees in the United States. The funds are designated as an emergency requirement, which exempts the funds from discretionary spending limits and other budget enforcement rules.

title: Stop Sanctuary Policies and Protect Americans Act
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], None, Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA]]
texts: This bill prohibits a sanctuary jurisdiction from receiving grants under the State Criminal Alien Assistance Program, the Community Oriented Policing Services Program, and the Community Development Block Grant Program. A sanctuary jurisdiction is a state or political subdivision that has a policy or practice in effect that: (1) prohibits or restricts information sharing about an individual's immigration status, or (2) prohibits compliance with a lawfully issued detainer request or notification of release request.

title: Pension Accountability Act
sponsers: [Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL]]
texts: This bill amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) and the Internal Revenue Code to revise rules for voting on the suspension of pension benefits under multiemployer plans in endangered or critical status. The bill changes the voting procedure for suspending plan benefits to provide that a suspension shall go into effect unless a majority of plan participants and beneficiaries who cast a vote (currently, a majority of all plan participants and beneficiaries) reject the suspension. The bill also eliminates the authority of the Department of the Treasury, in the case of systemically important plans, to override a vote of plan participants to reject a suspension. A plan is systemically important if projected financial assistance to the plan will exceed $1 billion if suspensions are not implemented.

title: Protecting Medicare Beneficiaries Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen.
