[D-VT], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to: (1) prevent 2016 increases to Medicare Part B premiums and deductibles for enrollees, and (2) authorize federal funding to offset the corresponding reduction in aggregate monthly premiums.

title: Understanding the True Cost of College Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN]]
texts: This bill amends the Higher Education Opportunity Act and the Higher Education Act of 1965 to require institutions of higher education to use a standardized financial aid offer form that meets specified requirements.

title: Net Price Calculator Improvement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], None, Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA]]
texts: This bill amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to establish the minimum requirements for the net price calculator that an institution of higher education (IHE) receiving federal funds under title IV (Student Assistance) of the Act must include on its website. (An IHE's net price is the average yearly price actually charged to first-time, full-time undergraduate students receiving student aid at the school after deducting such aid.)

title: Family Health Care Accessibility Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], None, Sen. Thune, John [R-SD]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to deem a health professional volunteer providing primary health care to an individual at a community health center or through programs or events carried out by a center to be an employee of the Public Health Service for purposes of any civil action that may arise from providing services to patients. For a volunteer to be covered by this liability protection, the Department of Health and Human Services must approve the center's application to sponsor the volunteer.

title: Electrify Africa Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], None, Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Alexander, Lamar [R-TN], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD]]
texts: This bill directs the President to establish a multiyear strategy to assist countries in sub-Saharan Africa implement national power strategies and develop an appropriate mix of power solutions to provide access to reliable, affordable, and sustainable power in order to reduce poverty and drive economic growth.

title: Provider Payment Sunshine Act
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT]]
texts: This bill amends title XI (General Provisions) of the Social Security Act to expand reporting requirements related to the transparency of physician ownership or investment interests.

title: Elimination of Double Subsidies for the Hardrock Mining Industry Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to disallow the percentage depletion allowance for hardrock mines located on land currently subject to the general mining laws, or on land patented under such laws.

title: West Coast Ocean Protection Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR]]
texts: This bill amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to prohibit the Department of the Interior from issuing a lease for the exploration, development, or production of oil or natural gas in any area of the outer Continental Shelf off the coast of California, Oregon, or Washington.

title: Wildfire and Emergency Airspace Protection Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to make it a crime to knowingly launch a drone for recreational purposes that recklessly interferes with disaster response or firefighting efforts.

title: SAFE DRONE Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to make it a crime to knowingly operate a drone in a restricted area. A "restricted area" is an area that is:

title: PTC Elimination Act
sponsers: [Sen. Lankford, James [R-OK]]
texts: This bill repeals the tax credit for producing electricity from renewable resources (e.g., wind, biomass, trash, geothermal or solar energy facilities). The bill also expresses the sense of Congress that such credit should be allowed to expire and should not be extended.

title: Women's Public Health and Safety Act
sponsers: [Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], None, Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA]]
texts: This bill amends title XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act to allow a state to exclude from participation in the state's Medicaid program a provider that performs an abortion, unless: (1) the pregnancy is the result of rape or incest, or (2) the woman suffers from a physical issue that would place her in danger of death unless an abortion is performed. (Under current law, a state plan for medical assistance must provide that any individual eligible for medical assistance may obtain required services from any provider qualified to perform them.)

title: Military Enlistment Opportunity Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV]]
texts: Amends citizenship and residency qualifications for enlistment in the U.S. Armed Forces to permit enlistment of additional persons who: (1) have resided continuously in a lawful status in the United States for at least two years, or (2) possess an employment authorization document issued by U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services under requirements of the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) policy entitled Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals.

title: Liberian Refugee Immigration Fairness Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Homeland Security to adjust to permanent resident status a qualifying Liberian national who: (1) has been continuously present in the United States between January 1, 2013, through the date of status adjustment application; or (2) is the spouse, child, or unmarried son or daughter of such an alien.

title: Librarian of Congress Succession Modernization Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT]]
texts: This bill limits the term of the Librarian of Congress to 10 years.

title: Streamlining and Investing in Broadband Infrastructure Act
sponsers: [Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ]]
texts: This bill requires the National Telecommunications and Information Administration to issue best practices relating to broadband infrastructure and installation for state broadband coordination offices, with an emphasis on rural areas.

title: A bill to extend the secure rural schools and community self-determination program and to make permanent the payment in lieu of taxes program and the land and water conservation fund.
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR]]
texts: The bill eliminates the fiscal year limitation on funding for the Payments in Lieu of Taxes Program. This Program compensates local governments for tax revenue lost due to tax-exempt federal lands within their boundaries.

title: A bill to amend title 54, United States Code, to permanently authorize the Land and Water Conservation Fund.
sponsers: [Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA]]
texts: NA

title: Timely Mental Health for Foster Youth Act
sponsers: [Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR]]
texts: This bill amends part B (Child and Family Services) of title IV of the Social Security Act with respect to state plans for the ongoing oversight and coordination of health care services for children in a foster care placement.

title: 21st Century Buy American Act
sponsers: [Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT]]
texts: This bill amends the Buy American Act to define the term "substantially all" to mean that articles, materials, or supplies shall be treated as made substantially all from articles, materials, or supplies mined, produced, or manufactured in the United States if the cost of the domestic components of such articles, materials, or supplies exceeds 60% of the total cost of all such components.

title: Law Enforcement Trust and Integrity Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD]]
texts: This bill requires the Department of Justice (DOJ) to analyze existing law enforcement accreditation standards, recommend additional areas for the development of national standards, recommend the adoption of additional standards, and adopt policies and procedures to encourage accreditation of law enforcement agencies. It authorizes DOJ to make grants to federal, state, local, and tribal law enforcement agencies to obtain accreditation from certified organizations.

title: A bill to amend title 54, United States Code, to extend the Land and Water Conservation Fund.
sponsers: [Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: NA

title: VETS Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], None, Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA]]
texts: Allows a health care professional who is authorized to provide health care through the Department of Veterans Affairs and who is licensed, registered, or certified in a state to practice his or her profession at any location in any state, regardless of where the professional or patient is located, if the professional is using telemedicine to provide treatment.

title: SOAR Reauthorization Act
sponsers: [Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ]]
texts: This bill amends the District of Columbia Code to prohibit the Department of Education from limiting the number of eligible students receiving District of Columbia Opportunity Scholarship Program (OSP) scholarships, and from preventing otherwise eligible students from participating in the OSP because of:

title: Protecting Consumers from Unreasonable Rates Act
sponsers: [Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to declare that federal requirements that the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) review unreasonable premium increases in health care coverage do not prohibit a state from imposing additional rate requirements on health insurance issuers that are more protective of consumers. The review is expanded to include all rate increases, not only premium increases.

title: Improving Access to Mental Health Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to: (1) increase the Medicare reimbursement rate for clinical social worker services, (2) exclude clinical social worker services from the prospective payment system in which predetermined amounts form the basis for payment under Medicare, and (3) alter the definition of "clinical social worker services" as it relates to Medicare.

title: Creating Quality Technical Educators Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV]]
texts: This bill amends title II (Teacher Quality Enhancement) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to authorize grants under the Teacher Quality Partnership grant program to be used for secondary school career and technical education teacher preparation programs. The grant program provides funds to partnerships of high-need local educational agencies, high-need schools or early education programs, and institutions of higher education (IHEs) to train current and prospective teachers and school leaders.

title: Department of Veterans Affairs Provider Equity Act
sponsers: [Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], None, Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: This bill includes podiatrists within the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) definition of physician, and increases their pay grade to match other VA physician compensation.

title: Affordable College Textbook Act
sponsers: [Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], None, Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Education (ED) to make competitive grants to institutions of higher education (IHEs) to support pilot programs that expand the use of open textbooks in order to achieve savings for students.

title: S. 2177, Medgar Evers House Study Act
sponsers: [Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS]]
texts: Directs the Department of the Interior to conduct a special resource study of the home of the late civil rights activist Medgar Evers, which is located at 2332 Margaret Walker Alexander Drive in Jackson, Mississippi.

title: Timber Revitalization and Economic Enhancement Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to the reduced tax rate on the net timber gains of corporations, to: (1) adjust the formula for calculating such rate, and (2) make such reduced rate permanent.

title: Veteran CARE Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT]]
texts: This bill authorizes the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), if unable to furnish hospital care, medical services, or extended care at VA facilities or under other authorized contracts or sharing agreements, to enter into a Veterans Care Agreement with an eligible provider to furnish such care and services.

title: Protecting Older Workers Against Discrimination Act
sponsers: [Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO]]
texts: This bill amends the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 to specify that an unlawful employment practice is established when the complaining party demonstrates that age or participation in investigations, proceedings, or litigation under such Act was a motivating factor for any unlawful employment practice, even though other factors also motivated the practice (thereby allowing what are commonly known as "mixed motive" claims).

title: Default Prevention Act
sponsers: [Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY]]
texts: This bill requires the following obligations to be granted priority over all other U.S. obligations if the public debt reaches the statutory limit:

title: Cut, Cap, and Balance Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY]]
texts: This bill amends the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to establish FY2016 spending limits of $2.832 trillion for new budget authority and $2.884 trillion for outlays. Spending for Social Security, Medicare, Veterans Benefits and Services, Net Interest, and Military Personnel is exempt from the limits.

title: Export-Import Bank Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], None, Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL]]
texts: This bill amends the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 to reduce, for each of FY2015-FY2019, the authorized aggregate amount of loans, guarantees, and insurance the Export-Import Bank may have outstanding at any time.

title: Foreign Aid Transparency and Accountability Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], None, Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL]]
texts: This bill requires the President to establish guidelines for the establishment of measurable goals, performance metrics, and monitoring and evaluation plans for U.S. foreign development and economic assistance.

title: Breast Cancer Awareness Commemorative Coin Act
sponsers: [Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Reid, Harry [D-NV], Sen. Carper, Thomas R. [D-DE], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of the Treasury to mint and issue up to 50,000 $5 gold coins (to be made of "pink gold" containing at least 75% gold), 400,000 $1 silver coins, and 750,000 half-dollar clad coins emblematic of the fight against breast cancer.

title: Investing in Student Success Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR]]
texts: This bill authorizes an individual (i.e., a student) and another person (i.e., an investor) to enter an income-share agreement (ISA) in which the student agrees to pay a percentage of future income, for a specified period of time, in exchange for funds to pay for postsecondary education, workforce development, or other purposes.

title: FDA Regulatory Efficiency Act
sponsers: [Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to require the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to establish a third-party quality system assessment program to accredit persons to assess whether a medical device manufacturer's quality system can ensure the safety and effectiveness or substantial equivalence of an approved medical device after certain changes, including changes in manufacturing or changes to enhance device safety.

title: Rare Disease Innovation Act
sponsers: [None, Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to expand the humanitarian device exemption to authorize the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to exempt from effectiveness requirements certain medical devices intended to benefit fewer than 8,000 individuals. Currently, the FDA may exempt devices intended to benefit fewer than 4,000 individuals.

title: Federal Land Transaction Facilitation Act Reauthorization of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID]]
texts: Amends the Federal Land Transaction Facilitation Act (FLTFA) to reauthorize and make permanent the program for the completion of appraisals and satisfaction of other legal requirements for the sale or exchange of public land identified for disposal in approved land use plans under the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976.

title: REST Act
sponsers: [Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: This bill amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 and the Elementary and Secondary Act of 1965 to: (1) establish several new grant programs for students training to become educators in rural schools, and (2) enhance federal student loan forgiveness for rural educators.

title: PARTNERSHIPS Act
sponsers: [Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR]]
texts: This bill amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to establish a state-federal partnership to promote state investment in public higher education. The bill directs the Department of Education to award annual block grants to states that increase public higher education operating support on a per student basis, using a specified formula. As a condition of receiving grants, states must use grant funds to reduce tuition costs and support the enrollment of low-income students in state public educational institutions.

title: NICS Reporting Improvement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY]]
texts: This bill amends the NICS Improvement Amendments Act of 2007 to revise the requirement for states to provide to the Department of Justice (DOJ), as an eligibility condition to receive a grant under the NICS Act Record Improvement Program (NARIP) and a waiver of the grant match requirement under the National Criminal History Improvement Program, estimates of firearms-related disqualifying records.

title: Kate's Law
sponsers: [Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], None, Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], None, Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Rubio, Marco [R-FL], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Sasse, Ben  [R-NE], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS]]
texts: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to increase from two years to five years the maximum prison term for an alien who reenters after being denied admission, excluded, deported, or removed.

title: Clean Cookstoves and Fuels Support Act
sponsers: [Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of State to work to advance the goals of the Global Alliance for Clean Cookstoves.

title: Sixth Amendment Preservation Act
sponsers: [Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to limit the detention authority of the United States.

title: A bill to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide for the non-application of Medicare competitive acquisition rates to complex rehabilitative wheelchairs and accessories.
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Graham, Lindsey [R-SC], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO]]
texts: NA

title: Securing Care for Seniors Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA]]
texts: This bill amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to require the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) to periodically revise the Medicare Advantage (MA) risk adjustment system, such that an individual's risk score takes into account the number of chronic conditions with which the individual has been diagnosed.

title: Domestic Violence Gun Homicide Prevention Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY]]
texts: This bill authorizes the Department of Justice's Office of Community Oriented Policing Services to award grants to states to carry out certain policies and procedures that restrict and penalize firearm possession by or transfer to a person subject to a domestic violence protection order or a person convicted of a domestic violence misdemeanor.

title: Regulatory Authority Clarification Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT]]
texts: This bill prohibits a federal agency from promulgating a rule that conflicts with or fails to carry out any concurrent resolution enacted by Congress that clarifies the meaning of a provision of law, including a clarification of whether a law delegates certain authority to an agency. If an agency has a rule in effect that conflicts with or fails to carry out the meaning of the resolution, the agency must promulgate new rules that carry out such meaning.

title: Workplace Advancement Act
sponsers: [Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Portman, Rob [R-OH], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], None, Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE]]
texts: This bill amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to prohibit discharging or retaliating against any employee because such employee has inquired about, discussed, or disclosed comparative compensation information for the purpose of determining whether the employer is compensating an employee in a manner that provides equal pay for equal work.

title: S. 2201, Global Gateways Trade Capacity Act of 2016
sponsers: [Sen. Corker, Bob [R-TN], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE]]
texts: This bill places primary responsibility on the Department of State for coordinating a whole-of-government effort to expand U.S. efforts in trade capacity building.

title: Agriculture Equipment and Machinery Depreciation Act
sponsers: [Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], None, Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to eliminate the placed-in-service restriction on the depreciation of certain farming business machinery and equipment and to make permanent the five-year recovery period for such property.

title: Earned Income Tax Credit and Child Tax Credit Equity for Puerto Rico Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to make citizens of Puerto Rico eligible for the federal earned income tax credit and allow them to claim the refundable portion of the child tax credit on the same basis as U.S. taxpayers.

title: End of Suffering Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA]]
texts: This bill prohibits any federal or state law, regulation, or agency action from restricting the right of a mentally competent adult who is suffering from an advanced illness with intolerable pain or a terminal illness to receive pain relief treatment from a physician.

title: Tribal Healing to Wellness Courts Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], None, Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT]]
texts: This bill permits the Department of Justice (DOJ) to award grants to tribal governments acting in partnership with state or local governments for tribal healing to wellness courts. (A tribal healing to wellness court is a drug court that is a component of a tribal justice system and includes substance abuse treatment and may include cultural activities.)

title: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Sexual Harassment and Assault Prevention Act
sponsers: [Sen. Sullivan, Dan  [R-AK], Sen. Schatz, Brian [D-HI], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Nelson, Bill [D-FL], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Murkowski, Lisa [R-AK]]
texts: This bill requires the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) to develop policies on the prevention of and response to sexual harassment or assaults involving its employees, NOAA's commissioned officer corps, and individuals who work with or conduct business on behalf of NOAA. Those policies must include procedures for reporting incidents, including those occurring after-hours, at sea, or in remote locations.

title: A bill to require the Secretary of State to offer rewards of not less than $10,000,000 for information that leads to the arrest or conviction of suspects in connection with the bombing of Pan Am Flight 103.
sponsers: [Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], None, Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ]]
texts: NA

title: Security and Financial Empowerment Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Cantwell, Maria [D-WA], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Sanders, Bernard [I-VT], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD]]
texts: This bill amends the Violence Against Women Act to require the National Resource Center on Workplace Response provide information and assistance through domestic violence or sexual assault coalitions and survivor service organizations. These organizations and coalitions shall provide resource materials and assistance to employees, employers, and labor organizations to aid in efforts to develop adequate workplace responses to domestic and sexual violence.

title: Lawful Purpose and Self Defense Act
sponsers: [Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to modify the definition of "armor piercing ammunition" for purposes of federal firearms provisions to: (1) include a projectile that is designed and intended by the manufacturer or importer for use in a handgun (currently, a projectile that may be used in a handgun); (2) repeal the exclusion of a projectile that the Department of Justice (DOJ) finds is primarily intended for sporting purposes; and (3) exclude a projectile that is primarily intended by the manufacturer or importer to be used in a rifle or shotgun and a handgun projectile that is designed and intended by the manufacturer or importer to be used for hunting, recreational, or competitive shooting.

title: Veteran PEER Act
sponsers: [Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], None, Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT]]
texts: This bill directs the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to establish peer specialists in patient aligned care teams at VA medical centers to promote the use and integration of mental health services in a primary care setting.

title: Spectrum Relocation Fund Act of 2015
sponsers: [None, Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS]]
texts: This bill amends the National Telecommunications and Information Administration Organization Act to make amounts available from the Spectrum Relocation Fund (SRF) for the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) to pay federal entities for research and development activities to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their use of electromagnetic spectrum under government station licenses in order to make frequencies available for: (1) reallocation for nonfederal use, shared federal and nonfederal use, or a combination of such uses; and (2) auctions in accordance with such reallocation.

title: Real Time Transparency Act
sponsers: [Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Udall, Tom [D-NM], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to revise the requirement of a 48-hour notification of a campaign contribution of $1,000 or more to the Federal Election Commission (FEC) and certain other officials by the principal campaign committee of a candidate for federal office.

title: Background Check Completion Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Warren, Elizabeth [D-MA], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Hirono, Mazie K. [D-HI], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Menendez, Robert [D-NJ], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA]]
texts: This bill amends the federal criminal code to prohibit a licensed gun dealer from transferring a firearm to an unlicensed person prior to completion of a background check. (Current law permits a licensed gun dealer to transfer a firearm to an unlicensed person if a submitted background check remains incomplete after three business days.)

title: Cody Miller Patient Medication Information Act
sponsers: [Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], None, Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to direct the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to regulate the authorship, content, format, and dissemination of patient medication information for prescription drugs. (Patient medication information includes the instructional brochures provided to patients when a prescription is filled.)

title: No Bonuses for Tax Cheats Act
sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Thune, John [R-SD], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], None, Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC]]
texts: This bill prohibits the Department of the Treasury from providing any discretionary performance award to any employee of the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) with respect to whom there is substantial evidence of misconduct or a seriously delinquent tax debt. Treasury shall consider such a denial or withholding of a discretionary performance award as an action necessary to protect the integrity of the IRS, for purposes of any collective bargaining agreement.

title: Senior$afe Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Kirk, Mark Steven [R-IL], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Toomey, Pat [R-PA], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Hoeven, John [R-ND]]
texts: This bill provides that: (1) a supervisor, compliance officer, or legal advisor for a covered financial institution who has received training regarding the identification and reporting of the suspected exploitation of a senior citizen (at least 65 years old) shall not be liable for disclosing such exploitation to a covered agency if such individual made the disclosure in good faith and with reasonable care; and (2) a covered financial institution shall not be liable for such a disclosure by such an individual if such individual was employed by the institution at the time of the disclosure and the institution had provided such training.

title: Common Sense Nutrition Disclosure Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Scott, Tim [R-SC], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Heitkamp, Heidi [D-ND], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], None, Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO]]
texts: This bill amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to revise the nutritional information that restaurants and retail food establishments must disclose. The nutrient content disclosure statement on the menu or menu board must include: (1) the number of calories contained in the whole menu item; (2) the number of servings and number of calories per serving; or (3) the number of calories per common unit of the item, such as for a multi-serving item that is typically divided before presentation to the consumer. Nutritional information may be provided solely by a remote-access menu (e.g., an Internet menu) for food establishments where the majority of orders are placed by customers who are off-premises.

title: PHIT Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Rounds, Mike  [R-SD], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], None, Sen. Thune, John [R-SD]]
texts: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a medical care tax deduction for up to $1,000 ($2,000 for a joint return or a head of household) of qualified sports and fitness expenses. The bill defines "qualified sports and fitness expenses" as amounts paid exclusively for the sole purpose of participating in a physical activity, including: (1) for membership at a fitness facility, (2) for participation or instruction in physical exercise or activity, or (3) for equipment used in a program (including a self-directed program) of physical exercise or activity.

title: Outdoor Recreation Jobs and Economic Impact Act of 2016
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Gardner, Cory [R-CO], Sen. Daines, Steve [R-MT], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Murray, Patty [D-WA], Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS], Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Ernst, Joni  [R-IA]]
texts: This bill directs the Bureau of Economic Analysis of the Department of Commerce to assess and analyze the outdoor recreation economy of the United States and the effects attributable to it on the overall U.S. economy.

title: Healthy MOM Act
sponsers: [Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen. Markey, Edward J. [D-MA], Sen. Tester, Jon [D-MT], Sen. Heinrich, Martin [D-NM], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY], Sen. Kaine, Tim [D-VA], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Blumenthal, Richard [D-CT], Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], Sen. Peters, Gary C. [D-MI], Sen. Cardin, Benjamin L. [D-MD], Sen. Bennet, Michael F. [D-CO], Sen. Merkley, Jeff [D-OR], Sen. Boxer, Barbara [D-CA], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. McCaskill, Claire [D-MO], Sen. King, Angus S., Jr. [I-ME], None, Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act and Internal Revenue Code to require health insurers, health insurance exchanges, and group health plans to offer a special enrollment period to pregnant individuals. The special enrollment period offered by an insurer or exchange must begin when the pregnancy is reported to the insurer or exchange. The special enrollment period offered by a group health plan must begin when the pregnancy is reported to the plan or is confirmed by a health care provider.

title: Ensuring Access to Affordable and Quality Home Care for Seniors and People with Disabilities Act
sponsers: [Sen. Isakson, Johnny [R-GA], Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Fischer, Deb [R-NE], Sen. Flake, Jeff [R-AZ], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA], Sen. Coats, Daniel [R-IN], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], None, Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS]]
texts: This bill amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 with respect to the exemption from minimum wage and maximum hour requirements of domestic service employment to provide companionship services for individuals who because of age or infirmity are unable to care for themselves. Definitions of "companionship services" and "domestic service employment" are detailed. Excluded from companionship services are any relating to the care and protection of the aged or infirm which require and are performed by trained medical personnel.

title: Community College to Career Fund Act
sponsers: [Sen. Franken, Al [D-MN], Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH], Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE]]
texts: This bill amends the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act to direct the Department of Labor to award competitive grants to eligible community colleges, four-year public institutions of higher education, tribal colleges or universities, public or private nonprofit two-year institutions of higher education in specified U.S. territories, or a consortium of any of them, in partnership with employers or an employer or industry partnership representing multiple employers, in order to develop, offer, improve, and provide educational or career training programs for workers.

title: S. 2223, Black Hills National Cemetery Boundary Expansion Act
sponsers: [Sen. Enzi, Michael B. [R-WY], None, Sen. Thune, John [R-SD]]
texts: This bill transfers jurisdiction over certain public land from the Department of the Interior to the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) for inclusion in the Black Hills National Cemetery.

title: Child Poverty Reduction Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Casey, Robert P., Jr. [D-PA], Sen. Baldwin, Tammy [D-WI], Sen. Brown, Sherrod [D-OH]]
texts: This bill establishes in the Administration for Children and Families of the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) the Federal Interagency Working Group on Reducing Child Poverty.

title: Save Our Small and Seasonal Businesses Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Cassidy, Bill [R-LA], Sen. Warner, Mark R. [D-VA], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], None, Sen. Tillis, Thom [R-NC]]
texts: This bill amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to declare that, effective as if enacted on January 1, 2015, a returning H-2B visa alien (temporary nonagricultural worker) who has already been counted toward the applicable numerical limitation shall:

title: Improving Treatment for Pregnant and Postpartum Women Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN], Sen. Gillibrand, Kirsten E. [D-NY], Sen. Heller, Dean [R-NV], Sen. Collins, Susan M. [R-ME], Sen. Cochran, Thad [R-MS], Sen. Donnelly, Joe [D-IN], None, Sen. Ayotte, Kelly [R-NH]]
texts: This bill amends the Public Health Service Act to extend support for residential substance abuse treatment programs for pregnant and postpartum women through FY2020.

title: Private Spectrum Relocation Funding Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Manchin, Joe, III [D-WV], Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS]]

title: A bill to amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to permit review of certain Medicare payment determinations for disproportionate share hospitals, and for other purposes.
sponsers: [Sen. Grassley, Chuck [R-IA], Sen. Stabenow, Debbie [D-MI], Sen. Cornyn, John [R-TX], Sen. Schumer, Charles E. [D-NY]]
texts: NA

title: Veterans Scheduling Accountability Act
sponsers: [Sen. Shaheen, Jeanne [D-NH]]
texts: This bill directs the Government Accountability Office to conduct random, periodic audits of the medical facilities of the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) and the Veterans Integrated Service Networks to determine if they are in compliance with legal and VA standards requiring that veterans be provided timely access to VA health care.

title: Muslim Brotherhood Terrorist Designation Act of 2015
sponsers: [Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Hatch, Orrin G. [R-UT], Sen. Johnson, Ron [R-WI], Sen. Inhofe, James M. [R-OK], Sen. Roberts, Pat [R-KS], Sen. Moran, Jerry [R-KS], Sen. Perdue, David [R-GA], Sen. Sessions, Jeff [R-AL]]
texts: Expresses the sense of Congress that: (1) the Muslim Brotherhood has met the criteria for designation as a foreign terrorist organization, and (2) the Department of State should so designate it.

title: A bill to express the sense of Congress that the Government of the Maldives should immediately release former President Mohamed Nasheed from prison and release all other political prisoners in the country, as well as guarantee due process for and respect the human rights of all of the people of the Maldives.
sponsers: [Sen. Leahy, Patrick J. [D-VT], Sen. Durbin, Richard J. [D-IL], Sen. Murphy, Christopher [D-CT], Sen. McCain, John [R-AZ], Sen. Reed, Jack [D-RI], Sen. Whitehouse, Sheldon [D-RI], Sen. sponsers: [Sen. Barrasso, John [R-WY], Sen. Blunt, Roy [R-MO], Sen. Boozman, John [R-AR], Sen. Capito, Shelley Moore [R-WV], Sen. Crapo, Mike [R-ID], Sen. Cruz, Ted [R-TX], Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY]]
texts: This bill directs the Government Accountability Office to: (1) commence and complete an audit of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System and of the Federal Reserve Banks within 12 months of enactment of this Act, and (2) report findings and conclusions to Congress within 90 days of completing the audit.

title: A bill to amend section 3716 of title 31, United States Code, to reestablish the period of limitations for claims of the United States that may be collected by garnishing payments received from the Government.
sponsers: [Sen. Vitter, David [R-LA]]
texts: NA

sponsers: [Sen. Burr, Richard [R-NC], Sen. Feinstein, Dianne [D-CA], Sen. Wyden, Ron [D-OR], Sen. Cotton, Tom [R-AR], Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID], Sen. Mikulski, Barbara A. [D-MD], Sen.
